01-03.title: Alaska Becomes 49th State
01-03.description: On January 3, 1959, Alaska was admitted as the 49th state of the United States.

01-04.title: Utah Becomes 45th State
01-04.description: On January 4, 1896, Utah was admitted as the 45th state of the United States.

01-05.title: National Hockey League Formed
01-05.description: On January 5, 1917, the National Hockey League (NHL) was formed in Montreal, Canada.

01-06.title: Feast of the Epiphany
01-06.description: Traditionally celebrated on January 6, this Christian feast day commemorates the visit of the Magi to the infant Jesus.

01-07.title: First U.S. Presidential Election
01-07.description: On January 7, 1789, the first U.S. presidential election was held, with George Washington unanimously elected.

01-08.title: Battle of New Orleans
01-08.description: On January 8, 1815, American forces defeated the British in the Battle of New Orleans, the final major battle of the War of 1812.

01-09.title: Apple Macintosh Unveiled
01-09.description: On January 9, 1984, Apple Computer unveiled the Macintosh, the first successful mouse-driven computer with a graphical user interface.

01-10.title: League of Nations Founded
01-10.description: On January 10, 1920, the League of Nations was formally established with the ratification of the Treaty of Versailles.

01-11.title: Amelia Earhart's Solo Flight
01-11.description: On January 11, 1935, Amelia Earhart became the first person to fly solo from Hawaii to California.

01-12.title: Haiti Earthquake
01-12.description: On January 12, 2010, a devastating 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck Haiti, killing approximately 230,000 people.

01-13.title: Treaty of Cahuenga Signed
01-13.description: On January 13, 1847, the Treaty of Cahuenga ended fighting in California during the Mexican-American War.

01-14.title: Treaty of Paris Ratified
01-14.description: On January 14, 1784, the Continental Congress ratified the Treaty of Paris, officially ending the American Revolutionary War.

01-15.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Born
01-15.description: Martin Luther King Jr. was born on January 15, 1929, in Atlanta, Georgia.

01-16.title: Prohibition Begins in U.S.
01-16.description: On January 16, 1920, the 18th Amendment went into effect, beginning Prohibition in the United States.

01-17.title: Operation Desert Storm Begins
01-17.description: On January 17, 1991, Operation Desert Storm began with airstrikes against Iraq following its invasion of Kuwait.

01-18.title: Captain Cook Reaches Hawaii
01-18.description: On January 18, 1778, Captain James Cook became the first European to reach the Hawaiian Islands.

01-19.title: Japan Leaves League of Nations
01-19.description: On January 19, 1933, Japan announced its withdrawal from the League of Nations following criticism of its occupation of Manchuria.

01-21.title: Concorde's First Commercial Flights
01-21.description: On January 21, 1976, the Concorde began its first commercial flights to London and Paris simultaneously.

01-22.title: Queen Victoria Dies
01-22.description: On January 22, 1901, Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom died after a reign of 63 years, 7 months.

01-23.title: 24th Amendment Ratified
01-23.description: On January 23, 1964, the 24th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified, abolishing poll taxes.

01-24.title: California Gold Discovery
01-24.description: On January 24, 1848, James W. Marshall discovered gold at Sutter's Mill in California, sparking the California Gold Rush.

01-25.title: First Winter Olympics
01-25.description: On January 25, 1924, the first Winter Olympics opened in Chamonix, France.

01-26.title: Australia Day
01-26.description: On January 26, 1788, the First Fleet arrived at Port Jackson, establishing the first European settlement in Australia.

01-27.title: Auschwitz Liberated
01-27.description: On January 27, 1945, Soviet troops liberated the Auschwitz concentration camp in Poland.

01-28.title: Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster
01-28.description: On January 28, 1986, the Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds into its flight, killing all seven crew members.

01-29.title: Kansas Becomes 34th State
01-29.description: On January 29, 1861, Kansas was admitted as the 34th state of the United States.

01-30.title: Mahatma Gandhi Assassinated
01-30.description: On January 30, 1948, Mahatma Gandhi was assassinated by Nathuram Godse in New Delhi, India.

01-31.title: U.S. Enters Space Age
01-31.description: On January 31, 1958, the United States launched its first satellite, Explorer 1, into space.

02-01.title: Columbia Space Shuttle Disaster
02-01.description: On February 1, 2003, the Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated during re-entry, killing all seven crew members.

02-02.title: Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo
02-02.description: On February 2, 1848, the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo was signed, ending the Mexican-American War.

02-03.title: 16th Amendment Ratified
02-03.description: On February 3, 1913, the 16th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified, establishing federal income tax.

02-04.title: Facebook Launched
02-04.description: On February 4, 2004, Mark Zuckerberg launched Facebook from his Harvard dormitory room.

02-06.title: Queen Elizabeth II Ascends Throne
02-06.description: On February 6, 1952, Princess Elizabeth became Queen Elizabeth II following the death of her father, King George VI.

02-07.title: Great Fire of London
02-07.description: On February 7, 1812, a massive fire destroyed much of central London, though not as famous as the 1666 fire.

02-08.title: Mary, Queen of Scots Executed
02-08.description: On February 8, 1587, Mary, Queen of Scots was executed at Fotheringhay Castle in England.

02-10.title: Treaty of Paris Ends French and Indian War
02-10.description: On February 10, 1763, the Treaty of Paris was signed, ending the French and Indian War/Seven Years' War.

02-11.title: Nelson Mandela Released
02-11.description: On February 11, 1990, Nelson Mandela was released from prison after 27 years of incarceration in South Africa.

02-12.title: Abraham Lincoln's Birthday
02-12.description: Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, was born on February 12, 1809, in Kentucky.

02-13.title: Firebombing of Dresden
02-13.description: On February 13-15, 1945, Allied forces firebombed Dresden, Germany, resulting in massive destruction and civilian casualties.

02-14.title: Saint Valentine's Day Massacre
02-14.description: On February 14, 1929, seven members of Chicago's North Side Gang were murdered by associates of Al Capone.

02-16.title: Lithuania Declares Independence
02-16.description: On February 16, 1918, Lithuania declared its independence from Russia and Germany.

02-17.title: First Issue of Newsweek Published
02-17.description: On February 17, 1933, the first issue of Newsweek magazine was published.

02-18.title: Pluto Discovered
02-18.description: On February 18, 1930, Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto at Lowell Observatory in Flagstaff, Arizona.

02-19.title: Japanese American Internment Begins
02-19.description: On February 19, 1942, President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed Executive Order 9066, authorizing Japanese American internment.

02-20.title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
02-20.description: On February 20, 1962, John Glenn became the first American to orbit the Earth aboard Friendship 7.

02-21.title: Malcolm X Assassinated
02-21.description: On February 21, 1965, Malcolm X was assassinated while speaking at the Audubon Ballroom in New York City.

02-22.title: George Washington's Birthday
02-22.description: George Washington, the first President of the United States, was born on February 22, 1732, in Virginia.

02-23.title: Iwo Jima Flag Raising
02-23.description: On February 23, 1945, U.S. Marines raised the American flag on Mount Suribachi during the Battle of Iwo Jima.

02-24.title: Gulf War Ground Offensive Begins
02-24.description: On February 24, 1991, the ground offensive of Operation Desert Storm began in the Gulf War.

02-25.title: People Power Revolution in Philippines
02-25.description: On February 25, 1986, the People Power Revolution ousted Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos from power.

02-26.title: World Trade Center Bombing
02-26.description: On February 26, 1993, a truck bomb exploded in the underground garage of the World Trade Center in New York City.

02-27.title: Reichstag Fire
02-27.description: On February 27, 1933, the German parliament building (Reichstag) was set on fire, a key event in Nazi Germany's rise.

02-28.title: Television's First Commercial
02-28.description: On February 28, 1939, the first television commercial aired in the United States during a baseball game.

03-01.title: Yellowstone National Park Established
03-01.description: On March 1, 1872, Yellowstone became the world's first national park when President Ulysses S. Grant signed the act into law.

03-02.title: Texas Declares Independence
03-02.description: On March 2, 1836, Texas declared its independence from Mexico, forming the Republic of Texas.

03-03.title: Treaty of Brest-Litovsk Signed
03-03.description: On March 3, 1918, Russia signed the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk with the Central Powers, exiting World War I.

03-04.title: First Inauguration in Washington D.C.
03-04.description: On March 4, 1801, Thomas Jefferson became the first president to be inaugurated in Washington, D.C.

03-05.title: Boston Massacre
03-05.description: On March 5, 1770, British soldiers killed five colonists in what became known as the Boston Massacre.

03-06.title: Dred Scott Decision
03-06.description: On March 6, 1857, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled in Dred Scott v. Sandford that African Americans could not be citizens.

03-07.title: Bloody Sunday
03-07.description: On March 7, 1965, civil rights marchers were attacked by state troopers on the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Alabama.

03-08.title: International Women's Day
03-08.description: First celebrated on March 8, 1911, International Women's Day honors women's achievements and promotes gender equality.

03-09.title: USS Monitor vs. CSS Virginia
03-09.description: On March 9, 1862, the first battle between ironclad warships, the Monitor and the Virginia, took place during the Civil War.

03-10.title: First Successful Telephone Call
03-10.description: On March 10, 1876, Alexander Graham Bell made the first successful telephone call, saying 'Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you.'

03-11.title: Great Blizzard of 1888
03-11.description: On March 11-14, 1888, one of the most severe blizzards in American history struck the Northeast, causing massive disruption.

03-12.title: FDR's First Fireside Chat
03-12.description: On March 12, 1933, President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered his first 'fireside chat' radio address to the American people.

03-13.title: William Herschel Discovers Uranus
03-13.description: On March 13, 1781, astronomer William Herschel discovered the planet Uranus, the first planet discovered with a telescope.

03-15.title: Ides of March - Julius Caesar Assassinated
03-15.description: On March 15, 44 BC, Roman dictator Julius Caesar was assassinated by a group of senators led by Brutus and Cassius.

03-16.title: My Lai Massacre
03-16.description: On March 16, 1968, American soldiers killed between 347 and 504 unarmed Vietnamese civilians in the My Lai Massacre.

03-17.title: Evacuation Day in Boston
03-17.description: On March 17, 1776, British forces evacuated Boston during the American Revolutionary War, celebrated as Evacuation Day.

03-18.title: Tripartite Convention Signed
03-18.description: On March 18, 1889, the Tripartite Convention established the colonial division of the Samoan Islands between Germany and the U.S.

03-19.title: Iraq War Begins
03-19.description: On March 19, 2003, the United States and coalition forces invaded Iraq, beginning the Iraq War.

03-20.title: U.S. Invades Iraq (2003)
03-20.description: On March 20, 2003, the United States launched its invasion of Iraq with 'shock and awe' bombing campaign.

03-21.title: Sharpeville Massacre
03-21.description: On March 21, 1960, South African police opened fire on a crowd of black protesters in Sharpeville, killing 69 people.

03-22.title: Stamp Act Passed
03-22.description: On March 22, 1765, the British Parliament passed the Stamp Act, imposing a direct tax on the American colonies.

03-23.title: Patrick Henry's 'Give Me Liberty' Speech
03-23.description: On March 23, 1775, Patrick Henry delivered his famous 'Give me liberty or give me death!' speech in Virginia.

03-24.title: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill
03-24.description: On March 24, 1989, the oil tanker Exxon Valdez ran aground in Alaska's Prince William Sound, causing a massive environmental disaster.

03-25.title: Triangular Slave Trade Abolished
03-25.description: On March 25, 1807, the British Parliament passed the Slave Trade Act, abolishing the slave trade in the British Empire.

03-26.title: Bangladesh Independence Day
03-26.description: On March 26, 1971, Bangladesh declared its independence from Pakistan, beginning the Bangladesh Liberation War.

03-27.title: Alaska Earthquake
03-27.description: On March 27, 1964, the Good Friday earthquake struck Alaska, the most powerful earthquake recorded in North American history.

03-28.title: Three Mile Island Accident
03-28.description: On March 28, 1979, a partial nuclear meltdown occurred at the Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station in Pennsylvania.

03-29.title: Vietnam War Ends for U.S.
03-29.description: On March 29, 1973, the last U.S. combat troops left South Vietnam, ending direct American military involvement in the Vietnam War.

03-30.title: President Reagan Shot
03-30.description: On March 30, 1981, President Ronald Reagan was shot and wounded by John Hinckley Jr. outside a Washington, D.C. hotel.

03-31.title: Eiffel Tower Opens
03-31.description: On March 31, 1889, the Eiffel Tower was officially opened to the public during the Exposition Universelle in Paris.

04-01.title: Byzantine Emperor Justin I names his nephew Justinian
04-01.description: On April 1, 527, Byzantine Emperor Justin I names his nephew Justinian I as co-ruler and successor to the throne

04-01.title: Ruins of Pompeii 1748 The ruins of Pompeii are
04-01.description: On April 1, 1748, Ruins of Pompeii 1748 The ruins of Pompeii are rediscovered by Spaniard Roque Joaquín de Alcubierre

04-01.title: "Big Bang" theory proposed in scientific journal
04-01.description: On April 1, 1948, "Big Bang" theory proposed in scientific journal "Physical Review" by American cosmologists Ralph Alpher, Hans Bethe, and George Gamow

04-01.title: Ayatollah Khomeini calls for an Islamic Republic in
04-01.description: On April 1, 1974, Ayatollah Khomeini calls for an Islamic Republic in Iran

04-01.title: Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs found Apple Computer in
04-01.description: On April 1, 1976, Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs found Apple Computer in the garage of Jobs' parents house in Cupertino, California

04-01.title: The Netherlands becomes the first country in the world
04-01.description: On April 1, 2001, The Netherlands becomes the first country in the world to make same-sex marriage legal

04-02.title: Explorer Juan Ponce de León claims Florida for Spain
04-02.description: On April 2, 1513, Explorer Juan Ponce de León claims Florida for Spain as the first known European to reach it

04-02.title: The Coinage Act is passed
04-02.description: On April 2, 1792, The Coinage Act is passed, establishing the United States Mint and authorizing the $10 Eagle, $5 Half-Eagle, $2.50 Quarter-Eagle gold coins, and the silver dollar, half dollar, quarter, dime, and half-dime

04-02.title: Battle of Copenhagen 1801 Battle of Copenhagen :
04-02.description: On April 2, 1801, Battle of Copenhagen 1801 Battle of Copenhagen : British naval forces led by Horatio Nelson destroy the Danish fleet during the Napoleonic Wars

04-02.title: US President Woodrow Wilson asks Congress to declare
04-02.description: On April 2, 1917, US President Woodrow Wilson asks Congress to declare war against Germany

04-02.title: Ras Tafari Makonnen is proclaimed Emperor Haile
04-02.description: On April 2, 1930, Ras Tafari Makonnen is proclaimed Emperor Haile Selassie of Abyssinia (Ethiopia)

04-02.title: Several thousand Argentine troops invade and seize the
04-02.description: On April 2, 1982, Several thousand Argentine troops invade and seize the Falkland Islands from the United Kingdom

04-02.title: Record 6.6 million Americans file claims for
04-02.description: On April 2, 2020, Record 6.6 million Americans file claims for unemployment in the prior week according to the US Department of Labor, 10 million in the prior two weeks

04-02.title: US President Donald Trump announces "Liberation Day"
04-02.description: On April 2, 2025, US President Donald Trump announces "Liberation Day", unveiling wide-ranging tariffs on foreign countries importing into the US, including 34% on China and 20% for the European Union [1]

04-03.title: Battle of Navarrete 1367 Battle of Navarrete :
04-03.description: On April 3, 1367, Battle of Navarrete 1367 Battle of Navarrete : Alliance of King Peter of Castile, Edward the Black Prince and John of Gaunt of England, Aquitaine, Majorca and Navarre defeats Count Henry of Castile near Nájera in La Rioja, Castile

04-03.title: English Long Parliament passes the Self-Denying
04-03.description: On April 3, 1645, English Long Parliament passes the Self-Denying Ordinance, limiting regional armies, a significant step toward the New Model Army

04-03.title: Pony Express 1860 Start of the Pony Express
04-03.description: On April 3, 1860, Pony Express 1860 Start of the Pony Express, mail is delivered by horse and rider relay teams between St. Joseph, Missouri and Sacramento, California

04-03.title: Joseph Stalin is appointed General Secretary of the
04-03.description: On April 3, 1922, Joseph Stalin is appointed General Secretary of the Russian Communist Party by an ailing Vladimir Lenin

04-03.title: US President Harry Truman signs the Marshall Plan to
04-03.description: On April 3, 1948, US President Harry Truman signs the Marshall Plan to rebuild war-torn Western Europe after World War II, granting an initial $5 billion in aid to 16 European countries

04-03.title: First mobile phone call is made in downtown Manhattan
04-03.description: On April 3, 1973, First mobile phone call is made in downtown Manhattan, NY, by Motorola employee Martin Cooper to Bell Labs headquarters in New Jersey

04-03.title: Panama Papers are published - 11.5 million
04-03.description: On April 3, 2016, Panama Papers are published - 11.5 million confidential documents from offshore law firm Mossack Fonseca expose widespread illegal activities, including fraud, kleptocracy, tax evasion, and the violation of international sanctions by the world's elite in the largest data leak ever

04-04.title: Francis Drake is knighted by Queen Elizabeth I aboard
04-04.description: On April 4, 1581, Francis Drake is knighted by Queen Elizabeth I aboard his galleon, the "Golden Hind" at Deptford, England

04-04.title: English fleet defeats Barbary pirates in Tunis
04-04.description: On April 4, 1655, Battle of Porto Farina: English fleet defeats Barbary pirates in Tunis

04-04.title: First US Congress begins regular sessions during
04-04.description: On April 4, 1789, First US Congress begins regular sessions during George Washington 's presidency at Federal Hall, NYC (ends 1791)

04-04.title: The North Atlantic Treaty is signed in Washington
04-04.description: On April 4, 1949, The North Atlantic Treaty is signed in Washington, D.C., establishing the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), a military alliance between Western nations

04-04.title: Martin Luther King Shot Dead 1968 US civil rights
04-04.description: On April 4, 1968, Martin Luther King Shot Dead 1968 US civil rights activist Martin Luther King Jr. is assassinated by James Earl Ray at the Lorraine Hotel in Memphis, Tennessee

04-04.title: World Trade Center opens in New York as the world's
04-04.description: On April 4, 1973, World Trade Center opens in New York as the world's tallest building at 110 stories, later destroyed in the 9/11 terrorist attacks

04-04.title: Founding of Microsoft 1975 Microsoft is founded as a
04-04.description: On April 4, 1975, Founding of Microsoft 1975 Microsoft is founded as a partnership between Bill Gates and Paul Allen to develop and sell BASIC interpreters for the Altair 8800

04-05.title: Battle on the Ice: Russian Prince of Novgorod
04-05.description: On April 5, 1242, Battle on the Ice: Russian Prince of Novgorod Alexander Nevsky defeats the Teutonic Knights on the frozen Lake Peipus between Estonia and Russia

04-05.title: Easter Island Moai 1722 Dutch navigator Jacob
04-05.description: On April 5, 1722, Easter Island Moai 1722 Dutch navigator Jacob Roggeveen is the first European to discover Easter Island, also known as Rapa Nui, in the southeastern Pacific Ocean

04-05.title: Battle of Maipú: Chile's independence movement
04-05.description: On April 5, 1818, Battle of Maipú: Chile's independence movement, led by Bernardo O'Higgins and José de San Martín, wins a decisive victory over Spain, leaving 2,000 Spaniards and 1,000 Chilean patriots dead

04-05.title: First civic public park
04-05.description: On April 5, 1847, First civic public park, Birkenhead Park, designed by Joseph Paxton, opens in Birkenhead, England

04-05.title: Chile declares war on Bolivia and Peru
04-05.description: On April 5, 1879, Chile declares war on Bolivia and Peru, starting the War of the Pacific

04-06.title: BC Battle of Thapsus: Julius Caesar defeats Caecilius
04-06.description: On April 6, BC Battle of Thapsus: Julius Caesar defeats Caecilius Metellus Scipio and Marcus Porcius Cato (Cato the Younger) near Thapsus in modern-day Tunisia

04-06.title: Turkish forces under Sultan Mehmed II begin the siege
04-06.description: On April 6, 1453, Turkish forces under Sultan Mehmed II begin the siege of the Byzantine Empire's capital, Constantinople (now Istanbul), which falls on May 29

04-06.title: Cape Colony Founded 1652 Cape Colony
04-06.description: On April 6, 1652, Cape Colony Founded 1652 Cape Colony, the first European settlement in South Africa, is established by the Dutch East India Company under Jan van Riebeeck

04-06.title: The United States declares war on Germany and enters
04-06.description: On April 6, 1917, The United States declares war on Germany and enters World War I on the side of the Allies

04-06.title: Rwandan Genocide 1994 Plane carrying Rwandan President
04-06.description: On April 6, 1994, Rwandan Genocide 1994 Plane carrying Rwandan President Juvénal Habyarimana and Burundian President Cyprien Ntaryamira is shot down by surface-to-air missiles, abruptly ending peace negotiations and sparking the Rwandan Genocide . Those responsible have never been identified.

04-07.title: Scholars estimate for the crucifixion of Jesus by
04-07.description: On April 7, 30, Scholars estimate for the crucifixion of Jesus by Roman troops in Jerusalem [or April 3]

04-07.title: First draft of Corpus Juris Civilis or the Justinian
04-07.description: On April 7, 529, First draft of Corpus Juris Civilis or the Justinian Code (a fundamental work in jurisprudence) is issued by Eastern Roman Emperor Justinian I

04-07.title: World Health Organization is formed by the United
04-07.description: On April 7, 1948, World Health Organization is formed by the United Nations

04-07.title: US President Dwight D. Eisenhower
04-07.description: On April 7, 1954, US President Dwight D. Eisenhower, in a news conference, is the first to voice fear of a "domino effect" of communism in the Indochina region

04-07.title: Martin Luther King Assassination Riots 1968 Riots
04-07.description: On April 7, 1968, Martin Luther King Assassination Riots 1968 Riots continue in over 100 US cities following the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.

04-07.title: publication of RFC 1
04-07.description: On April 7, 1969, The Internet's symbolic birth date: publication of RFC 1

04-08.title: Ayutthaya Kingdom in present-day Thailand falls to
04-08.description: On April 8, 1767, Ayutthaya Kingdom in present-day Thailand falls to Burmese invaders

04-08.title: Venus de Milo 1820 The famous ancient Greek statue
04-08.description: On April 8, 1820, Venus de Milo 1820 The famous ancient Greek statue Venus de Milo is discovered on the Aegean island of Milos

04-08.title: William Gladstone introduces the first Irish Home Rule
04-08.description: On April 8, 1886, William Gladstone introduces the first Irish Home Rule Bill in the British House of Commons

04-08.title: Battle of Atbara River: Anglo-Egyptian forces defeat 15
04-08.description: On April 8, 1898, Battle of Atbara River: Anglo-Egyptian forces defeat 15,000 Sudanese during the Mahdist War, a turning point in the reconquest of Sudan

04-08.title: China's National Assembly opens in Peking
04-08.description: On April 8, 1913, China's National Assembly opens in Peking, the first free democratic parliament in Chinese history

04-08.title: Humanitarian Ceasefire Agreement on the Conflict in
04-08.description: On April 8, 2004, Humanitarian Ceasefire Agreement on the Conflict in Darfur is signed by the Sudanese government and two rebel groups, ending hostilities amid a 45-day ceasefire [1]

04-09.title: Edward V, aged 12, succeeds his father Edward IV as
04-09.description: On April 9, 1483, Edward V, aged 12, succeeds his father Edward IV as King of England. He is never crowned and disappears, presumed murdered, after being incarcerated in the Tower of London with his younger brother Richard (the "Princes in the Tower")

04-09.title: British mariner Robert Jenkins' ear is cut off by
04-09.description: On April 9, 1731, British mariner Robert Jenkins' ear is cut off by Spanish Guarde Costa in the Caribbean, catalyst for a later war between Britain and Spain

04-09.title: John Hancock refuses to allow two British customs
04-09.description: On April 9, 1768, John Hancock refuses to allow two British customs agents to go below deck of his ship, considered by some to be the first act of physical resistance to British authority in the colonies

04-09.title: Confederate General Robert E. Lee and 26
04-09.description: On April 9, 1865, Confederate General Robert E. Lee and 26,765 troops surrender at Appomattox Court House to U.S. Lieutenant General Ulysses S. Grant, ending the Civil War in Northern Virginia

04-09.title: Hudson's Bay Company cedes its territory to Canada
04-09.description: On April 9, 1869, Hudson's Bay Company cedes its territory to Canada

04-09.title: John Major is elected Prime Minister of the United
04-09.description: On April 9, 1992, John Major is elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom after his Conservative Party wins the most votes in British electoral history

04-09.title: Invasion of Iraq 2003 Baghdad falls to US forces
04-09.description: On April 9, 2003, Invasion of Iraq 2003 Baghdad falls to US forces, ending the invasion of Iraq, resulting in widespread looting

04-10.title: Lama Deshin Shekpa visits the Ming Dynasty capital at
04-10.description: On April 10, 1407, Lama Deshin Shekpa visits the Ming Dynasty capital at Nanjing and receives the title Great Treasure Prince of Dharma

04-10.title: Eruption of Mount Tambora 1815 Mount Tambora in the
04-10.description: On April 10, 1815, Eruption of Mount Tambora 1815 Mount Tambora in the Dutch East Indies experiences a cataclysmic eruption, one of the most powerful in history, killing around 71,000 people and causing a global volcanic winter

04-10.title: Big Ben, a 13.76-tonne bell, is recast at the
04-10.description: On April 10, 1858, Big Ben, a 13.76-tonne bell, is recast at the Whitechapel Bell Foundry

04-10.title: US, USSR and 70 other nations agree to ban biological
04-10.description: On April 10, 1972, US, USSR and 70 other nations agree to ban biological weapons at the Biological Weapons Convention

04-10.title: The Good Friday Agreement (Belfast Agreement) for
04-10.description: On April 10, 1998, The Good Friday Agreement (Belfast Agreement) for Northern Ireland is signed by the British and Irish governments

04-11.title: Battle of Ravenna 1512 Battle of Ravenna : French
04-11.description: On April 11, 1512, Battle of Ravenna 1512 Battle of Ravenna : French forces under Gaston de Foix defeat the Holy League in a major battle of the Italian Wars

04-11.title: Hostilities formally cease in the American
04-11.description: On April 11, 1783, Hostilities formally cease in the American Revolutionary War after the Continental Congress proclaims the "Cessation of Arms" against His Britannic Majesty [1]

04-11.title: Napoléon Bonaparte abdicates unconditionally and is
04-11.description: On April 11, 1814, Napoléon Bonaparte abdicates unconditionally and is exiled to the island of Elba in the Mediterranean

04-11.title: The Shogunate is abolished in Japan
04-11.description: On April 11, 1868, The Shogunate is abolished in Japan

04-11.title: Chartered Air India plane "Kashmir Princess" is bombed
04-11.description: On April 11, 1955, Chartered Air India plane "Kashmir Princess" is bombed and crashes into the South China Sea in a failed assassination attempt on Zhou Enlai by a Kuomintang secret agent

04-11.title: US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the 1968 Civil
04-11.description: On April 11, 1968, US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the 1968 Civil Rights Act

04-11.title: Tanzanian army captures Kampala
04-11.description: On April 11, 1979, Tanzanian army captures Kampala, the capital of Uganda forcing Ugandan dictator Idi Amin to flee into exile in Libya

04-11.title: Barack Obama and Raúl Castro meet in Panama
04-11.description: On April 11, 2015, Barack Obama and Raúl Castro meet in Panama, the first meeting of US and Cuban heads of state since the Cuban Revolution

04-11.title: Anti Omar al-Bashir Protest 2019 Sudanese President
04-11.description: On April 11, 2019, Anti Omar al-Bashir Protest 2019 Sudanese President Omar al-Bashir is overthrown and arrested by the army in Khartoum after 30 years in power following massive street protests

04-12.title: The Fourth Crusade occupies and plunders Constantinople
04-12.description: On April 12, 1204, The Fourth Crusade occupies and plunders Constantinople

04-12.title: First US colonists on the Pacific coast arrive at Cape
04-12.description: On April 12, 1811, First US colonists on the Pacific coast arrive at Cape Disappointment, Washington

04-12.title: Battle of Fort Sumter 1861 Fort Sumter in South
04-12.description: On April 12, 1861, Battle of Fort Sumter 1861 Fort Sumter in South Carolina is attacked by the Confederacy, beginning the American Civil War

04-12.title: Kuomintang leader Chiang Kai-shek begins a
04-12.description: On April 12, 1927, Kuomintang leader Chiang Kai-shek begins a counter-revolution by violently suppressing Communist groups

04-12.title: Launch of Vostok 1 1961 Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin
04-12.description: On April 12, 1961, Launch of Vostok 1 1961 Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human to travel into space and orbit Earth, aboard the Vostok 1 spacecraft

04-12.title: Ghana is the first country to approve a new vaccine
04-12.description: On April 12, 2023, Ghana is the first country to approve a new vaccine for malaria, Mosquirix (RTS,S), developed at Oxford University. It is the first major vaccine approved first in Africa. [1]

04-13.title: The Seventh Crusade is defeated in Egypt
04-13.description: On April 13, 1250, The Seventh Crusade is defeated in Egypt, and Louis IX of France is captured

04-13.title: Edict of Nantes grants political rights to French
04-13.description: On April 13, 1598, Edict of Nantes grants political rights to French Huguenots

04-13.title: Pony Express 1860 First Pony Express rider reaches
04-13.description: On April 13, 1860, Pony Express 1860 First Pony Express rider reaches Sacramento, California

04-13.title: Ethiopian Emperor Commits Suicide 1868 Abyssinian War
04-13.description: On April 13, 1868, Ethiopian Emperor Commits Suicide 1868 Abyssinian War ends as British and Indian troops capture Magdala and Ethiopian Emperor Tewodros II commits suicide

04-13.title: Apollo 13 announces
04-13.description: On April 13, 1970, Apollo 13 announces, "Okay, Houston, we've had a problem here" after a Beech-built oxygen tank exploded en route to the Moon

04-14.title: Assassination of Abraham Lincoln 1865 US President
04-14.description: On April 14, 1865, Assassination of Abraham Lincoln 1865 US President Abraham Lincoln is shot in the head by John Wilkes Booth at Ford's Theatre in Washington; he dies a day later

04-14.title: 40pm off Newfoundland and sinks in the early hours of
04-14.description: On April 14, 1912, The Titanic Sinks 1912 RMS Titanic, the world's largest ocean liner, hits an iceberg at 11:40pm off Newfoundland and sinks in the early hours of April 15

04-14.title: Dr. Harry Plotz isolates the bacteria that causes
04-14.description: On April 14, 1914, Dr. Harry Plotz isolates the bacteria that causes typhus fever at Mount Sinai Hospital in NYC

04-14.title: Black Sunday dust storm ravages the US Midwest
04-14.description: On April 14, 1935, Black Sunday dust storm ravages the US Midwest, leading to the region being named the "Dust Bowl"

04-14.title: The first Space Shuttle
04-14.description: On April 14, 1981, The first Space Shuttle, Columbia, returns to Earth after 2 days and 6 hours in space

04-14.title: The Human Genome Project is completed with 99% of the
04-14.description: On April 14, 2003, The Human Genome Project is completed with 99% of the human genome sequenced to an accuracy of 99.99%

04-15.title: Samuel Johnson 's "A Dictionary of the English
04-15.description: On April 15, 1755, Samuel Johnson 's "A Dictionary of the English Language" is published in London

04-15.title: Federal army of 75
04-15.description: On April 15, 1861, Federal army of 75,000 volunteers is mobilized by President Abraham Lincoln at the start of the American Civil War

04-15.title: First Impressionist art exhibition opens in Paris
04-15.description: On April 15, 1874, First Impressionist art exhibition opens in Paris, features Claude Monet, Edgar Degas, Pierre-Auguste Renoir, Camille Pissarro and Berthe Morisot

04-15.title: World's first home telephone is installed in Somerville
04-15.description: On April 15, 1877, World's first home telephone is installed in Somerville, Massachusetts at the house of Charles Williams Jr. [1]

04-15.title: Iceberg Sinks 'Unsinkable' Titanic 1912 RMS Titanic
04-15.description: On April 15, 1912, Iceberg Sinks 'Unsinkable' Titanic 1912 RMS Titanic sinks at 2:20 AM off Newfoundland as the band plays on, with the loss of between 1,490 and 1,635 lives

04-16.title: Battle of Megiddo 1457 BC Battle of Megiddo : Egyptian
04-16.description: On April 16, Battle of Megiddo 1457 BC Battle of Megiddo : Egyptian forces of Thutmose III defeat a large Canaanite coalition under the King of Kadesh. First battle recorded with a reliable account.

04-16.title: Queen Anne of England knights scientist Isaac Newton
04-16.description: On April 16, 1705, Queen Anne of England knights scientist Isaac Newton at Trinity College, Cambridge

04-16.title: Battle of Culloden: Royalist troops under the Duke of
04-16.description: On April 16, 1746, Battle of Culloden: Royalist troops under the Duke of Cumberland defeat the Jacobite army of Charles Edward Stuart in the final battle of the Jacobite Rising on British soil

04-16.title: US Post Office issues its first stamp booklets
04-16.description: On April 16, 1900, US Post Office issues its first stamp booklets containing 12, 24, or 48 two-cent stamps [1]

04-16.title: Organization for European Economic Cooperation (OEEC)
04-16.description: On April 16, 1948, Organization for European Economic Cooperation (OEEC) forms in Paris

04-16.title: Treaty of Accession signed
04-16.description: On April 16, 2003, Treaty of Accession is signed in Athens, admitting 10 new member states to the European Union

04-17.title: Christopher Columbus signs a contract with Spanish
04-17.description: On April 17, 1492, Christopher Columbus signs a contract with Spanish monarchs King Ferdinand II of Aragon and Queen Isabella I to find the "Indies" with the stated goal of converting people to Catholicism. This promises him 10% of all riches found and the governorship of any lands encountered.

04-17.title: Treaty of Shimonoseki signed
04-17.description: On April 17, 1895, Treaty of Shimonoseki is signed ending the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-95)

04-17.title: Vladimir Lenin issues his radical "April Theses"
04-17.description: On April 17, 1917, Vladimir Lenin issues his radical "April Theses" calling for Soviets to take power during the Russian Revolution [OS Apr 4]

04-17.title: 1,400 Cuban exiles land in the Bay of Pigs in a doomed
04-17.description: On April 17, 1961, 1,400 Cuban exiles land in the Bay of Pigs in a doomed attempt to overthrow Fidel Castro

04-17.title: Canadian Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau and Queen
04-17.description: On April 17, 1982, Canadian Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau and Queen Elizabeth II sign the "Proclamation of the Constitution Act", establishing the "Charter of Rights and Freedoms" as part of the country’s new Constitution

04-17.title: St. Cuthbert Gospel 2012 The 8th century St. Cuthbert
04-17.description: On April 17, 2012, St. Cuthbert Gospel 2012 The 8th century St. Cuthbert Gospel, Europe's oldest intact book, is purchased by the British Library for 9 million pounds

04-18.title: Bolesław I the Brave is crowned in Gniezno
04-18.description: On April 18, 1025, Bolesław I the Brave is crowned in Gniezno, becoming the first King of Poland

04-18.title: St. Peter's Basilica 1506 The cornerstone of the
04-18.description: On April 18, 1506, St. Peter's Basilica 1506 The cornerstone of the current St. Peter's Basilica is laid in the Vatican by Pope Julius II

04-18.title: Paul Revere, William Dawes and Samuel Prescott ride
04-18.description: On April 18, 1775, Paul Revere, William Dawes and Samuel Prescott ride from Charlestown to Lexington warning "the regulars are coming out!" [1]

04-18.title: George Washington issues General Orders announcing the
04-18.description: On April 18, 1783, George Washington issues General Orders announcing the end of hostilities with Britain in the American Revolutionary War, giving thanks to the Almighty, offering congratulations, and authorizing an extra ration of alcohol to the troops to celebrate [1]

04-18.title: San Francisco Earthquake of 1906 1906 San Francisco
04-18.description: On April 18, 1906, San Francisco Earthquake of 1906 1906 San Francisco earthquake and fire kills nearly 4,000 while destroying 75% of the city

04-18.title: Canonization of Joan of Arc 1909 Joan of Arc receives
04-18.description: On April 18, 1909, Canonization of Joan of Arc 1909 Joan of Arc receives beatification by the Roman Catholic Church at St. Peter's Basilica in the Vatican

04-18.title: Superman first appears in DC Comics' Action Comics
04-18.description: On April 18, 1938, Superman first appears in DC Comics' Action Comics Series Issue #1, dated June 1938

04-18.title: Egyptian Colonel Gamal Abdel Nasser seizes power and
04-18.description: On April 18, 1954, Egyptian Colonel Gamal Abdel Nasser seizes power and appoints himself Prime Minister

04-19.title: British explorer Captain James Cook first sights
04-19.description: On April 19, 1770, British explorer Captain James Cook first sights Australia. Writes in his log book that “what we have as yet seen of this land appears rather low, and not very hilly, the face of the Country green and Woody, but the Sea shore is all a white Sand.”

04-19.title: The Shot Heard Round the World 1775 American
04-19.description: On April 19, 1775, The Shot Heard Round the World 1775 American Revolution begins in Lexington, Massachusetts, with the " Shot Heard Round the World " fired later that day in Concord

04-19.title: Oklahoma City bombing: Timothy McVeigh sets a truck
04-19.description: On April 19, 1995, Oklahoma City bombing: Timothy McVeigh sets a truck bomb at Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building, killing 168. including 19 children, and injuring 500

04-19.title: Fidel Castro resigns his position of First Secretary
04-19.description: On April 19, 2011, Fidel Castro resigns his position of First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba after 45 years in power [1]

04-20.title: Winchester Round Table 1290 Round Table tournament
04-20.description: On April 20, 1290, Winchester Round Table 1290 Round Table tournament held near Winchester, England, in imitation of King Arthur, to commemorate betrothal of daughter of Edward I, and attended by the king

04-20.title: First pasteurization test is completed by Frenchmen
04-20.description: On April 20, 1862, First pasteurization test is completed by Frenchmen Louis Pasteur and Claude Bernard

04-20.title: Marie and Pierre Curie isolate the radioactive
04-20.description: On April 20, 1902, Marie and Pierre Curie isolate the radioactive compound radium chloride

04-20.title: British politician Enoch Powell makes his
04-20.description: On April 20, 1968, British politician Enoch Powell makes his controversial "Rivers of Blood" speech

04-20.title: Climax of the Berber Spring in Algeria sees hundreds
04-20.description: On April 20, 1980, Climax of the Berber Spring in Algeria sees hundreds of Berber political activists arrested

04-20.title: Columbine High School massacre: Eric Harris and Dylan
04-20.description: On April 20, 1999, Columbine High School massacre: Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold kill 13 people and injure 24 others before committing suicide at Columbine High School, Colorado

04-20.title: The Deepwater Horizon drilling rig explodes
04-20.description: On April 20, 2010, The Deepwater Horizon drilling rig explodes, killing 11 and causing the rig to sink, causing a massive oil discharge into the Gulf of Mexico and an environmental disaster

04-20.title: US House passes a bipartisan $95 billion foreign aid
04-20.description: On April 20, 2024, US House passes a bipartisan $95 billion foreign aid package for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan and a bill against TikTok [1]

04-21.title: BC Romulus and Remus found Rome (traditional date)
04-21.description: On April 21, BC Romulus and Remus found Rome (traditional date)

04-21.title: First Battle of Panipat 1526 First Battle of Panipat :
04-21.description: On April 21, 1526, First Battle of Panipat 1526 First Battle of Panipat : Central Asian conqueror Babur defeats Sultan Ibrahim Lodi, establishing the Mughal Empire in India

04-21.title: Brazilian revolutionary Tiradentes is hanged
04-21.description: On April 21, 1792, Brazilian revolutionary Tiradentes is hanged, drawn, and quartered in Rio de Janeiro

04-21.title: Bahá'u'lláh, founder of the Bahá'í Faith, enters the
04-21.description: On April 21, 1863, Bahá'u'lláh, founder of the Bahá'í Faith, enters the garden of Ridván near Baghdad. He makes his declaration as a Messenger of God during the 12 days he spends there.

04-21.title: German World War I fighter ace Baron Manfred von
04-21.description: On April 21, 1918, German World War I fighter ace Baron Manfred von Richthofen aka " The Red Baron," is shot down and killed over Vaux-sur Somme in France. Canadian pilot Arthur Roy Brown is credited with the kill.

04-21.title: Thousands of Chinese crowd into Beijing's Tiananmen
04-21.description: On April 21, 1989, Thousands of Chinese crowd into Beijing's Tiananmen Square, cheering for students demanding greater political freedom

04-22.title: Portuguese Discover Brazil 1500 Pedro Álvares Cabral
04-22.description: On April 22, 1500, Portuguese Discover Brazil 1500 Pedro Álvares Cabral is the first European to discover Brazil, landing near Monte Pascoal and claiming it for Portugal

04-22.title: First military use of poison gas occurs when Germany
04-22.description: On April 22, 1915, First military use of poison gas occurs when Germany uses chlorine gas against the Allies along the Western Front at Ypres, France in World War I [1]

04-22.title: Holocaust Memorial Museum dedicated in Washington, D.C.
04-22.description: On April 22, 1993, Holocaust Memorial Museum dedicated in Washington, D.C.

04-22.title: 7,000 Tutsi are slaughtered by Hutus in the stadium at
04-22.description: On April 22, 1994, 7,000 Tutsi are slaughtered by Hutus in the stadium at Kibuye, Rwanda

04-22.title: Nepalese security forces open fire on pro-democracy
04-22.description: On April 22, 2006, Nepalese security forces open fire on pro-democracy protesters demonstrating against King Gyanendra, injuring hundreds. The protesters secure the restoration of parliament and a federal state

04-22.title: Paris Agreement on climate change is signed in New York
04-22.description: On April 22, 2016, Paris Agreement on climate change is signed in New York, binding 195 nations to limit the increase in the global average temperature to less than 2°C above pre-industrial levels and to pursue efforts to limit the increase to 1.5°C

04-23.title: BC A temple dedicated to Venus Erycina is built on
04-23.description: On April 23, BC A temple dedicated to Venus Erycina is built on Capitoline Hill to commemorate the Roman defeat at Lake Trasimene

04-23.title: Battle of Clontarf 1014 King Brian Boru of Ireland
04-23.description: On April 23, 1014, Battle of Clontarf 1014 King Brian Boru of Ireland defeats Viking forces at the Battle of Clontarf, freeing Ireland from foreign control

04-23.title: William Shakespeare 's "The Merry Wives of Windsor" is
04-23.description: On April 23, 1597, William Shakespeare 's "The Merry Wives of Windsor" is first performed with Queen Elizabeth I of England in attendance

04-23.title: Robert E. Lee is named commander of Virginia's
04-23.description: On April 23, 1861, Robert E. Lee is named commander of Virginia's Confederate forces (US Civil War)

04-23.title: First decimal coins issued in Britain
04-23.description: On April 23, 1968, First decimal coins issued in Britain, the 5 and 10 new pence, replacing the shilling and two-shilling pieces

04-23.title: AIDS virus is identified as HTLV-III
04-23.description: On April 23, 1984, AIDS virus is identified as HTLV-III (Human T-lymphotropic Virus Type III)

04-24.title: BC The Greeks enter Troy using the Trojan Horse
04-24.description: On April 24, BC The Greeks enter Troy using the Trojan Horse (traditional date)

04-24.title: Russia declares war on the Ottoman Empire
04-24.description: On April 24, 1877, Russo-Turkish War: Russia declares war on the Ottoman Empire

04-24.title: Spain declares war after rejecting US ultimatum to
04-24.description: On April 24, 1898, Spain Declares War Against the United States 1898 Spanish–American War : Spain declares war after rejecting US ultimatum to withdraw from Cuba

04-24.title: Easter Proclamation of 1916 1916 Easter Rising of
04-24.description: On April 24, 1916, Easter Proclamation of 1916 1916 Easter Rising of Irish republicans against British occupation begins in Dublin

04-24.title: American General William Westmoreland says in a
04-24.description: On April 24, 1967, American General William Westmoreland says in a Vietnam War news conference that the enemy has "gained support in the United States that gives him hope that he can win politically that which he cannot win militarily"

04-24.title: India surpasses China as the worlds most populous
04-24.description: On April 24, 2023, India surpasses China as the worlds most populous country according to UN estimates, with 1,425,775,850 people (estimated to reach 1.7 billion by 2064) [1]

04-25.title: English Convention Parliament meets and votes to
04-25.description: On April 25, 1660, English Convention Parliament meets and votes to restore Charles II

04-25.title: Guillotine first used in France
04-25.description: On April 25, 1792, Guillotine first used in France, executes highwayman Nicolas Pelletier

04-25.title: Thornton Affair: Open conflict begins over the
04-25.description: On April 25, 1846, Thornton Affair: Open conflict begins over the disputed border of Texas, triggering the Mexican–American War

04-25.title: Gallipoli: Guts, Glory and Defeat 1915 First landings
04-25.description: On April 25, 1915, Gallipoli: Guts, Glory and Defeat 1915 First landings at Gaba Tepe and Cape Helles on the Gallipoli Peninsula by ANZAC forces during World War I

04-25.title: San Remo conference establishes three League of
04-25.description: On April 25, 1920, San Remo conference establishes three League of Nations mandates: a French mandate for Syria, and British mandates for Mesopotamia and Palestine with effect to the terms of the Balfour Declaration

04-25.title: "Elbe Day" - US and Soviet forces meet at Torgau
04-25.description: On April 25, 1945, "Elbe Day" - US and Soviet forces meet at Torgau, Germany on the Elbe River during the invasion of Germany in World War II

04-25.title: Francis Crick and James Watson 's discovery of the
04-25.description: On April 25, 1953, Francis Crick and James Watson 's discovery of the double helix structure of DNA is published in "Nature" magazine

04-25.title: First Solar Battery 1954 Bell Labs announces the first
04-25.description: On April 25, 1954, First Solar Battery 1954 Bell Labs announces the first solar battery made from silicon with about 6% efficiency

04-25.title: Hubble space telescope is placed into orbit by space
04-25.description: On April 25, 1990, Hubble space telescope is placed into orbit by space shuttle Discovery

04-26.title: Pazzi conspirators attack Lorenzo de' Medici and kill
04-26.description: On April 26, 1478, Pazzi conspirators attack Lorenzo de' Medici and kill Giuliano de' Medici in Florence

04-26.title: Harlow Shapley and Heber D. Curtis hold the "Great
04-26.description: On April 26, 1920, Harlow Shapley and Heber D. Curtis hold the "Great Debate" on the nature of nebulae, galaxies, and the size of the universe at the US National Academy of Sciences, Washington, D.C.

04-26.title: Marshal Philippe Pétain
04-26.description: On April 26, 1945, Marshal Philippe Pétain, leader of France's Vichy collaborationist regime during World War II, is arrested for treason

04-26.title: First modern container ship
04-26.description: On April 26, 1956, First modern container ship, the Ideal X, leaves Port Newark, New Jersey for Houston, Texas

04-26.title: Pripyat: Nuclear Wasteland 1986 The world's worst
04-26.description: On April 26, 1986, Pripyat: Nuclear Wasteland 1986 The world's worst nuclear disaster occurs when the fourth reactor at the Chernobyl nuclear power station in the Soviet Union explodes, resulting in 31 deaths and radioactive contamination spreading to much of Western Europe

04-26.title: Under international pressure
04-26.description: On April 26, 2005, Under international pressure, Syria withdraws the last of its 14,000 troops from Lebanon, ending its 29-year military domination of the country

04-27.title: First Spanish settlement in the Philippines is founded
04-27.description: On April 27, 1565, First Spanish settlement in the Philippines is founded in Cebu City

04-27.title: Steamboat "SS Sultana" explodes in the Mississippi
04-27.description: On April 27, 1865, Steamboat "SS Sultana" explodes in the Mississippi River, killing up to 1,800 of the 2,427 passengers in the greatest maritime disaster in United States history; most are paroled Union POWs on their way home.

04-27.title: First Labour Government 1904 The Australian Labor
04-27.description: On April 27, 1904, First Labour Government 1904 The Australian Labor Party under Prime Minister Chris Watson becomes the first Labor government in the world

04-27.title: Italian partisans capture Benito Mussolini in Dongo
04-27.description: On April 27, 1945, Italian partisans capture Benito Mussolini in Dongo, near Lake Como

04-27.title: The superjumbo jet aircraft Airbus A380 makes its
04-27.description: On April 27, 2005, The superjumbo jet aircraft Airbus A380 makes its first flight from Toulouse, France

04-28.title: Establishment of the Pontifical and Royal University
04-28.description: On April 28, 1611, Establishment of the Pontifical and Royal University of Santo Tomas, the Catholic University of the Philippines, the oldest existing university in Asia and the largest Catholic university in the world

04-28.title: British Captain James Cook
04-28.description: On April 28, 1770, British Captain James Cook, aboard HMS Endeavour, first lands in Australia at Botany Bay

04-28.title: Mutiny on the Bounty 1789 Fletcher Christian leads a
04-28.description: On April 28, 1789, Mutiny on the Bounty 1789 Fletcher Christian leads a mutiny on HMS Bounty against its captain William Bligh in the South Pacific

04-28.title: First night air flight by Claude Grahame-White takes
04-28.description: On April 28, 1910, First night air flight by Claude Grahame-White takes place in England

04-28.title: First commercial flight across the Pacific is operated
04-28.description: On April 28, 1937, First commercial flight across the Pacific is operated by Pan Am

04-28.title: Andreas Baader and members of the terrorist group Red
04-28.description: On April 28, 1977, Andreas Baader and members of the terrorist group Red Army Faction (Baader-Meinhof Gang) are jailed for life after a trial lasting nearly two years in Stuttgart, Germany

04-29.title: Battle of Gate Pā 1864 Battle of Gate Pā
04-29.description: On April 29, 1864, Battle of Gate Pā 1864 Battle of Gate Pā (Pukehinahina): 1,700 British troops suffer their worst defeat of the New Zealand Wars at the hands of 230 entrenched Māori warriors in Tauranga [1]

04-29.title: Jesse James ' gang robs a bank of $1
04-29.description: On April 29, 1872, Jesse James ' gang robs a bank of $1,500 in Columbia, Kentucky, killing bank employee Robert A.C. Martin during the crime

04-29.title: Easter Proclamation of 1916 1916 Irish republicans
04-29.description: On April 29, 1916, Easter Proclamation of 1916 1916 Irish republicans abandon the post office in Dublin and surrender unconditionally, ending the Easter Rising

04-29.title: US Army liberates 31
04-29.description: On April 29, 1945, US Army liberates 31,601 people from the Dachau Nazi concentration camp in Germany

04-29.title: The Fall of Saigon 1975 US begins to evacuate its
04-29.description: On April 29, 1975, The Fall of Saigon 1975 US begins to evacuate its citizens from Saigon in Operation Frequent Wind in response to advancing North Vietnamese forces, bringing an end to US involvement in the Vietnam War

04-29.title: Wrecking cranes begin tearing down the Berlin Wall at
04-29.description: On April 29, 1990, Wrecking cranes begin tearing down the Berlin Wall at the Brandenburg Gate

04-29.title: Cyclone strikes the Chittagong district in Bangladesh
04-29.description: On April 29, 1991, Cyclone strikes the Chittagong district in Bangladesh, killing 139,000 people and leaving 10 million homeless

04-29.title: Chemical Weapons Convention of 1993 comes into force
04-29.description: On April 29, 1997, Chemical Weapons Convention of 1993 comes into force, outlawing the production, stockpiling, and use of chemical weapons among its signatories

04-30.title: Roman Emperor Galerius issues the Edict of Toleration
04-30.description: On April 30, 311, Roman Emperor Galerius issues the Edict of Toleration, ending the persecution of Christians in the Roman Empire

04-30.title: Islamic conquest of Iberia: Moorish troops led by
04-30.description: On April 30, 711, Islamic conquest of Iberia: Moorish troops led by Tariq ibn Ziyad land at Gibraltar to begin their invasion of the Iberian Peninsula (Al-Andalus)

04-30.title: Jean Ribault and colonists arrive in Florida
04-30.description: On April 30, 1562, Jean Ribault and colonists arrive in Florida, the first French colonists in North America

04-30.title: George Washington's Inauguration 1789 George
04-30.description: On April 30, 1789, George Washington's Inauguration 1789 George Washington is inaugurated as the first President of the United States of America at Federal Hall in NYC

04-30.title: Charles Dickens ' "A Tale of Two Cities" is first
04-30.description: On April 30, 1859, Charles Dickens ' "A Tale of Two Cities" is first published in the literary periodical "All the Year Round" in weekly installments until November 26

04-30.title: Chrysler automobile company files for Chapter 11
04-30.description: On April 30, 2009, Chrysler automobile company files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy

05-01.title: Acts of Union come into force
05-01.description: On May 1, 1707, Acts of Union come into force, uniting England and Scotland to form the Kingdom of Great Britain

05-01.title: Publication of "Species Plantarum" by Carl Linnaeus -
05-01.description: On May 1, 1753, Publication of "Species Plantarum" by Carl Linnaeus - the formal start date of plant taxonomy adopted by the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature

05-01.title: Penny Black 1840 " Penny Black
05-01.description: On May 1, 1840, Penny Black 1840 " Penny Black," the world's first adhesive postage stamp is issued by the United Kingdom

05-01.title: Nationwide demonstrations and strikes demanding an
05-01.description: On May 1, 1886, Nationwide demonstrations and strikes demanding an 8-hour workday begin in the US

05-01.title: German automobile manufacturers
05-01.description: On May 1, 1924, German automobile manufacturers Daimler-Motoren-Gesellschaft and Benz & Cie begin their first joint venture, later merging into Mercedes-Benz

05-01.title: Empire State Building opens in New York City as the
05-01.description: On May 1, 1931, Empire State Building opens in New York City as the world's tallest building until the World Trade Center surpasses it in 1970

05-02.title: Raising a Flag over the Reichstag 1945 Battle of
05-02.description: On May 2, 1945, Raising a Flag over the Reichstag 1945 Battle of Berlin ends as the Soviet army storms the capital, forcing German commander of the city, General Helmuth Weidling, to surrender

05-02.title: More than 1,000,000 German soldiers officially
05-02.description: On May 2, 1945, More than 1,000,000 German soldiers officially surrender to the Western Allies in Italy and Austria

05-02.title: Arthur Miller wins a Pulitzer Prize for his play
05-02.description: On May 2, 1949, Arthur Miller wins a Pulitzer Prize for his play "Death of a Salesman"

05-02.title: Argentine cruiser General Belgrano is sunk by British
05-02.description: On May 2, 1982, Argentine cruiser General Belgrano is sunk by British submarine HMS Conqueror with the loss of more than 350 men during the Falklands War

05-02.title: Cyclone Nargis makes landfall in Myanmar
05-02.description: On May 2, 2008, Cyclone Nargis makes landfall in Myanmar, killing over 130,000 people and leaving millions homeless

05-02.title: Osama bin Laden, the suspected mastermind behind the
05-02.description: On May 2, 2011, Osama bin Laden, the suspected mastermind behind the September 11 attacks and the FBI's most wanted man, is killed by US special forces in Abbottabad, Pakistan

05-03.title: Constitution of May 3 is proclaimed by the Great Sejm
05-03.description: On May 3, 1791, Constitution of May 3 is proclaimed by the Great Sejm (Parliament) of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, the first modern constitution in Europe

05-03.title: The Third of May 1808 1808 Day depicted by Spanish
05-03.description: On May 3, 1808, The Third of May 1808 1808 Day depicted by Spanish painter Francisco Goya in his " The Third of May," which he paints in 1814

05-03.title: Volunteers Help Defeat General Strike 1926 Britain's
05-03.description: On May 3, 1926, Volunteers Help Defeat General Strike 1926 Britain's Trade Union Congress calls for the country's first-ever general strike, begins at 1 minute to midnight in support of striking coal miners and lasts 9 days

05-03.title: Margaret Mitchell wins the Pulitzer Prize for her
05-03.description: On May 3, 1937, Margaret Mitchell wins the Pulitzer Prize for her novel "Gone with the Wind"

05-03.title: German ocean liner SS Cap Arcona
05-03.description: On May 3, 1945, German ocean liner SS Cap Arcona, laden with prisoners, is sunk by the Royal Air Force in the western Baltic Sea, killing 5,800 people in one of the largest maritime losses of life in World War II

05-03.title: Japan's post-war constitution goes into effect
05-03.description: On May 3, 1947, Japan's post-war constitution goes into effect, granting universal suffrage, stripping Emperor Hirohito of all but symbolic power and outlawing Japan's right to make war

05-04.title: Battle of Tewkesbury 1471 Battle of Tewkesbury
05-04.description: On May 4, 1471, Battle of Tewkesbury 1471 Battle of Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire: Final battle between the Houses of Lancaster and York sees Prince of Wales, Edward of Westminster, killed and King Edward IV return to his throne, restoring political stability to England until his death in 1483

05-04.title: Spanish Pope Alexander VI decrees in the papal bull
05-04.description: On May 4, 1493, Spanish Pope Alexander VI decrees in the papal bull "Inter caetera" that all lands west of a line 100 leagues west of any of the islands of the Azores or the Cape Verde Islands belong to Castile, ultimately dividing the Americas between Spain and Portugal

05-04.title: King Ferdinand VII of Spain signs the Decree of the
05-04.description: On May 4, 1814, King Ferdinand VII of Spain signs the Decree of the 4th of May, returning Spain to absolutism

05-04.title: United States begins construction of the Panama Canal
05-04.description: On May 4, 1904, United States begins construction of the Panama Canal

05-04.title: Margaret Thatcher becomes the first woman to be
05-04.description: On May 4, 1979, Margaret Thatcher becomes the first woman to be elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

05-05.title: Kublai Khan, grandson of Genghis Khan, becomes ruler
05-05.description: On May 5, 1260, Kublai Khan, grandson of Genghis Khan, becomes ruler of the Mongol Empire

05-05.title: Panic of 1893 1893 Panic of 1893 causes a large crash
05-05.description: On May 5, 1893, Panic of 1893 1893 Panic of 1893 causes a large crash on the NY Stock Exchange

05-05.title: Ethiopian Emperor Haile Selassie returns triumphantly
05-05.description: On May 5, 1941, Ethiopian Emperor Haile Selassie returns triumphantly to Addis Ababa

05-05.title: West Germany is granted full sovereignty by its three
05-05.description: On May 5, 1955, West Germany is granted full sovereignty by its three occupying powers

05-05.title: First large-scale US Army ground units arrive in South
05-05.description: On May 5, 1965, First large-scale US Army ground units arrive in South Vietnam

05-05.title: Siege at Iranian Embassy in London ends when the SAS
05-05.description: On May 5, 1980, Siege at Iranian Embassy in London ends when the SAS and police storm the building

05-05.title: After 66 days on hunger strike
05-05.description: On May 5, 1981, After 66 days on hunger strike, 26-year-old Provisional IRA member and British MP Bobby Sands dies in Prison Maze. Nine more hunger strikers die in the next 3 months.

05-06.title: Spanish and German Imperial troops sack Rome
05-06.description: On May 6, 1527, Spanish and German Imperial troops sack Rome, ending the Renaissance. Charles III, Duke of Bourbon is killed in the assault removing any restraint for the victorious soldiers.

05-06.title: Dutch colonist Peter Minuit organizes the purchase of
05-06.description: On May 6, 1626, Dutch colonist Peter Minuit organizes the purchase of Manhattan Island from Native Americans for 60 guilders worth of goods, believed to be the Canarsee Indians of the Lenape

05-06.title: Eiffel Tower Opens 1889 Exposition Universelle
05-06.description: On May 6, 1889, Eiffel Tower Opens 1889 Exposition Universelle (World's Fair) in Paris opens with the recently completed Eiffel Tower serving as the entrance arch; the lifts in the tower are not ready, so intrepid visitors have to climb 1,710 steps to reach the top

05-06.title: Hindenburg Disaster 1937 German airship Hindenburg
05-06.description: On May 6, 1937, Hindenburg Disaster 1937 German airship Hindenburg explodes in flames at Lakehurst, New Jersey, killing 35 of the 97 on board and one on the ground

05-06.title: Joseph Stalin becomes Premier of the Soviet Union
05-06.description: On May 6, 1941, Joseph Stalin becomes Premier of the Soviet Union, replacing Foreign Minister Vyacheslav Molotov

05-07.title: English siege of Orleans broken by Joan of Arc and the
05-07.description: On May 7, 1429, English siege of Orleans broken by Joan of Arc and the French army

05-07.title: Nobel's Dynamite 1867 Swedish chemist Alfred Nobel
05-07.description: On May 7, 1867, Nobel's Dynamite 1867 Swedish chemist Alfred Nobel patents dynamite in England, the first of three patents he receives for the explosive material

05-07.title: Columbia University approves plans to award the
05-07.description: On May 7, 1912, Columbia University approves plans to award the Pulitzer Prize in several categories, after establishment by Joseph Pulitzer

05-07.title: Hero Millionaire Saves Lusitania Children 1915 RMS
05-07.description: On May 7, 1915, Hero Millionaire Saves Lusitania Children 1915 RMS Lusitania is sunk by a German submarine off the southern coast of Ireland, with 1,198 lives lost

05-07.title: Nazi Germany Surrenders 1945 German Third Reich
05-07.description: On May 7, 1945, Nazi Germany Surrenders 1945 German Third Reich General Alfred Jodl signs documents of surrender to the Allies at Reims, France; Soviet Union refuses to recognize it

05-07.title: The concept of the integrated circuit
05-07.description: On May 7, 1952, The concept of the integrated circuit, the basis for all modern computers, is first published by Geoffrey Dummer

05-07.title: Emmanuel Macron wins France's presidential election
05-07.description: On May 7, 2017, Emmanuel Macron wins France's presidential election, defeating Marine Le Pen

05-08.title: English Parliament proclaims Charles II King of
05-08.description: On May 8, 1660, English Parliament proclaims Charles II King of England and invites him to return

05-08.title: First installment of Hans Christian Andersen 's "Fairy
05-08.description: On May 8, 1835, First installment of Hans Christian Andersen 's "Fairy Tales" is published by C. A. Reitzel in Copenhagen, Denmark

05-08.title: China cedes Taiwan to Japan under the Treaty of
05-08.description: On May 8, 1895, China cedes Taiwan to Japan under the Treaty of Shimonoseki

05-08.title: Mount Pelée on the French overseas island of
05-08.description: On May 8, 1902, Mount Pelée on the French overseas island of Martinique erupts, wiping out the city of Saint-Pierre, killing 30,000 people and leaving only two survivors

05-08.title: Nazi Germany Surrenders 1945 V-E Day: World War II
05-08.description: On May 8, 1945, Nazi Germany Surrenders 1945 V-E Day: World War II ends in Europe after Germany's General Wilhelm Keitel formally signs unconditional surrender to the Allies represented by the United States, the UK, France and the Soviet Union in Berlin, Germany signs an unconditional surrender

05-08.title: World Health Organization announces smallpox has been
05-08.description: On May 8, 1980, World Health Organization announces smallpox has been eradicated

05-08.title: A new Northern Ireland Executive is formed with Ian
05-08.description: On May 8, 2007, A new Northern Ireland Executive is formed with Ian Paisley (Democratic Unionist Party) as First Minister and Martin McGuinness (Sinn Féin) as Deputy First Minister

05-08.title: Cardinal Robert Prevost (69) is elected as the 267th
05-08.description: On May 8, 2025, Cardinal Robert Prevost (69) is elected as the 267th pope of the Catholic church, the first American to hold the office takes the name of Pope Leo XIV [1]

05-09.title: World's Oldest Treaty 1386 Treaty of Windsor between
05-09.description: On May 9, 1386, World's Oldest Treaty 1386 Treaty of Windsor between Portugal and England is ratified at Windsor, cementing and strengthening ties between the two kingdoms. The treaty guarantees the mutual security of both nations and strengthens commercial ties. It is the oldest diplomatic alliance still in force. [1]

05-09.title: President Andrew Johnson issues a proclamation
05-09.description: On May 9, 1865, President Andrew Johnson issues a proclamation declaring that armed resistance in the South is virtually at an end, the commonly accepted end date of the American Civil War

05-09.title: First Australian Parliament 1901 First Australian
05-09.description: On May 9, 1901, First Australian Parliament 1901 First Australian Parliament opens in Melbourne, though the first working session is not until May 21

05-09.title: Soviet Union celebrates Victory Day in World War II
05-09.description: On May 9, 1945, Soviet Union celebrates Victory Day in World War II

05-09.title: United States becomes the first country to legalize
05-09.description: On May 9, 1960, United States becomes the first country to legalize the birth control pill

05-10.title: Italian navigator Amerigo Vespucci leaves for his
05-10.description: On May 10, 1497, Italian navigator Amerigo Vespucci leaves for his first voyage to the New World (disputed)

05-10.title: Second Continental Congress convenes in Philadelphia
05-10.description: On May 10, 1775, Second Continental Congress convenes in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, issuing paper currency for the first time

05-10.title: First Barbary War: The Barbary pirates of Tripoli
05-10.description: On May 10, 1801, First Barbary War: The Barbary pirates of Tripoli declare war on the United States of America (first US foreign war)

05-10.title: The Indian Mutiny 1857 Indian Mutiny against rule by
05-10.description: On May 10, 1857, The Indian Mutiny 1857 Indian Mutiny against rule by the British East India Company begins with the revolt of the Sepoy soldiers in Meerut

05-10.title: The Golden Spike 1869 The Golden Spike is driven
05-10.description: On May 10, 1869, The Golden Spike 1869 The Golden Spike is driven, completing the first US Transcontinental Railroad at Promontory Summit, Utah, connecting the Central Pacific Railroad with the Union Pacific

05-10.title: Winston Churchill succeeds Neville Chamberlain as
05-10.description: On May 10, 1940, Winston Churchill succeeds Neville Chamberlain as British Prime Minister at the head of a coalition government

05-10.title: US atomic submarine USS Triton completes first
05-10.description: On May 10, 1960, US atomic submarine USS Triton completes first submerged circumnavigation of the globe

05-10.title: Nelson Mandela is sworn in as South Africa's first
05-10.description: On May 10, 1994, Nelson Mandela is sworn in as South Africa's first Black president

05-11.title: Newly built city of Constantinople (Byzantium)
05-11.description: On May 11, 330, Newly built city of Constantinople (Byzantium) dedicated to Emperor Constantine the Great, becomes the capital of the Eastern Roman Empire

05-11.title: Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I Barbarossa and 100
05-11.description: On May 11, 1189, Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I Barbarossa and 100,000 crusaders depart Regensburg for the Third Crusade

05-11.title: Pennsylvania Hospital founded by Dr. Thomas Bond and
05-11.description: On May 11, 1751, Pennsylvania Hospital founded by Dr. Thomas Bond and Benjamin Franklin, in Philadelphia

05-11.title: Assassination of Spencer Perceval 1812 British Prime
05-11.description: On May 11, 1812, Assassination of Spencer Perceval 1812 British Prime Minister Spencer Perceval is assassinated by John Bellingham in the lobby of the House of Commons, London. Ironically, descendants of both later stand for the same seat in Parliament at the same time, but neither wins

05-11.title: Great dust bowl storm sweeps across the American and
05-11.description: On May 11, 1934, Great dust bowl storm sweeps across the American and Canadian prairies traveling as far as the East Coast

05-11.title: More than 170 countries agree to extend the Nuclear
05-11.description: On May 11, 1995, More than 170 countries agree to extend the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty indefinitely and without conditions to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons [1]

05-11.title: India's population officially reaches 1 billion -
05-11.description: On May 11, 2000, India's population officially reaches 1 billion - Astha Arora named India's billionth baby

05-12.title: Britain Abolishes the Slave Trade 1789 William
05-12.description: On May 12, 1789, Britain Abolishes the Slave Trade 1789 William Wilberforce makes his first major speech on abolition in the UK House of Commons, reasoning the slave trade morally reprehensible and an issue of natural justice

05-12.title: Nazi blitzkrieg and conquest of France begins with
05-12.description: On May 12, 1940, Nazi blitzkrieg and conquest of France begins with German forces crossing the Muese River

05-12.title: Axis forces in North Africa surrender
05-12.description: On May 12, 1943, Axis forces in North Africa surrender

05-12.title: USSR lifts blockade of West Berlin after US
05-12.description: On May 12, 1949, USSR lifts blockade of West Berlin after US, UK, and allies successfully supply the city during the Berlin Airlift

05-12.title: Former US President Jimmy Carter arrives in Cuba for a
05-12.description: On May 12, 2002, Former US President Jimmy Carter arrives in Cuba for a five-day visit with Fidel Castro, becoming the first President of the United States, in or out of office, to visit the island since Castro's 1959 revolution.

05-12.title: Wenchuan earthquake
05-12.description: On May 12, 2008, Wenchuan earthquake, measuring 7.8 in magnitude occurs in Sichuan, China, killing over 87,000, injuring 374,643 and leaving homeless between 4.8 million and 11 million people

05-13.title: How Australia Was Born 1787 The First Fleet
05-13.description: On May 13, 1787, How Australia Was Born 1787 The First Fleet, headed by Arthur Phillip, sets sail with 11 ships of convicts for Botany Bay, Australia [1]

05-13.title: The Republic of Ecuador is founded with Juan José
05-13.description: On May 13, 1830, The Republic of Ecuador is founded with Juan José Flores as president

05-13.title: Winston Churchill says "I have nothing to offer but
05-13.description: On May 13, 1940, Winston Churchill says "I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat" in his first speech as Prime Minister to the British House of Commons

05-13.title: Pope John Paul II is shot and critically wounded by
05-13.description: On May 13, 1981, Pope John Paul II is shot and critically wounded by Turkish gunman Mehmet Ali Ağca in St Peter's Square, Vatican City

05-13.title: Approximately 2,000 students begin a hunger strike in
05-13.description: On May 13, 1989, Approximately 2,000 students begin a hunger strike in Tiananmen Square, China, to force a dialogue with the government ahead of a visit by Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev

05-14.title: Constitution of the United States 1787 Delegates
05-14.description: On May 14, 1787, Constitution of the United States 1787 Delegates gather in Philadelphia to draw up the Constitution of the United States

05-14.title: English country doctor Edward Jenner administers his
05-14.description: On May 14, 1796, English country doctor Edward Jenner administers his revolutionary cowpox-based vaccine for smallpox in Berkeley, Gloucestershire

05-14.title: Meriwether Lewis and William Clark 's expedition sets
05-14.description: On May 14, 1804, Meriwether Lewis and William Clark 's expedition sets out from St. Louis for the Pacific Coast, commissioned by Thomas Jefferson

05-14.title: Land surveyor, newspaper publisher and inventor Gail
05-14.description: On May 14, 1853, Land surveyor, newspaper publisher and inventor Gail Borden patents his process for condensed milk

05-14.title: Israeli Declaration of Independence 1948 David
05-14.description: On May 14, 1948, Israeli Declaration of Independence 1948 David Ben-Gurion declares Israel independent from British administration, Golda Meir one of the signatories

05-14.title: Warsaw Pact signed
05-14.description: On May 14, 1955, Warsaw Pact is signed by the Soviet Union, Albania, Bulgaria, Czechoslovakia, East Germany, Hungary, Poland and Romania

05-14.title: Google unveils new generative AI features at its
05-14.description: On May 14, 2024, Google unveils new generative AI features at its annual conference, forcing users to view AI Overviews at the top of search results despite them being factually incorrect 60% of the time [1] [2] [3]

05-15.title: Pope Innocent IV issues the papal bull Ad Extirpanda
05-15.description: On May 15, 1252, Pope Innocent IV issues the papal bull Ad Extirpanda, which authorizes but also limits the torture of heretics in the Medieval Inquisition

05-15.title: German astronomer Johannes Kepler discovers the third
05-15.description: On May 15, 1618, German astronomer Johannes Kepler discovers the third of his three planetary laws, the "harmonic law"

05-15.title: Emigrants Crossing the Plains 1841 First emigrant
05-15.description: On May 15, 1841, Emigrants Crossing the Plains 1841 First emigrant wagon train to reach California leaves Independence, Missouri, on a 1,730-mile journey over the Sierra Nevada [1]

05-15.title: National Woman Suffrage Association forms in New York
05-15.description: On May 15, 1869, National Woman Suffrage Association forms in New York, founded by Susan B. Anthony and Elizabeth Cady Stanton

05-15.title: Richard and Maurice McDonald open the first McDonald's
05-15.description: On May 15, 1940, Richard and Maurice McDonald open the first McDonald's restaurant in San Bernardino, California

05-15.title: AT&T becomes the first US corporation to have a
05-15.description: On May 15, 1951, AT&T becomes the first US corporation to have a million stockholders after young car salesman Brady Denton purchases seven shares worth $1,078

05-15.title: The Soviet Union begins withdrawing its 115
05-15.description: On May 15, 1988, The Soviet Union begins withdrawing its 115,000 troops from Afghanistan

05-16.title: Japanese poet Matsuo Bashō leaves Edo on his epic
05-16.description: On May 16, 1689, Japanese poet Matsuo Bashō leaves Edo on his epic 150-day journey to Honshu Island in Japan, which he writes about in the literary masterpiece "Oku no Hosomichi" (The Narrow Road to the Deep North)

05-16.title: Belgian-French engineer Étienne Lenoir builds the
05-16.description: On May 16, 1862, Belgian-French engineer Étienne Lenoir builds the first automobile with an internal-combustion engine

05-16.title: US Senate fails to impeach President Andrew Johnson by
05-16.description: On May 16, 1868, US Senate fails to impeach President Andrew Johnson by one vote

05-16.title: Canonization of Joan of Arc 1920 French heroine Joan
05-16.description: On May 16, 1920, Canonization of Joan of Arc 1920 French heroine Joan of Arc is canonized as a saint by Pope Benedict XV

05-16.title: Operation Chastise: No. 617 Squadron RAF begins the
05-16.description: On May 16, 1943, Operation Chastise: No. 617 Squadron RAF begins the famous Dambusters Raid, bombing the Möhne and Eder dams in the Ruhr Valley with bouncing bombs

05-16.title: First of over 180,000 Hungarian Jews reaches Auschwitz
05-16.description: On May 16, 1944, First of over 180,000 Hungarian Jews reaches Auschwitz

05-16.title: Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev and Chinese leader
