05-16.description: On May 16, 1989, Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev and Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping meet in Beijing and formally end a 30-year rift

05-16.title: Human stem cells are successfully cloned
05-16.description: On May 16, 2013, Human stem cells are successfully cloned

05-17.title: Twenty-four merchants form the New York Stock Exchange
05-17.description: On May 17, 1792, Twenty-four merchants form the New York Stock Exchange at 70 Wall Street

05-17.title: John Hawkins and Richard French patent the reaping
05-17.description: On May 17, 1803, John Hawkins and Richard French patent the reaping machine

05-17.title: First Color Photograph 1861 The first color photograph
05-17.description: On May 17, 1861, First Color Photograph 1861 The first color photograph, of a tartan ribbon is shown by Scottish scientist James Clerk Maxwell to the Royal Institution in London

05-17.title: US Senate Watergate Committee begins its hearings into
05-17.description: On May 17, 1973, US Senate Watergate Committee begins its hearings into the break-in at the Democratic National Committee headquarters at the Watergate office complex in Washington, D.C.

05-17.title: Massachusetts becomes the first U.S. state to legalize
05-17.description: On May 17, 2004, Massachusetts becomes the first U.S. state to legalize same-sex marriage

05-17.title: Center-right Hindu nationalist party
05-17.description: On May 17, 2014, Center-right Hindu nationalist party, the BJP, led by Narendra Modi, wins a landslide general election victory in India

05-18.title: After 100 years of Crusader control
05-18.description: On May 18, 1291, After 100 years of Crusader control, the last Crusader stronghold of Acre is reconquered and destroyed by the Mamluks under Sultan al-Ashraf Khalil

05-18.title: Napoléon Bonaparte is proclaimed Emperor of France by
05-18.description: On May 18, 1804, Napoléon Bonaparte is proclaimed Emperor of France by the French Senate

05-18.title: Khodynka Tragedy: A stampeding crowd on Khodynka Field
05-18.description: On May 18, 1896, Khodynka Tragedy: A stampeding crowd on Khodynka Field, Moscow, during the coronation festivities for Russian Tsar Nicholas II, causes the deaths of an estimated 1,300 people

05-18.title: India becomes the sixth nation to detonate an atomic
05-18.description: On May 18, 1974, India becomes the sixth nation to detonate an atomic bomb

05-18.title: Mount St. Helens Erupts 1980 Eruption of Mount St.
05-18.description: On May 18, 1980, Mount St. Helens Erupts 1980 Eruption of Mount St. Helens in Washington state triggers the largest landslide in history, killing 57 people and causing over $1 billion in damage

05-18.title: The Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam are defeated by
05-18.description: On May 18, 2009, The Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam are defeated by the Sri Lankan government, ending the Sri Lankan Civil War and almost 26 years of fighting between the two sides

05-19.title: Execution of Anne Boleyn 1536 Anne Boleyn
05-19.description: On May 19, 1536, Execution of Anne Boleyn 1536 Anne Boleyn, second wife of English King Henry VIII, is beheaded at the Tower of London on charges of adultery, incest and treason

05-19.title: Massachusetts Bay, Plymouth, Connecticut, and New
05-19.description: On May 19, 1643, Massachusetts Bay, Plymouth, Connecticut, and New Haven form the United Colonies of New England

05-19.title: England is declared a Commonwealth by an act of the
05-19.description: On May 19, 1649, England is declared a Commonwealth by an act of the Rump Parliament, making England a republic for the next 11 years

05-19.title: German Chancellor Otto von Bismarck takes possession
05-19.description: On May 19, 1885, German Chancellor Otto von Bismarck takes possession of Cameroon and Togoland

05-19.title: US Congress passes the Private Mailing Card Act
05-19.description: On May 19, 1898, US Congress passes the Private Mailing Card Act, allowing private publishers and printers to produce postcards, which have to be labeled "Private Mailing Cards" until 1901, known as "souvenir cards"

05-19.title: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk lands at Samsun on the Black Sea
05-19.description: On May 19, 1919, Mustafa Kemal Atatürk lands at Samsun on the Black Sea coast, beginning the Turkish War of Independence

05-20.title: Possible date of the Antioch earthquake in the
05-20.description: On May 20, 526, Possible date of the Antioch earthquake in the Byzantine Empire (present-day Syria), which kills 200,000 people

05-20.title: Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama arrives in Calicut
05-20.description: On May 20, 1498, Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama arrives in Calicut, India, becoming the first European to reach India by sea

05-20.title: William Shakespeare 's Sonnets are first published in
05-20.description: On May 20, 1609, William Shakespeare 's Sonnets are first published in London, perhaps illicitly, by publisher Thomas Thorpe

05-20.title: US President Abraham Lincoln signs into law the
05-20.description: On May 20, 1862, US President Abraham Lincoln signs into law the Homestead Act to provide cheap land for the settlement of the American West (80 million acres by 1900)

05-20.title: Nine Kings in One Room 1910 Funeral for Britain's King
05-20.description: On May 20, 1910, Nine Kings in One Room 1910 Funeral for Britain's King Edward VII is held in Westminster Abbey, attended by one of the largest assemblies of European royalty

05-20.title: At 7:40 AM, Charles Lindbergh takes off from New York
05-20.description: On May 20, 1927, At 7:40 AM, Charles Lindbergh takes off from New York to cross the Atlantic for Paris aboard the Spirit of St. Louis in the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight

05-20.title: Treaty of Jeddah signed
05-20.description: On May 20, 1927, Treaty of Jeddah is signed between the United Kingdom and Ibn Saud, recognizing the independence of the Kingdom of Hejaz and Nejd, the forerunner of Saudi Arabia

05-20.title: Hubble Space Telescope sends its first photographs
05-20.description: On May 20, 1990, Hubble Space Telescope sends its first photographs from space

05-21.title: Mount Unzen on Japan's Shimabara Peninsula erupts
05-21.description: On May 21, 1792, Mount Unzen on Japan's Shimabara Peninsula erupts, creating a tsunami and killing about 15,000 people in the country's deadliest volcanic eruption

05-21.title: First US Democratic National Convention is held in
05-21.description: On May 21, 1832, First US Democratic National Convention is held in Baltimore

05-21.title: French Army attacks Paris
05-21.description: On May 21, 1871, French Army attacks Paris, starting the Semaine Sanglante (Bloody Week), a weeklong battle that kills 10,000-15,000 and ends the Paris Commune

05-21.title: Aviator Charles Lindbergh
05-21.description: On May 21, 1927, Aviator Charles Lindbergh, in the Spirit of St. Louis, lands in Paris after the first solo air crossing of the Atlantic

05-21.title: Amelia Earhart Flies Across the Atlantic 1932 After
05-21.description: On May 21, 1932, Amelia Earhart Flies Across the Atlantic 1932 After flying for 17 hours from Newfoundland, Amelia Earhart lands near Londonderry, Northern Ireland, completing the first solo transatlantic flight by a woman

05-22.title: Battle of the Granicus 334 BC Macedonian army of
05-22.description: On May 22, Battle of the Granicus 334 BC Macedonian army of Alexander the Great defeats Darius III of Persia in the Battle of the Granicus

05-22.title: First atlas "Theatrum Orbis Terrarum" is published by
05-22.description: On May 22, 1570, First atlas "Theatrum Orbis Terrarum" (Theatre of the World) is published by Abraham Ortelius in Antwerp with 70 maps

05-22.title: First wagon train departs Independence
05-22.description: On May 22, 1843, First wagon train departs Independence, Missouri, for Oregon with 700 to 1,000 migrants

05-22.title: Germany's Adolf Hitler and Italy's Benito Mussolini
05-22.description: On May 22, 1939, Germany's Adolf Hitler and Italy's Benito Mussolini sign the "Pact of Steel" formalizing the 1936 alliance known as the Rome-Berlin Axis

05-22.title: Royal Thai Armed Forces
05-22.description: On May 22, 2014, Royal Thai Armed Forces, led by General Prayut Chan-o-cha, stage a coup in Thailand, suspend the kingdom's constitution, and take control of the government, the 12th since the country's first coup in 1932

05-23.title: Second Defenestration of Prague: Two Catholic Lords
05-23.description: On May 23, 1618, Second Defenestration of Prague: Two Catholic Lords Regent and their secretary are thrown out of a window and amazingly are not seriously injured by the 70 foot (21m) fall. Triggers the Thirty Years' War.

05-23.title: Benjamin Franklin announces his invention of bifocals
05-23.description: On May 23, 1785, Benjamin Franklin announces his invention of bifocals

05-23.title: South American independence leader Simón Bolívar
05-23.description: On May 23, 1813, South American independence leader Simón Bolívar enters Mérida, leading the invasion of Venezuela, and is proclaimed El Libertador (The Liberator)

05-23.title: Bonnie and Clyde Killed 1934 American outlaws Bonnie
05-23.description: On May 23, 1934, Bonnie and Clyde Killed 1934 American outlaws Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow are killed by police in an ambush near Sailes, Louisiana

05-23.title: Federal Republic of (West) Germany is created from the
05-23.description: On May 23, 1949, Federal Republic of (West) Germany is created from the American, British, and French occupation zones

05-23.title: Mao Zedong starts the "Great Leap Forward" movement in
05-23.description: On May 23, 1958, Mao Zedong starts the "Great Leap Forward" movement in China, kills between 23 and 55 million Chinese citizens due to famine and forced labor

05-23.title: The Good Friday Agreement is accepted in a referendum
05-23.description: On May 23, 1998, The Good Friday Agreement is accepted in a referendum in Northern Ireland with 75% voting yes

05-24.title: Nomenclator of Leiden University Library appears
05-24.description: On May 24, 1595, Nomenclator of Leiden University Library appears, the first printed catalog of an institutional library

05-24.title: John Wesley is converted
05-24.description: On May 24, 1738, John Wesley is converted, launching the Methodist movement, celebrated annually by Methodists as Aldersgate Day

05-24.title: Samuel Morse taps out "What hath God wrought" in the
05-24.description: On May 24, 1844, Samuel Morse taps out "What hath God wrought" in the world's first telegraph message

05-24.title: Brooklyn Bridge Opens 1883 Brooklyn Bridge is opened
05-24.description: On May 24, 1883, Brooklyn Bridge Opens 1883 Brooklyn Bridge is opened by President Chester A. Arthur and NY Governor Grover Cleveland

05-24.title: German battleship Bismarck sinks British battlecruiser
05-24.description: On May 24, 1941, German battleship Bismarck sinks British battlecruiser HMS Hood; 1,416 die, 3 survive

05-24.title: Britain's Parliament passes Section 28 as law
05-24.description: On May 24, 1988, Britain's Parliament passes Section 28 as law prohibiting the promotion of homosexuality. Repealed in 2001/2004.

05-25.title: The Ship "Le Grand St Antoine" reaches Marseille
05-25.description: On May 25, 1720, The Ship "Le Grand St Antoine" reaches Marseille, bringing Europe's last major plague outbreak. Kills around 100,000.

05-25.title: In the May Revolution
05-25.description: On May 25, 1810, In the May Revolution, citizens of Buenos Aires expel the Spanish Viceroy Cisneros during Semana de Mayo

05-25.title: British House of Commons passes the Irish Home Rule
05-25.description: On May 25, 1914, British House of Commons passes the Irish Home Rule Bill

05-25.title: First commercial fluid catalytic cracking facility
05-25.description: On May 25, 1942, First commercial fluid catalytic cracking facility begins production at Exxon, developed by the "Four Horsemen” research team at Exxon. The process now produces half the world's gasoline. [1]

05-25.title: JFK announces the US goal of putting a man on the Moon
05-25.description: On May 25, 1961, JFK announces the US goal of putting a man on the Moon before the end of the decade

05-25.title: Video of African American George Floyd 's arrest and
05-25.description: On May 25, 2020, Video of African American George Floyd 's arrest and murder while restrained in Minneapolis police custody shows he was pinned to the ground by police officer Derek Chauvin's knee for 8 minutes and 46 seconds, igniting widespread condemnation and nationwide protests

05-25.title: US CDC says half of all US adults are now fully
05-25.description: On May 25, 2021, US CDC says half of all US adults are now fully vaccinated, with 61% having had their first shot

05-26.title: Dow Jones Industrial Average begins with an average of
05-26.description: On May 26, 1896, Dow Jones Industrial Average begins with an average of 12 industrial stocks, the daily closing value is 40.9

05-26.title: At Masjed Soleyman (مسجد سليمان) in southwest Persia
05-26.description: On May 26, 1908, At Masjed Soleyman (مسجد سليمان) in southwest Persia, the first major commercial oil strike in the Middle East is made, rights acquired by the United Kingdom

05-26.title: Model T 1927 Henry Ford and the Ford Motor Company
05-26.description: On May 26, 1927, Model T 1927 Henry Ford and the Ford Motor Company produce the last (and 15 millionth) Model T Ford / Tin Lizzie

05-26.title: South Africa elects a nationalist government under D.
05-26.description: On May 26, 1948, South Africa elects a nationalist government under D. F. Malan with an apartheid policy

05-26.title: US Army veteran Terry Nichols is found guilty of 161
05-26.description: On May 26, 2004, US Army veteran Terry Nichols is found guilty of 161 state murder charges for helping carry out the Oklahoma City bombing

05-27.title: Habeas Corpus Act passes in England
05-27.description: On May 27, 1679, Habeas Corpus Act passes in England, strengthening a person's right to challenge unlawful arrest and imprisonment

05-27.title: Saint Petersburg (Leningrad) is founded by Russian
05-27.description: On May 27, 1703, Saint Petersburg (Leningrad) is founded by Russian Tsar Peter the Great

05-27.title: Heinrich Schliemann discovers "Priam's Treasure" a
05-27.description: On May 27, 1873, Heinrich Schliemann discovers "Priam's Treasure" a cache of gold and other objects in Hisarlik (Troy) in Anatolia

05-27.title: Battle of Tsushima 1905 Japanese fleet destroys the
05-27.description: On May 27, 1905, Battle of Tsushima 1905 Japanese fleet destroys the Russian East Sea fleet in the Battle of Tsushima, the only decisive clash between modern steel battleships in history

05-27.title: Miracle of Dunkirk 1940 British and Allied forces
05-27.description: On May 27, 1940, Miracle of Dunkirk 1940 British and Allied forces begin the evacuation of Dunkirk (Operation Dynamo) during World War II

05-27.title: Jomo Kenyatta is elected as the first Prime Minister
05-27.description: On May 27, 1963, Jomo Kenyatta is elected as the first Prime Minister of Kenya

05-27.title: International Criminal Tribunal for the former
05-27.description: On May 27, 1999, International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia indicts Slobodan Milošević and four others for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in Kosovo

05-27.title: An earthquake strikes Java
05-27.description: On May 27, 2006, An earthquake strikes Java, Indonesia, at 5:53:58 AM local time, devastating Bantul and the city of Yogyakarta and killing over 6,600 people

05-28.title: as predicted by Greek philosopher Thales
05-28.description: On May 28, BC Solar eclipse, as predicted by Greek philosopher Thales, occurs while Lydians are at war with the Medes and leads to a truce. It is one of the cardinal dates from which other dates are calculated.

05-28.title: Joan of Arc is accused of relapsing into heresy by
05-28.description: On May 28, 1431, Joan of Arc is accused of relapsing into heresy by donning male clothing again, providing justification for her execution

05-28.title: King Philip II dispatches the Spanish Armada under the
05-28.description: On May 28, 1588, King Philip II dispatches the Spanish Armada under the Duke of Medina-Sidonia from Lisbon, Portugal to invade England

05-28.title: Trail of Tears 1830 US President Andrew Jackson signs
05-28.description: On May 28, 1830, Trail of Tears 1830 US President Andrew Jackson signs the Indian Removal Act, a key law leading to the forced removal of the Cherokee, Chickasaw, Choctaw, Creek, and Seminole tribes out of Georgia and surrounding states, setting the stage for the Cherokee Trail of Tears

05-28.title: On Computable Numbers 1936 Alan Turing submits " On
05-28.description: On May 28, 1936, On Computable Numbers 1936 Alan Turing submits " On Computable Numbers " for publication, in which he sets out the theoretical basis for modern computers

05-28.title: White House "plumbers" first break in at the
05-28.description: On May 28, 1972, White House "plumbers" first break in at the Democratic National Headquarters and install listening devices at Watergate Complex in Washington, D.C.

05-29.title: Constantinople, capital of the Eastern Roman Empire,
05-29.description: On May 29, 1453, Constantinople, capital of the Eastern Roman Empire, falls to the Ottoman Turks under Mehmed the Conqueror, ending the Byzantine Empire after 1,100 years

05-29.title: The Korean navy, led by Admiral Yi Sun-sin, repels a
05-29.description: On May 29, 1592, The Korean navy, led by Admiral Yi Sun-sin, repels a Japanese fleet in the Battle of Sacheon, the first use of a Korean Turtle Ship

05-29.title: On his 30th birthday
05-29.description: On May 29, 1660, On his 30th birthday, Charles II returns to London from exile in the Netherlands to claim the English throne after the Puritan Commonwealth comes to an end

05-29.title: Sojourner Truth addresses the first Black Women's
05-29.description: On May 29, 1851, Sojourner Truth addresses the first Black Women's Rights Convention in Akron, Ohio

05-29.title: Tenzing Norgay on the Summit of Mount Everest 1953
05-29.description: On May 29, 1953, Tenzing Norgay on the Summit of Mount Everest 1953 Edmund Hillary (NZ) and Tenzing Norgay (Nepal) are the first to reach the summit of Mount Everest as part of a British expedition

05-30.title: Hundred Years' War: 19-year-old Joan of Arc is burned
05-30.description: On May 30, 1431, Hundred Years' War: 19-year-old Joan of Arc is burned at the stake by an English-dominated tribunal in Rouen, France

05-30.title: Hernando de Soto's Expedition lands in Florida 1539
05-30.description: On May 30, 1539, Hernando de Soto's Expedition lands in Florida 1539 Spanish explorer Hernando de Soto 's expedition of 10 ships and 700 men lands in Florida

05-30.title: Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo between the United States
05-30.description: On May 30, 1848, Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo between the United States and Mexico comes into force, giving California, Nevada, Utah, and most of Colorado, New Mexico, and Arizona to the US in return for $15 million

05-30.title: Memorial Day first observed
05-30.description: On May 30, 1868, "Decoration Day," later called Memorial Day, is first observed in Northern US states

05-30.title: Treaty of London signed
05-30.description: On May 30, 1913, Treaty of London is signed by the Great Powers, the Ottoman Empire, and the victorious Balkan League (Serbia, Greece, the Kingdom of Bulgaria, and Montenegro), bringing an end to the First Balkan War

05-30.title: Hissène Habré convicted of crimes against humanity
05-30.description: On May 30, 2016, Former Chadian dictator Hissène Habré is convicted of crimes against humanity by the Extraordinary African Chambers, the first ex-head of state convicted of the charge

05-30.title: former US President Donald Trump found guilty
05-30.description: On May 30, 2024, Jury in New York City finds former US President Donald Trump guilty on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records to hide payments made to prevent damaging personal information from being released prior to the 2016 election [1]

05-31.title: Ramesses the Great becomes Pharaoh
05-31.description: On May 31, BC Ramesses II, also known as Ramesses the Great becomes Pharaoh of Ancient Egypt's 19th Dynasty

05-31.title: Martin Frobisher sails from Harwich
05-31.description: On May 31, 1578, Martin Frobisher sails from Harwich, England, to Frobisher Bay, Canada. Eventually mines fools gold, famously used to pave the streets of London.

05-31.title: Treaty of Vereeniging signed
05-31.description: On May 31, 1902, Treaty of Vereeniging is signed, ending the Second Boer War and making Transvaal and the Orange Free State self-governing British colonies

05-31.title: Union of South Africa declares independence
05-31.description: On May 31, 1910, Union of South Africa declares independence from the United Kingdom

05-31.title: Battle of Jutland 1916 Battle of Jutland : Largest
05-31.description: On May 31, 1916, Battle of Jutland 1916 Battle of Jutland : Largest naval battle of World War I between the British Grand Fleet and the German High Seas Fleet, 8,645 sailors are killed in an inconclusive battle but strategic British victory. German fleet never puts to sea again in WWI.

05-31.title: A 7.7 magnitude earthquake destroys Quetta in
05-31.description: On May 31, 1935, A 7.7 magnitude earthquake destroys Quetta in Balochistan, British India (now Pakistan), killing an estimated 40,000 people

05-31.title: Communists seize power in Hungary
05-31.description: On May 31, 1947, Communists seize power in Hungary

05-31.title: 7.75 Ancash earthquake off the coast of Peru kills 66
05-31.description: On May 31, 1970, 7.75 Ancash earthquake off the coast of Peru kills 66,000-70,000 people and triggers the world's deadliest avalanche

06-01.title: central Ukraine (hypothesis only)
06-01.description: On June 1, BC Approximate domestication of the horse in the Eurasian steppes near Dereivka, central Ukraine (hypothesis only)

06-01.title: Peking [Beijing], then a city of over one million,
06-01.description: On June 1, 1215, Peking [Beijing], then a city of over one million, under the control of Jurchen ruler Emperor Xuanzong of Jin, is captured and looted for a month by the Mongols under Genghis Khan

06-01.title: De humani corporis fabrica 1543 Flemish physician
06-01.description: On June 1, 1543, De humani corporis fabrica 1543 Flemish physician Andreas Vesalius publishes " De humani corporis fabrica (On the fabric of the human body in seven books)" a major step forward in understanding human anatomy [date is representative as exact date of publication unknown]

06-01.title: Battle of Öland 1676 Battle of Öland : allied
06-01.description: On June 1, 1676, Battle of Öland 1676 Battle of Öland : allied Danish-Dutch forces defeat the Swedish navy in the Baltic Sea, during the Scanian War (1675–79)

06-01.title: Boston Tea Party 1774 Boston Port Act: Following the
06-01.description: On June 1, 1774, Boston Tea Party 1774 Boston Port Act: Following the passage of the act, the British government orders Port of Boston closed to punish colonists for the Boston Tea Party

06-01.title: European Central Bank is founded in Brussels to define
06-01.description: On June 1, 1998, European Central Bank is founded in Brussels to define and execute the European Union's monetary policy

06-02.title: King Gaiseric and the Vandals sack Rome
06-02.description: On June 2, 455, King Gaiseric and the Vandals sack Rome, looting continues for 14 days

06-02.title: Robert E. Lee takes command of Confederate armies of
06-02.description: On June 2, 1862, Robert E. Lee takes command of Confederate armies of North Virginia during the American Civil War

06-02.title: Italian engineer and inventor Guglielmo Marconi
06-02.description: On June 2, 1896, Italian engineer and inventor Guglielmo Marconi applies for the first ever patent for a system of wireless telegraphy in the United Kingdom

06-02.title: The King is Dead; Long Live the Queen 1953 Coronation
06-02.description: On June 2, 1953, The King is Dead; Long Live the Queen 1953 Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in Westminster Abbey, London, England

06-02.title: Goddess of Democracy 1989 10
06-02.description: On June 2, 1989, Goddess of Democracy 1989 10,000 Chinese soldiers are blocked by 100,000 citizens in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, protecting students demonstrating for democracy

06-03.title: Dutch West India Company receives charter for the West
06-03.description: On June 3, 1621, Dutch West India Company receives charter for the West Indies (the Americas, Caribbean and West Africa)

06-03.title: Chile and Peru sign the Treaty of Lima
06-03.description: On June 3, 1929, Chile and Peru sign the Treaty of Lima, finally resolving their border dispute from the War of the Pacific (1879–83). Chile keeps Arica and Peru regains Tacna.

06-03.title: Zoot Suit Riots 1943 A mob of 60 from the Los Angeles
06-03.description: On June 3, 1943, Zoot Suit Riots 1943 A mob of 60 from the Los Angeles Naval Reserve Armory beats up everyone perceived to be Hispanic, starting the week-long Zoot Suit Riots

06-03.title: Ixtoc I rig in the Gulf of Mexico blows out
06-03.description: On June 3, 1979, Ixtoc I rig in the Gulf of Mexico blows out, spilling 3 million barrels of oil in one of the worst oil spills in history

06-03.title: Tiananmen Square Massacre 1989 Beginning of the
06-03.description: On June 3, 1989, Tiananmen Square Massacre 1989 Beginning of the Tiananmen Square Massacre as Chinese troops open fire on pro-democracy supporters in Beijing

06-04.title: The Great Upheaval: New England planters arrive in
06-04.description: On June 4, 1760, The Great Upheaval: New England planters arrive in Nova Scotia, Canada, to claim land taken from the Acadians

06-04.title: Miracle of Dunkirk 1940 British complete the " Miracle
06-04.description: On June 4, 1940, Miracle of Dunkirk 1940 British complete the " Miracle of Dunkirk " by evacuating 338,226 Allied troops from France via a flotilla of over 800 vessels, including Royal Navy destroyers, merchant marine boats, fishing boats, pleasure craft, and even lifeboats

06-04.title: Eastern Europe's first partially free elections in 40
06-04.description: On June 4, 1989, Eastern Europe's first partially free elections in 40 years are held in Poland, Solidarity Party comes to power

06-04.title: Tiananmen Square Massacre 1989 Tiananmen Square
06-04.description: On June 4, 1989, Tiananmen Square Massacre 1989 Tiananmen Square Massacre : Chinese troops clear the square of student protesters, unofficial figures place death toll near 1,000

06-04.title: Ukrainian counteroffensive begins with increased
06-04.description: On June 4, 2023, Ukrainian counteroffensive begins with increased fighting in the east and south of the country [1]

06-05.title: Sultan Barghash bin Said
06-05.description: On June 5, 1873, Sultan Barghash bin Said, under British pressure, closes the infamous slave market of Zanzibar in present-day Tanzania

06-05.title: US Secretary of State George Marshall outlines the "
06-05.description: On June 5, 1947, US Secretary of State George Marshall outlines the " Marshall Plan " to rebuild Western Europe

06-05.title: A state of siege is declared in Iran
06-05.description: On June 5, 1963, A state of siege is declared in Iran, and Ayatollah Khomeini is arrested

06-05.title: Six-Day War 1967 Six-Day War begins between Israel and
06-05.description: On June 5, 1967, Six-Day War 1967 Six-Day War begins between Israel and the neighboring Arab states of Egypt, Jordan and Syria

06-05.title: Bobby Kennedy Gunned Down on Campaign Trail 1968
06-05.description: On June 5, 1968, Bobby Kennedy Gunned Down on Campaign Trail 1968 Palestinian Sirhan Sirhan assassinates Robert F. Kennedy, shooting him 3 times and wounding 5 others at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles, California. Kennedy dies the next day.

06-05.title: AIDS epidemic officially begins when US Centers for
06-05.description: On June 5, 1981, AIDS epidemic officially begins when US Centers for Disease Control reports on pneumonia affecting five homosexual men in Los Angeles

06-05.title: Indira Gandhi orders an attack on Sikhism's holiest
06-05.description: On June 5, 1984, Indira Gandhi orders an attack on Sikhism's holiest site, the Golden Temple in Amritsar

06-06.title: Gustav Vasa is elected King of Sweden
06-06.description: On June 6, 1523, Gustav Vasa is elected King of Sweden, ending the Kalmar Union

06-06.title: French transport the first African slaves to Louisiana
06-06.description: On June 6, 1716, French transport the first African slaves to Louisiana

06-06.title: The death of Yuan Shikai
06-06.description: On June 6, 1916, The death of Yuan Shikai, ruler of much of China since 1912, causes central government to virtually collapse in the face of pressure from warlords, and from political reformers including Sun Yat-Sen

06-06.title: D-Day begins as the 156
06-06.description: On June 6, 1944, D-Day 1944 Operation Overlord: D-Day begins as the 156,000-strong Allied Expeditionary Force lands in Normandy, France, during World War II

06-06.title: 30,000 Israeli troops invade Lebanon to drive out the
06-06.description: On June 6, 1982, 30,000 Israeli troops invade Lebanon to drive out the PLO

06-07.title: Treaty of Tordesillas 1494 Treaty of Tordesillas :
06-07.description: On June 7, 1494, Treaty of Tordesillas 1494 Treaty of Tordesillas : Spain and Portugal divide the New World along a meridian 370 leagues west of the Cape Verde Islands off the west coast of Africa

06-07.title: English King Charles I ratifies the Petition of Right
06-07.description: On June 7, 1628, English King Charles I ratifies the Petition of Right

06-07.title: Louis XIV is crowned King of France
06-07.description: On June 7, 1654, Louis XIV is crowned King of France

06-07.title: British Museum Opens its Doors 1753 British Museum is
06-07.description: On June 7, 1753, British Museum Opens its Doors 1753 British Museum is founded by an Act of Parliament with royal assent from King George II, opens in 1759

06-07.title: Vatican City becomes a sovereign state
06-07.description: On June 7, 1929, Vatican City becomes a sovereign state

06-07.title: The Supreme Court of the United States decides on
06-07.description: On June 7, 1965, The Supreme Court of the United States decides on Griswold v. Connecticut, effectively legalizing the use of contraception by married couples

06-07.title: US President Donald Trump orders deployment of 2
06-07.description: On June 7, 2025, US President Donald Trump orders deployment of 2,000 National Guard troops to southern California to quell protests against Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) sweeps in and around Los Angeles [1]

06-08.title: Attila the Hun invades Italy
06-08.description: On June 8, 452, Attila the Hun invades Italy

06-08.title: Vikings in longships from modern-day Norway plunder
06-08.description: On June 8, 793, Vikings in longships from modern-day Norway plunder St. Cuthbert's monastery on Lindisfarne Island off the northeast coast of England, capturing and killing monks

06-08.title: King Richard I of England arrives at Acre in
06-08.description: On June 8, 1191, King Richard I of England arrives at Acre in modern-day Israel to join the Siege of Acre during the Third Crusade

06-08.title: Laki volcano in southern Iceland begins an 8-month
06-08.description: On June 8, 1783, Laki volcano in southern Iceland begins an 8-month eruption, killing 10,000 people and causing widespread famine throughout Europe and Asia

06-08.title: Bill of Rights 1789 James Madison introduces a
06-08.description: On June 8, 1789, Bill of Rights 1789 James Madison introduces a proposed Bill of Rights in the US House of Representatives

06-08.title: Nova Aquilae is discovered
06-08.description: On June 8, 1918, Nova Aquilae is discovered, the brightest nova since Kepler's nova of 1604

06-08.title: New Zealand's Labour government legislates against
06-08.description: On June 8, 1987, New Zealand's Labour government legislates against nuclear weapons and nuclear powered vessels, the only nation to legislate against nuclear power

06-09.title: Roman Emperor Nero commits suicide
06-09.description: On June 9, 68, Roman Emperor Nero commits suicide, imploring his secretary Epaphroditus to slit his throat to evade a Senate-imposed death by flogging

06-09.title: Odo of Aquitaine defeats a Umayyad Muslim army at the
06-09.description: On June 9, 721, Odo of Aquitaine defeats a Umayyad Muslim army at the Battle of Toulouse, halting Arab expansion in Western Europe

06-09.title: Book of Common Prayer 1549 Book of Common Prayer is
06-09.description: On June 9, 1549, Book of Common Prayer 1549 Book of Common Prayer is adopted by the Church of England

06-09.title: Congress of Vienna ends after reshaping the political
06-09.description: On June 9, 1815, Congress of Vienna ends after reshaping the political map of Europe

06-09.title: Mormons leave Iowa City
06-09.description: On June 9, 1856, Mormons leave Iowa City, Iowa, and head west for Salt Lake City, Utah, carrying all their possessions in two-wheeled handcarts

06-09.title: China leases Hong Kong's New Territories to the United
06-09.description: On June 9, 1898, China leases Hong Kong's New Territories to the United Kingdom for 99 years

06-09.title: Over 1 million people protest in Hong Kong against
06-09.description: On June 9, 2019, Over 1 million people protest in Hong Kong against proposed new laws for extradition to China in one of the largest-ever protests in the city

06-10.title: Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I Barbarossa drowns while
06-10.description: On June 10, 1190, Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I Barbarossa drowns while crossing the Saleph River in modern-day Turkey, leading an army to Jerusalem during the Third Crusade

06-10.title: A landslide dam on the Dadu River
06-10.description: On June 10, 1786, A landslide dam on the Dadu River, caused by an earthquake ten days earlier, collapses and kills 100,000 in Sichuan province, China

06-10.title: Spain Declares War Against the United States 1898 US
06-10.description: On June 10, 1898, Spain Declares War Against the United States 1898 US Marines land in Cuba during the Spanish–American War

06-10.title: Hashemite-led Arabs of the Hejaz rise up against the
06-10.description: On June 10, 1916, Hashemite-led Arabs of the Hejaz rise up against the ruling Ottoman Empire in the Great Arab Revolt of World War I

06-10.title: US Equal Pay Act signed into law by President John F.
06-10.description: On June 10, 1963, US Equal Pay Act signed into law by President John F. Kennedy

06-10.title: Apple Computer ships its first Apple II computers
06-10.description: On June 10, 1977, Apple Computer ships its first Apple II computers

06-10.title: Spirit Rover Begins Mars Mission 2003 The Spirit Rover
06-10.description: On June 10, 2003, Spirit Rover Begins Mars Mission 2003 The Spirit Rover is launched, beginning NASA's Mars Exploration Rover mission

06-11.title: Troy is sacked and burned according to calculations by
06-11.description: On June 11, BC Trojan War: Troy is sacked and burned according to calculations by Eratosthenes

06-11.title: Emperor Taizong of Tang sends envoys to the Xueyantuo
06-11.description: On June 11, 631, Emperor Taizong of Tang sends envoys to the Xueyantuo bearing gold and silk for the release of Chinese prisoners captured on the northern frontier during the transition from the Sui to Tang dynasty and succeeds in freeing 80,000

06-11.title: United States Declaration of Independence 1776
06-11.description: On June 11, 1776, United States Declaration of Independence 1776 Continental Congress creates committee to draft a Declaration of Independence with Thomas Jefferson, John Adams, Benjamin Franklin, Roger Sherman, and Robert R. Livingston as members

06-11.title: US President John F. Kennedy says segregation is
06-11.description: On June 11, 1963, US President John F. Kennedy says segregation is morally wrong and that it is "time to act"

06-11.title: Margaret Thatcher is the first British Prime Minister
06-11.description: On June 11, 1987, Margaret Thatcher is the first British Prime Minister in 160 years to win a third consecutive term

06-11.title: Swine Flu Pandemic 2009 The World Health Organization
06-11.description: On June 11, 2009, Swine Flu Pandemic 2009 The World Health Organization declares H1N1 swine flu to be a global pandemic, the first such incident in over forty years

06-11.title: Islamic State of Iraq forces seize control of
06-11.description: On June 11, 2014, Islamic State of Iraq forces seize control of government offices and other important buildings in the northern city of Mosul

06-12.title: Patent for the 'Spinning Jenny'
06-12.description: On June 12, 1770, Patent for the 'Spinning Jenny', the first multiple spinning machine that revolutionizes cotton spinning, is granted to English weaver James Hargreaves [1]

06-12.title: Beginning of French colonization of Algeria: 34
06-12.description: On June 12, 1830, Beginning of French colonization of Algeria: 34,000 French soldiers land 27 kilometers west of Algiers at Sidi Ferruch

06-12.title: Battle of Trevilian Station
06-12.description: On June 12, 1864, Battle of Trevilian Station, the bloodiest and largest all-cavalry battle of the American Civil War, ends with a Confederate tactical victory and a Union successful retreat in Louisa County, Virginia

06-12.title: Al Capone is indicted on 5
06-12.description: On June 12, 1931, Al Capone is indicted on 5,000 counts of prohibition violations and perjury

06-12.title: Anne Frank – A Light of Inspiration in the Nazi
06-12.description: On June 12, 1942, Anne Frank – A Light of Inspiration in the Nazi Darkness 1942 Anne Frank receives her diary as a birthday present in Amsterdam

06-12.title: Nelson Mandela Begins 27 Years in Jail 1964 Nelson
06-12.description: On June 12, 1964, Nelson Mandela Begins 27 Years in Jail 1964 Nelson Mandela is sentenced to life in prison for sabotage in South Africa

06-12.title: Boris Yeltsin wins Russia's first presidential
06-12.description: On June 12, 1991, Boris Yeltsin wins Russia's first presidential election with 57% of the vote

06-12.title: Donald Trump Meets Kim Jong-Un 2018 Singapore Summit
06-12.description: On June 12, 2018, Donald Trump Meets Kim Jong-Un 2018 Singapore Summit between North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and US President Donald Trump - first time a North Korean leader and an incumbent US President meet

06-13.title: World's Oldest Treaty 1373 Anglo-Portuguese Treaty of
06-13.description: On June 13, 1373, World's Oldest Treaty 1373 Anglo-Portuguese Treaty of Perpetual Alliance (world's oldest still in existence) is signed in London between King Edward III of England and King Ferdinand I of Portugal [1]

06-13.title: US House of Representatives passes the 14th Amendment
06-13.description: On June 13, 1866, US House of Representatives passes the 14th Amendment (Civil Rights)

06-13.title: Congress of Berlin begins
06-13.description: On June 13, 1878, Congress of Berlin begins, determines the territories of the states in the Balkan peninsula following the Russo-Turkish War of 1877–78

06-13.title: The last British troops leave the Suez Canal Zone in
06-13.description: On June 13, 1956, The last British troops leave the Suez Canal Zone in Egypt

06-13.title: South Korean President Kim Dae-jung meets North Korean
06-13.description: On June 13, 2000, South Korean President Kim Dae-jung meets North Korean dictator Kim Jong-il for the beginning of the first-ever inter-Korean summit in the northern capital of Pyongyang

06-13.title: Operation Rising Lion: Israel strikes dozens of
06-13.description: On June 13, 2025, Operation Rising Lion: Israel strikes dozens of targets in Iran, including nuclear facilities, military sites and private residences, killing some senior military commanders and scientists in effort to eliminate Iran’s nuclear ambitions

06-14.title: Poll Tax Triggers the Peasants' Revolt 1381 Richard II
06-14.description: On June 14, 1381, Poll Tax Triggers the Peasants' Revolt 1381 Richard II in England meets leaders of the Peasants' Revolt on Blackheath. The Tower of London is stormed by rebels who enter without resistance.

06-14.title: Battle of Naseby, Leicestershire: Parliament's New
06-14.description: On June 14, 1645, Battle of Naseby, Leicestershire: Parliament's New Model Army under Oliver Cromwell and Thomas Fairfax defeats the Royalist forces of English King Charles I

06-14.title: US Continental Congress adopts the Stars & Stripes flag
06-14.description: On June 14, 1777, US Continental Congress adopts the Stars & Stripes flag, designed by Francis Hopkinson, replacing the Grand Union flag

06-14.title: King of Sennar, Badi VII, surrenders his throne and
06-14.description: On June 14, 1821, King of Sennar, Badi VII, surrenders his throne and realm to General Ismail Pasha of the Ottoman Empire, bringing the 300-year-old Sudanese kingdom to an end

06-14.title: Auschwitz concentration and extermination camp opens
06-14.description: On June 14, 1940, Auschwitz concentration and extermination camp opens in Nazi controlled Poland with Polish POWs, later expanded to include civilian Jews, Roman Catholics, Gypsies and Soviet POWs (at least 1.1 million would die within its walls)

06-14.title: Estonia loses 11,000 inhabitants as a consequence of
06-14.description: On June 14, 1941, Estonia loses 11,000 inhabitants as a consequence of mass deportations into Siberia

06-14.title: Argentine Soldiers Surrender in the Falklands 1982
06-14.description: On June 14, 1982, Argentine Soldiers Surrender in the Falklands 1982 Argentina surrenders to the United Kingdom, ending the 74-day Falklands Islands conflict

06-15.title: BC Assyrians record a solar eclipse that will be used
06-15.description: On June 15, BC Assyrians record a solar eclipse that will be used to fix the chronology of Mesopotamian history

06-15.title: Magna Carta 1215 King John of England signs the Magna
06-15.description: On June 15, 1215, Magna Carta 1215 King John of England signs the Magna Carta at Runnymede near Windsor in Surrey, limiting royal authority and establishing the principle that the king and his government are not above the law

06-15.title: Dannebrog - World's Oldest National Flag 1219
06-15.description: On June 15, 1219, Dannebrog - World's Oldest National Flag 1219 According to legend, Dannebrog, the flag of Denmark and the oldest national flag in the world falls from the sky during the Battle of Lyndanisse (now Tallinn) in Estonia and turns the Danes' luck

06-15.title: Ottomans defeat the Serbian army in the bloody Battle
06-15.description: On June 15, 1389, Ottomans defeat the Serbian army in the bloody Battle of Kosovo, opening the way for the Ottoman conquest of Southeastern Europe. Large losses on both sides including Sultan Murad and Serbian leader Prince Lazar. (NS date)

06-15.title: George Washington is appointed commander-in-chief of
06-15.description: On June 15, 1775, George Washington is appointed commander-in-chief of the Continental Army a day after Congress establishes the force

06-15.title: A tsunami strikes a Shinto festival on the beach at
06-15.description: On June 15, 1896, A tsunami strikes a Shinto festival on the beach at Sanriku, Japan; 27,000 people are killed, 9,000 are injured, and 13,000 houses are destroyed

06-15.title: German troops occupy Paris as French resistance to the
06-15.description: On June 15, 1940, German troops occupy Paris as French resistance to the German invasion crumbles

06-15.title: Climactic eruption of Mount Pinatubo in the Philippines
06-15.description: On June 15, 1991, Climactic eruption of Mount Pinatubo in the Philippines, the second-largest volcanic eruption on Earth in the 20th century

06-16.title: Great Siege of Gibraltar 1779 Spain declares war on
06-16.description: On June 16, 1779, Great Siege of Gibraltar 1779 Spain declares war on Great Britain in support of France and the USA, starting the Great Siege of Gibraltar, which lasts 3 years, 7 months, and 2 weeks

06-16.title: Abraham Lincoln says "A house divided against itself
06-16.description: On June 16, 1858, Abraham Lincoln says "A house divided against itself cannot stand" accepting Illinois Republican Party's nomination for the Senate

06-16.title: Bloomsday, the date of the fictional events in James
06-16.description: On June 16, 1904, Bloomsday, the date of the fictional events in James Joyce 's novel "Ulysses"

06-16.title: Soviet space mission Vostok 6 is launched with
06-16.description: On June 16, 1963, Soviet space mission Vostok 6 is launched with Valentina Tereshkova onboard, who becomes the first woman in space

06-16.title: Israel complies with UN Security Council Resolution
06-16.description: On June 16, 2000, Israel complies with UN Security Council Resolution 425 after 22 years, which calls on Israel to completely withdraw from Lebanon. Israel withdraws from all of Lebanon, except the disputed Shebaa Farms.

06-17.title: Ali ibn Abu Talib elected the 4th Caliph of the
06-17.description: On June 17, 656, Ali ibn Abu Talib elected the 4th Caliph of the Rashidun Caliphate

06-17.title: Pánfilo de Narváez departs Spain to explore Florida
06-17.description: On June 17, 1527, Pánfilo de Narváez departs Spain to explore Florida with five ships and 600 men; by 1536, only four men are still alive

06-17.title: Francis Drake Lands in California 1579 English
06-17.description: On June 17, 1579, Francis Drake Lands in California 1579 English navigator Francis Drake lands on the coast of California at what becomes known as Drakes Bay, for ship repairs; claims area on behalf of Queen Elizabeth, and names it "Nova Albion" [1] [2]

06-17.title: Taj Mahal 1631 Mumtaz Mahal dies during childbirth.
06-17.description: On June 17, 1631, Taj Mahal 1631 Mumtaz Mahal dies during childbirth. Her husband, Mughal emperor Shah Jahan I, then spends more than 20 years building her tomb, the Taj Mahal

06-17.title: French Revolution: During the meeting of the
06-17.description: On June 17, 1789, French Revolution: During the meeting of the Estates-General, the Third Estate proclaims itself the 'National Assembly'

06-17.title: Charles Goodyear obtains his first rubber patent
06-17.description: On June 17, 1837, Charles Goodyear obtains his first rubber patent

06-17.title: Republican Party opens its first national convention
06-17.description: On June 17, 1856, Republican Party opens its first national convention as party members meet in Philadelphia

06-18.title: Coronation of Chinese governor Li Yuan as Emperor
06-18.description: On June 18, 618, Coronation of Chinese governor Li Yuan as Emperor Gaozu of Tang, the new Emperor of China, initiating three centuries of Tang Dynasty rule over China

06-18.title: War of 1812 begins when the US declares war against
06-18.description: On June 18, 1812, War of 1812 begins when the US declares war against Britain

06-18.title: Battle of Waterloo 1815 Battle of Waterloo : Napoleon
06-18.description: On June 18, 1815, Battle of Waterloo 1815 Battle of Waterloo : Napoleon Bonaparte and France are defeated by British forces under the Duke of Wellington and Prussian troops under Field Marshal von Blücher

06-18.title: American aviator Amelia Earhart becomes the first
06-18.description: On June 18, 1928, American aviator Amelia Earhart becomes the first woman to fly across the Atlantic Ocean (as a passenger), landing at Burry Port, Wales

06-18.title: Winston Churchill gives his "This was their finest
06-18.description: On June 18, 1940, Winston Churchill gives his "This was their finest hour" speech to the House of Commons, urging perseverance in the war after the Dunkirk evacuation and the fall of France

06-19.title: The Earl of Pembroke's army defeats Robert the Bruce
06-19.description: On June 19, 1306, The Earl of Pembroke's army defeats Robert the Bruce 's Scottish army at the Battle of Methven

06-19.title: ‘Bobbies’ Take To The Streets Of London 1829 Robert
06-19.description: On June 19, 1829, ‘Bobbies’ Take To The Streets Of London 1829 Robert Peel introduces the Metropolitan Police Act 1829 into Parliament to establish a unified police force for London, the city's first modern police force

06-19.title: Slavery is outlawed in US territories
06-19.description: On June 19, 1862, Slavery is outlawed in US territories

06-19.title: Juneteenth 1865 Union General Gordon Granger declares
06-19.description: On June 19, 1865, Juneteenth 1865 Union General Gordon Granger declares slaves free in Texas, now the date the end of slavery is celebrated across the US as Juneteenth

06-19.title: Day one of the two-day Battle of the Philippine Sea
06-19.description: On June 19, 1944, Day one of the two-day Battle of the Philippine Sea, US naval forces defeat the Japanese fleet in World War II

06-19.title: Pablo Escobar Jailed 1991 Colombian drug lord Pablo
06-19.description: On June 19, 1991, Pablo Escobar Jailed 1991 Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar surrenders to police

06-20.title: Battle of the Catalaunian Plains : Roman and Visigoth
06-20.description: On June 20, 451, Battle of the Catalaunian Plains : Roman and Visigoth forces defeat Attila the Hun in northeast France, halting the Hun invasion of Roman Gaul [exact date disputed]

06-20.title: Tennis Court Oath 1789 French Revolution: The Third
06-20.description: On June 20, 1789, Tennis Court Oath 1789 French Revolution: The Third Estate of the French Estates-General swears the Tennis Court Oath at the Palace of Versailles, vowing not to disband until a new constitution is formed

06-20.title: American inventor Samuel Morse patents his telegraph
06-20.description: On June 20, 1840, American inventor Samuel Morse patents his telegraph

06-20.title: First woman to earn a PhD in Physics from an American
06-20.description: On June 20, 1895, First woman to earn a PhD in Physics from an American university, Caroline Willard Baldwin (25), receives her degree from Cornell University

06-20.title: Highest-ever temperature recorded in the Arctic Circle
06-20.description: On June 20, 2020, Highest-ever temperature recorded in the Arctic Circle, 38°C (100°F) in Verkhoyansk, Siberia

06-21.title: Constitution of the United States 1788 US Constitution
06-21.description: On June 21, 1788, Constitution of the United States 1788 US Constitution comes into effect when New Hampshire is the 9th state to ratify it

06-21.title: First Victoria Cross won during the bombardment of
06-21.description: On June 21, 1854, First Victoria Cross won during the bombardment of Bomarsund in the Åland Islands during the Crimean War

06-21.title: Goodbye Scratchy 78s
06-21.description: On June 21, 1948, Goodbye Scratchy 78s, Hello Vinyl 1948 Columbia Records unveils the 33-1/3 rpm LP phonograph record, invented by Peter Carl Goldmark, allowing up to 20 minutes per side (available in 10 and 12-inch diameters) at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel, NYC; over the next decade, its popularity and profitability push the 78 rpm record out of production [1]

06-21.title: Lord Mountbatten resigns as Governor General of India
06-21.description: On June 21, 1948, Lord Mountbatten resigns as Governor General of India (formerly the last Viceroy)

06-21.title: 7.7 Manjil-Rudbar Earthquake with hundreds of
06-21.description: On June 21, 1990, 7.7 Manjil-Rudbar Earthquake with hundreds of aftershocks hits Iran, killing between 35,000 and 50,000 people

06-21.title: English mathematician Andrew Wiles proves the last
06-21.description: On June 21, 1993, English mathematician Andrew Wiles proves the last theorem of French mathematician Pierre de Fermat after 356 years, solving the world's most difficult math problem

06-22.title: Galileo Galilei recants his "heretical" position that
06-22.description: On June 22, 1633, Galileo Galilei recants his "heretical" position that the Earth orbiting the Sun is at odds with the Bible and church teaching (Vatican apologizes in 1992 for how it handled the case)

06-22.title: Royal Greenwich Observatory is established in England
06-22.description: On June 22, 1675, Royal Greenwich Observatory is established in England by King Charles II

06-22.title: Somerset v Stewart court case finds slavery
06-22.description: On June 22, 1772, Somerset v Stewart court case finds slavery unsupported by English common law, encouraging the abolitionist movement

06-22.title: Beginning of the June Days uprising in Paris by French
06-22.description: On June 22, 1848, Beginning of the June Days uprising in Paris by French workers

06-22.title: The CSS Shenandoah fires the last shot of the American
06-22.description: On June 22, 1865, The CSS Shenandoah fires the last shot of the American Civil War in the Bering Strait to indicate surrender

06-22.title: Germany Invades the Soviet Union 1941 Operation
06-22.description: On June 22, 1941, Germany Invades the Soviet Union 1941 Operation Barbarossa : Nazi Germany and its allies invade the Soviet Union during World War II, the largest military operation in history

06-23.title: World's oldest parliament
06-23.description: On June 23, 930, World's oldest parliament, the Icelandic Parliament is established, the Alþingi (anglicised as Althing or Althingi)

06-23.title: How the Qwerty Keyboard was Born 1868 Christopher
06-23.description: On June 23, 1868, How the Qwerty Keyboard was Born 1868 Christopher Latham Sholes patents the Sholes and Glidden typewriter, the first commercially successful of its kind

06-23.title: First contraceptive pill is made available for
06-23.description: On June 23, 1960, First contraceptive pill is made available for purchase in the United States

06-23.title: Hurricane Agnes becomes America's costliest natural
06-23.description: On June 23, 1972, Hurricane Agnes becomes America's costliest natural disaster, affecting 15 states with 119 deaths and $3 billion in damage

06-23.title: Solidarity leader Lech Wałęsa meets Pope John Paul II
06-23.description: On June 23, 1983, Solidarity leader Lech Wałęsa meets Pope John Paul II during papal visit to Poland

06-23.title: Britain Votes for Brexit 2016 United Kingdom votes in
06-23.description: On June 23, 2016, Britain Votes for Brexit 2016 United Kingdom votes in the Brexit referendum to leave the European Union

06-24.title: John Cabot claims parts of North America for England
06-24.description: On June 24, 1497, John Cabot claims parts of North America for England in what is now Eastern Canada, believing he has found Asia in Newfoundland

06-24.title: Henry VIII is crowned King of England in Westminster
06-24.description: On June 24, 1509, Henry VIII is crowned King of England in Westminster Abbey, London

06-24.title: Napoleon Bonaparte 's Grand Armée numbering half a
06-24.description: On June 24, 1812, Napoleon Bonaparte 's Grand Armée numbering half a million begin their invasion of Russia by crossing the Nieman River

06-24.title: US President Franklin Pierce signs the Gadsden Purchase
06-24.description: On June 24, 1853, US President Franklin Pierce signs the Gadsden Purchase, buying 29,670 square-miles (76,800 square km) from Mexico for $10 million (now southern Arizona and New Mexico)

06-24.title: First detection of an airplane using reflected radio
06-24.description: On June 24, 1930, First detection of an airplane using reflected radio waves, a precursor to radar, by US Naval Research Laboratory engineers in Anacostia, Washington, D.C.

06-24.title: The Berlin Candy Bombers 1948 Soviet Union blockades
06-24.description: On June 24, 1948, The Berlin Candy Bombers 1948 Soviet Union blockades West Berlin by stopping access by road, rail and water

06-24.title: US Supreme Court overturns Roe v. Wade
06-24.description: On June 24, 2022, US Supreme Court overturns Roe v. Wade, eliminating the constitutional right to choose abortion in a 6-3 vote [1] [2]

06-25.title: Venetian Elena Cornaro Piscopia is awarded a doctorate
06-25.description: On June 25, 1678, Venetian Elena Cornaro Piscopia is awarded a doctorate of philosophy from the University of Padua, the first woman to receive a university doctoral degree or PhD

06-25.title: Custer's Last Stand 1876 Battle of the Little Bighorn:
06-25.description: On June 25, 1876, Custer's Last Stand 1876 Battle of the Little Bighorn: US 7th Cavalry under Brevet Major General George Armstrong Custer is wiped out by Sioux and Cheyenne warriors led by Chiefs Crazy Horse and Sitting Bull in what becomes famously known as " Custer's Last Stand "

06-25.title: US President Herbert Hoover authorizes building of
06-25.description: On June 25, 1929, US President Herbert Hoover authorizes building of Boulder Dam ( Hoover Dam)

06-25.title: US President Franklin D. Roosevelt signs Executive
06-25.description: On June 25, 1941, US President Franklin D. Roosevelt signs Executive Order 8802, which forbids racial discrimination in the defense industry

06-25.title: Korean War Begins 1950 North Korea invades South Korea
06-25.description: On June 25, 1950, Korean War Begins 1950 North Korea invades South Korea, beginning the Korean War

06-25.title: WHO head Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus confirms the
06-25.description: On June 25, 2021, WHO head Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus confirms the COVID-19 Delta variant is the most transmissible to date, now present in 85 countries and spreading rapidly [1]

06-26.title: Roman Emperor Julian is killed during retreat from the
06-26.description: On June 26, 363, Roman Emperor Julian is killed during retreat from the Sassanid Empire. General Jovian is proclaimed Emperor by troops on the battlefield.

06-26.title: Battle of Fleurus 1794 Battle of Fleurus : Major
06-26.description: On June 26, 1794, Battle of Fleurus 1794 Battle of Fleurus : Major victory by forces of the First French Republic under General Jean-Baptiste Jourdan over the Coalition Army (Great Britain, Hanover, Dutch Republic, and Habsburgs) with the first use of a reconnaissance balloon

06-26.title: The first 62 recipients receive the Victoria Cross for
06-26.description: On June 26, 1857, The first 62 recipients receive the Victoria Cross for valor in the Crimean War from Queen Victoria

06-26.title: First US troops arrive in France during World War I
06-26.description: On June 26, 1917, First US troops arrive in France during World War I

06-26.title: United Nations Charter 1945 The United Nations Charter
06-26.description: On June 26, 1945, United Nations Charter 1945 The United Nations Charter is signed by 50 nations in San Francisco

06-26.title: Panama Canal's third set of locks opens for commercial
06-26.description: On June 26, 2016, Panama Canal's third set of locks opens for commercial traffic, doubling the Canal’s capacity at an estimated cost of $5.25 billion

06-27.title: Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo sets sail from the Mexican
06-27.description: On June 27, 1542, Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo sets sail from the Mexican port of Navidad on the first European voyage to explore the west coast of North America for the Spanish Empire

06-27.title: Great Northern War: Peter the Great of Russia defeats
06-27.description: On June 27, 1709, Great Northern War: Peter the Great of Russia defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava; Charles goes into exile in Bender, Ottoman Empire

06-27.title: Battle of Dettingen 1743 War of the Austrian
06-27.description: On June 27, 1743, Battle of Dettingen 1743 War of the Austrian Succession: King George II of Britain personally leads Allied troops to victory in the Battle of Dettingen in Bavaria. The last time a British monarch commanded troops in the field.

06-27.title: Russian sailors mutiny aboard the battleship
06-27.description: On June 27, 1905, Russian sailors mutiny aboard the battleship "Potemkin" and sail for Odessa

06-27.title: 1st Aerial Refueling 1923 Capt. Lowell H. Smith and
06-27.description: On June 27, 1923, 1st Aerial Refueling 1923 Capt. Lowell H. Smith and Lt. John P. Richter perform the first-ever aerial refueling in a DH-4B biplane

06-27.title: North Korean troops reach Seoul
06-27.description: On June 27, 1950, North Korean troops reach Seoul, causing the UN to ask member states to aid South Korea. Harry Truman orders the US Air Force and Navy into the Korean conflict.

06-27.title: First nuclear power station opens in Obninsk near
06-27.description: On June 27, 1954, First nuclear power station opens in Obninsk near Moscow, Russia

06-28.title: King Carlos I is elected Holy Roman Emperor Charles V
06-28.description: On June 28, 1519, King Carlos I is elected Holy Roman Emperor Charles V

06-28.title: Coronation of Queen Victoria 1838 Coronation of Queen
06-28.description: On June 28, 1838, Coronation of Queen Victoria 1838 Coronation of Queen Victoria, aged 19, during a five-hour ceremony at Westminster Abbey, London [1]

06-28.title: Why The World Went To War in 1914 1914 Franz Ferdinand
06-28.description: On June 28, 1914, Why The World Went To War in 1914 1914 Franz Ferdinand, Archduke of Austria and his wife Sophie are assassinated by Bosnian-Serb assassin Gavrilo Princip in Sarajevo, setting off a chain of alliances and events that lead to World War I

06-28.title: Signing of the Treaty of Versailles 1919 Treaty of
06-28.description: On June 28, 1919, Signing of the Treaty of Versailles 1919 Treaty of Versailles is signed in France, ending World War I and establishing the League of Nations

06-28.title: Tigray Defense Forces retake Tigray's regional capital
06-28.description: On June 28, 2021, Tigray Defense Forces retake Tigray's regional capital of Mekelle in Ethiopia's Tigray War. The Ethiopian government declares a unilateral ceasefire to save face but neither side sticks to it. [1]

06-29.title: Globe Theatre Fire 1613 Shakespeare 's Globe Theatre
06-29.description: On June 29, 1613, Globe Theatre Fire 1613 Shakespeare 's Globe Theatre in London burns down during a performance of " Henry VIII "

06-29.title: The Imperial Chinese Court issues what is essentially
06-29.description: On June 29, 1900, The Imperial Chinese Court issues what is essentially a declaration of war against foreigners in China, blaming them for hostilities and giving license to the Boxers for even greater ferocity

06-29.title: Ford introduces the revolutionary Ford-Ferguson 9N
06-29.description: On June 29, 1939, Ford introduces the revolutionary Ford-Ferguson 9N tractor incorporating Harry Ferguson 's three-point hitch system

06-29.title: 6,000 Jews are murdered in a pogrom in Bucharest,
06-29.description: On June 29, 1941, 6,000 Jews are murdered in a pogrom in Bucharest, Romania

06-29.title: Civil Rights Act of 1964 passes the US Senate after a
06-29.description: On June 29, 1964, Civil Rights Act of 1964 passes the US Senate after a 60-working-day filibuster by Southern senators

06-29.title: US planes bomb North Vietnam's capital
06-29.description: On June 29, 1966, US planes bomb North Vietnam's capital, Hanoi, and the port city of Haiphong for the first time in the Vietnam War

06-29.title: US reopens Guantanamo Naval Base to process refugees
06-29.description: On June 29, 1994, US reopens Guantanamo Naval Base to process refugees

06-30.title: Spanish conquistadors are expelled from Tenochtitlan
06-30.description: On June 30, 1520, Spanish conquistadors are expelled from Tenochtitlan following an Aztec revolt against their rule under Hernán Cortés during "La Noche Triste" (the Night of Sadness). Many soldiers drown in the escape, and Aztec emperor Moctezuma II dies in the struggle.

06-30.title: Famous debate on Charles Darwin 's theory of evolution
06-30.description: On June 30, 1860, Famous debate on Charles Darwin 's theory of evolution is held at Oxford University Museum, dominated by arguments between Thomas Henry Huxley and Bishop Samuel Wilberforce

06-30.title: The mutinous battleship Potemkin arrives in Odessa in
06-30.description: On June 30, 1905, The mutinous battleship Potemkin arrives in Odessa in the Russian Empire, where sailors take the bodies of dead crewmen ashore and join civilians in revolutionary actions during the 1905 Revolution

06-30.title: Tunguska Fireball 1908 A giant fireball
06-30.description: On June 30, 1908, Tunguska Fireball 1908 A giant fireball, most likely caused by the air burst of a large meteoroid or comet, flattens 80 million trees near the Stony Tunguska River in Yeniseysk Governorate, Russia, in the largest impact event in recorded history

06-30.title: Adolf Hitler stages a bloody purge of the Nazi party
06-30.description: On June 30, 1934, Adolf Hitler stages a bloody purge of the Nazi party in the "Night of the Long Knives"

06-30.title: British lease on the New Territories in Hong Kong
06-30.description: On June 30, 1997, British lease on the New Territories in Hong Kong expires, established by the Second Convention of Peking

07-01.title: Army of Protestant King William III of England defeats
07-01.description: On July 1, 1690, Army of Protestant King William III of England defeats deposed Roman Catholic King James II in the Battle of the Boyne at Oldbridge, Ireland

07-01.title: Joint reading of Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel
07-01.description: On July 1, 1858, Joint reading of Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace 's papers on evolution to the Linnean Society renders audience awestruck and silent [1]

07-01.title: Slavery Divide Triggers America’s Civil War 1863
07-01.description: On July 1, 1863, Slavery Divide Triggers America’s Civil War 1863 Battle of Gettysburg begins in Pennsylvania, Union forces halt Confederate General Robert E. Lee 's Army of Northern Virginia

07-01.title: The Dominion of Canada is formed
07-01.description: On July 1, 1867, The Dominion of Canada is formed, comprising the provinces of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Ontario and Quebec, with John A. Macdonald serving as the first Prime Minister

07-01.title: The British Army suffers its worst day
07-01.description: On July 1, 1916, Battle of the Somme 1916 First day of the Battle of the Somme in World War I: The British Army suffers its worst day, losing 19,240 men

07-01.title: United Kingdom returns Hong Kong and the New
07-01.description: On July 1, 1997, United Kingdom returns Hong Kong and the New Territories to People's Republic of China

07-02.title: Incident at Xuanwu Gate: Prince Li Shimin ambushes and
07-02.description: On July 2, 626, Incident at Xuanwu Gate: Prince Li Shimin ambushes and kills his rivals, the brothers Li Yuanji and Li Jiancheng, sons of Emperor Gaozu; he then forces the emperor to name him as successor to the throne

07-02.title: Continental Congress resolves "these United Colonies
07-02.description: On July 2, 1776, Continental Congress resolves "these United Colonies are, and of right ought to be Free and Independent States"

07-02.title: Bahia Independence Day: End of Portuguese rule in
07-02.description: On July 2, 1823, Bahia Independence Day: End of Portuguese rule in Brazil, with the final defeat of the Portuguese crown loyalists in the province of Bahia

07-02.title: A Salute To The Salvation Army 1865 One-time Methodist
07-02.description: On July 2, 1865, A Salute To The Salvation Army 1865 One-time Methodist Reform Church minister William Booth and his wife Catherine Booth found the East London Christian Mission, now known as The Salvation Army

07-02.title: US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Civil Rights
07-02.description: On July 2, 1964, US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Civil Rights Act and the Voting Rights Act into law

07-02.title: 1,426 pilgrims are trampled to death after a panic in
07-02.description: On July 2, 1990, 1,426 pilgrims are trampled to death after a panic in a tunnel in Mecca, Saudi Arabia

07-03.title: Battle of Adrianople: Roman Emperor Constantine I
07-03.description: On July 3, 324, Battle of Adrianople: Roman Emperor Constantine I defeats his co-emperor Licinius, who flees to Byzantium

07-03.title: Slavery Divide Triggers America’s Civil War 1863
07-03.description: On July 3, 1863, Slavery Divide Triggers America’s Civil War 1863 Battle of Gettysburg, the largest battle ever fought on the American continent, ends in a major victory for the Union during the US Civil War

07-03.title: Dow Jones publishes its first stock index
07-03.description: On July 3, 1884, Dow Jones publishes its first stock index, the Dow Jones Transportation Average

07-03.title: UK House of Commons announces that the Stone of Scone
07-03.description: On July 3, 1996, UK House of Commons announces that the Stone of Scone, aka the Stone of Destiny, used in the coronation of Scottish and subsequently English and British monarchs, will be returned to Scotland after 700 years in Westminster Abbey

07-04.title: Yippee! It's Independence Day for the U.S. 1776 US
07-04.description: On July 4, 1776, Yippee! It's Independence Day for the U.S. 1776 US Congress proclaims the Declaration of Independence and independence from Great Britain

07-04.title: Geologist James Hutton publicly reads an abstract of
07-04.description: On July 4, 1785, Geologist James Hutton publicly reads an abstract of his theory of uniformitarianism for the first time at a meeting of the Royal Society of Edinburgh

07-04.title: The Louisiana Purchase is announced to the American
07-04.description: On July 4, 1803, The Louisiana Purchase is announced to the American people by President Thomas Jefferson

07-04.title: Huskar Pit Disaster: 26 children drown while trying to
07-04.description: On July 4, 1838, Huskar Pit Disaster: 26 children drown while trying to escape flooding in the Silkstone Colliery in England. Leads to the 1842 Mines Act, which bans women and children from working underground. [1]

07-04.title: Hungarian physicist Leó Szilárd patents the
07-04.description: On July 4, 1934, Hungarian physicist Leó Szilárd patents the chain-reaction design for the atomic bomb

07-04.title: North Korea test-fires its first successful
07-04.description: On July 4, 2017, North Korea test-fires its first successful intercontinental ballistic missile into the Sea of Japan

07-04.title: US President Donald Trump signs his 'One Big Beautiful
07-04.description: On July 4, 2025, US President Donald Trump signs his 'One Big Beautiful Bill' into law, narrowly passed by Senate, 51-50, and by House of Representatives, 218-214; 5 Republicans joined all Democrats in opposition [1] [2]

07-05.title: Isaac Newton 's great work
07-05.description: On July 5, 1687, Isaac Newton 's great work, "Principia," is published by the Royal Society in England, outlining his laws of motion and universal gravitation

07-05.title: Seven provinces declare independence from Spain
07-05.description: On July 5, 1811, Venezuela Declares Independence 1811 Venezuelan Declaration of Independence : Seven provinces declare independence from Spain

07-05.title: Fugitive slave Frederick Douglass delivers his 'What
07-05.description: On July 5, 1852, Fugitive slave Frederick Douglass delivers his 'What to the Slave Is the Fourth of July?' speech to the Ladies' Anti-Slavery Society in Rochester, condemning the celebration as a hypocritical sham

07-05.title: US Secret Service begins operating under the Treasury
07-05.description: On July 5, 1865, US Secret Service begins operating under the Treasury Department

07-05.title: Amazon.com is founded by Jeff Bezos in Bellevue
07-05.description: On July 5, 1994, Amazon.com is founded by Jeff Bezos in Bellevue, Washington

07-05.title: First direct presidential election held in Indonesia
07-05.description: On July 5, 2004, First direct presidential election held in Indonesia, eventually won by Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono

07-06.title: Black Death 1348 Papal bull of Pope Clement VI issued
07-06.description: On July 6, 1348, Black Death 1348 Papal bull of Pope Clement VI issued during the Black Death states Jews are not to blame and encourages their protection

07-06.title: Declaration of the Causes and Necessity of Taking Up
07-06.description: On July 6, 1775, Declaration of the Causes and Necessity of Taking Up Arms 1775 Congress issues the " Declaration of the Causes and Necessity of Taking up Arms ", written by Thomas Jefferson and John Dickinson and lists American grievances but denies any intent to be independent

07-06.title: US Congress unanimously resolves to name the US
07-06.description: On July 6, 1785, US Congress unanimously resolves to name the US currency the "dollar" and adopts decimal coinage

07-06.title: Louis Pasteur successfully gives an anti-rabies
07-06.description: On July 6, 1885, Louis Pasteur successfully gives an anti-rabies vaccine to 9-year-old Joseph Meister, saving his life

07-06.title: Soviet Union Founded 1923 The Central Executive
07-06.description: On July 6, 1923, Soviet Union Founded 1923 The Central Executive Committee accepts the Treaty of Union, signed in Moscow in December 1922, and the Russian Empire becomes the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics

07-06.title: Nigerian Civil War erupts as Nigerian forces invade
07-06.description: On July 6, 1967, Nigerian Civil War erupts as Nigerian forces invade the secessionist state of Biafra

07-06.title: California passes the first no-fault divorce law in
07-06.description: On July 6, 1970, California passes the first no-fault divorce law in the United States

07-07.title: Hernán Cortés and the Tlaxcalans defeat a numerically
07-07.description: On July 7, 1520, Hernán Cortés and the Tlaxcalans defeat a numerically superior Aztec force in the Battle of Otumba in Mexico

07-07.title: Napoleon Meets the Tsar 1807 French Emperor Napoléon
07-07.description: On July 7, 1807, Napoleon Meets the Tsar 1807 French Emperor Napoléon Bonaparte and Russian Tsar Alexander I meet on a raft in the middle of the Neman River and sign the first Treaty of Tilsit

07-07.title: Japanese and Chinese troops clash at the Marco Polo
07-07.description: On July 7, 1937, Japanese and Chinese troops clash at the Marco Polo Bridge near Beijing, beginning the Second Sino-Japanese War

07-07.title: Alleged and disputed Roswell, New Mexico UFO incident
07-07.description: On July 7, 1947, Alleged and disputed Roswell, New Mexico UFO incident

07-07.title: Coordinated terrorist bomb blasts strike London's
07-07.description: On July 7, 2005, Coordinated terrorist bomb blasts strike London's public transport system during the morning rush hour, killing 52 and injuring 700

07-07.title: Influenced by global Live 8 concerts
07-07.description: On July 7, 2005, Influenced by global Live 8 concerts, G8 leaders pledge to double 2004 levels of aid to Africa from US$25 billion to US$50 billion by the year 2010 and to drop the debt owed by 18 of the most heavily indebted poor countries. Results are mixed. [1]

07-08.title: First Crusade: 15,000 starving Christian soldiers
07-08.description: On July 8, 1099, First Crusade: 15,000 starving Christian soldiers march in religious procession around Jerusalem as its Muslim defenders look on

07-08.title: Portuguese navigator Vasco da Gama departs on his
07-08.description: On July 8, 1497, Portuguese navigator Vasco da Gama departs on his first voyage and becomes the first European to reach India by sea

07-08.title: Independent Vermont introduces a new constitution
07-08.description: On July 8, 1777, Independent Vermont introduces a new constitution prohibiting slavery

07-08.title: Dr. Benjamin Waterhouse gives the first cowpox
07-08.description: On July 8, 1800, Dr. Benjamin Waterhouse gives the first cowpox vaccination in the United States to his son to prevent smallpox

07-08.title: Commander Perry and the Opening of Japan 1853
07-08.description: On July 8, 1853, Commander Perry and the Opening of Japan 1853 Commodore Matthew C. Perry sails his frigate Susquehanna into Tokyo Bay, opening Japan to Western influence and trade

07-08.title: 500th anniversary of the Russian Orthodox Church is
07-08.description: On July 8, 1948, 500th anniversary of the Russian Orthodox Church is celebrated in Moscow

07-08.title: South Africa's Prohibition of Mixed Marriages Act
07-08.description: On July 8, 1949, South Africa's Prohibition of Mixed Marriages Act commences, prohibiting marriage or sexual relationships between White people and people of other races [1]

07-09.title: Turko-Mongol ruler Tamerlane ( Timur ) destroys Baghdad
07-09.description: On July 9, 1401, Turko-Mongol ruler Tamerlane ( Timur ) destroys Baghdad, killing 20,000 people

07-09.title: King Gustav III leads Swedish naval forces to victory
07-09.description: On July 9, 1790, King Gustav III leads Swedish naval forces to victory over the Russian Baltic fleet during the Second Battle of Svensksund, destroying or capturing one-third of the Russian ships and ending the Russo-Swedish War

07-09.title: Louisiana and South Carolina are the last states to
07-09.description: On July 9, 1868, Louisiana and South Carolina are the last states to ratify the 14th Amendment to the United States Constitution, guaranteeing civil rights

07-09.title: Surgeon Daniel Hale Williams performs the first
07-09.description: On July 9, 1893, Surgeon Daniel Hale Williams performs the first successful open-heart surgery when he repairs the torn pericardium of knife wound patient James Cornish, without the use of penicillin or blood transfusion [1]

07-09.title: HMS Vanguard Disaster 1917 British battleship HMS
07-09.description: On July 9, 1917, HMS Vanguard Disaster 1917 British battleship HMS Vanguard explodes at Scapa Flow due to an internal explosion caused by faulty cordite, killing 804 crew members

07-09.title: National Security Advisor Henry Kissinger secretly
07-09.description: On July 9, 1971, National Security Advisor Henry Kissinger secretly visits the People's Republic of China to negotiate a detente between the US and China

07-09.title: The African Union is established in Addis Ababa
07-09.description: On July 9, 2002, The African Union is established in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. The first chairman is Thabo Mbeki, President of South Africa.

07-09.title: Iraqi Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi proclaims victory
07-09.description: On July 9, 2017, Iraqi Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi proclaims victory over Islamic State forces in Mosul

07-10.title: Hitler Will Have to Break Us or Lose the War 1940
07-10.description: On July 10, 1940, Hitler Will Have to Break Us or Lose the War 1940 Battle of Britain begins as Nazi forces attack shipping convoys in the English Channel

07-10.title: The Sinking of the Rainbow Warrior 1985 French foreign
07-10.description: On July 10, 1985, The Sinking of the Rainbow Warrior 1985 French foreign intelligence agents blow up the Greenpeace flagship Rainbow Warrior in Auckland harbor, New Zealand, to prevent it from interfering with French nuclear tests in the South Pacific. Dutch photographer Fernando Pereira is killed.

07-10.title: Boris Yeltsin is sworn in as the first elected
07-10.description: On July 10, 1991, Boris Yeltsin is sworn in as the first elected President of the Russian Federation

07-10.title: The American Episcopal Church becomes the first to
07-10.description: On July 10, 2012, The American Episcopal Church becomes the first to approve a rite for blessing gay marriages

07-11.title: Chinese fleet commander Zheng He sets sail to the
07-11.description: On July 11, 1405, Chinese fleet commander Zheng He sets sail to the Spice Islands on his first major expedition, leading 208 vessels, including 62 treasure ships with 27,800 sailors

07-11.title: Pope Clement VII excommunicates England's King Henry
07-11.description: On July 11, 1533, Pope Clement VII excommunicates England's King Henry VIII
