07-11.title: English poet John Keats writes "In the Cottage Where
07-11.description: On July 11, 1818, English poet John Keats writes "In the Cottage Where Burns is Born," "Lines Written in the Highlands," and "Gadfly"

07-11.title: Kate Edger becomes New Zealand’s first woman graduate
07-11.description: On July 11, 1877, Kate Edger becomes New Zealand’s first woman graduate and first woman in the British Empire to earn a Bachelor of Arts

07-11.title: The Balloon Expedition to the North Pole 1897 Salomon
07-11.description: On July 11, 1897, The Balloon Expedition to the North Pole 1897 Salomon August Andrée and crew leave Spitsbergen in northern Norway by balloon, heading for the North Pole

07-11.title: Franklin Roosevelt announces he will run for a fourth
07-11.description: On July 11, 1944, Franklin Roosevelt announces he will run for a fourth term as President of the United States

07-11.title: More than 8,000 Bosnian Muslim men and boys are
07-11.description: On July 11, 1995, More than 8,000 Bosnian Muslim men and boys are massacred by Bosnian Serbs after they overrun the UN "safe haven" of Srebrenica on directive of Radovan Karadžić

07-12.title: Minamoto Yoritomo becomes Seii Taishōgun
07-12.description: On July 12, 1192, Minamoto Yoritomo becomes Seii Taishōgun, the first ruling shogun in the history of Japan and de facto ruler

07-12.title: Britain's King Charles II ratifies Habeas Corpus Act
07-12.description: On July 12, 1679, Britain's King Charles II ratifies Habeas Corpus Act allowing prisoners' right to a court review of the justification for their imprisonment

07-12.title: French Revolution: The Civil Constitution of the
07-12.description: On July 12, 1790, French Revolution: The Civil Constitution of the Clergy is adopted, putting the Catholic Church in France under the control of the state

07-12.title: Former United States Secretary of the Treasury
07-12.description: On July 12, 1804, Former United States Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton dies after being shot in a pistol duel the previous day by Vice President Aaron Burr, near Weehaken, New Jersey

07-12.title: British forces invade the Waikato in New Zealand
07-12.description: On July 12, 1863, British forces invade the Waikato in New Zealand, home of the Māori King Movement, beginning a new phase of the New Zealand Wars between the colonial government and allied Māori tribes on one side and Māori on the other [1]

07-12.title: 150,000 Ulstermen gather and resolve to resist Irish
07-12.description: On July 12, 1913, 150,000 Ulstermen gather and resolve to resist Irish Home Rule by force of arms as the British Liberals promise the Irish nationalists Home Rule, making civil war appear imminent

07-12.title: World War II: Battle of Prokhorovka - Russia defeats
07-12.description: On July 12, 1943, World War II: Battle of Prokhorovka - Russia defeats German forces in one of the largest ever tank battles

07-12.title: US Surgeon General Leroy Burney links smoking to lung
07-12.description: On July 12, 1957, US Surgeon General Leroy Burney links smoking to lung cancer

07-13.title: Captain James Cook begins his second voyage to the
07-13.description: On July 13, 1772, Captain James Cook begins his second voyage to the South Seas aboard HMS Resolution to search for Terra Australis (Southern Continent)

07-13.title: Source of Mississippi River discovered by American
07-13.description: On July 13, 1832, Source of Mississippi River discovered by American geographer Henry Schoolcraft

07-13.title: Swedish-American inventor John Ericsson files for a
07-13.description: On July 13, 1835, Swedish-American inventor John Ericsson files for a patent for his screw propeller design

07-13.title: King Wilhelm I of Prussia sends the "Emser Depeche
07-13.description: On July 13, 1870, King Wilhelm I of Prussia sends the "Emser Depeche (Ems Telegram)" to Otto von Bismarck who publishes an edited version to purposely offend the French government precipitating the Franco-German War

07-13.title: A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada founds the
07-13.description: On July 13, 1966, A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada founds the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (Hare Krishna movement) in New York City

07-13.title: Former US President Donald Trump survives an
07-13.description: On July 13, 2024, Former US President Donald Trump survives an assassination attempt at an outdoor campaign rally in rural Butler, Pennsylvania; gunman Thomas Matthew Crooks fires 6 to 8 shots killing one spectator, critically wounding two, and hits Trump in the ear with a bullet before being killed by a Secret Service sniper

07-14.title: Bastille Day 1789 Bastille Day - the French Revolution
07-14.description: On July 14, 1789, Bastille Day 1789 Bastille Day - the French Revolution begins with the storming of the Bastille prison in Paris, now celebrated as France's National Day

07-14.title: US Sedition Act prohibits "any false
07-14.description: On July 14, 1798, US Sedition Act prohibits "any false, scandalous, and malicious writing" about the government

07-14.title: First public demonstration of ice made via
07-14.description: On July 14, 1850, First public demonstration of ice made via refrigeration by Florida physician John Gorrie

07-14.title: All non-Nazi political parties are banned in Germany
07-14.description: On July 14, 1933, All non-Nazi political parties are banned in Germany

07-14.title: 386BSD is released by Lynne Jolitz and William Jolitz
07-14.description: On July 14, 1992, 386BSD is released by Lynne Jolitz and William Jolitz, starting the open source operating system revolution. Linus Torvalds releases Linux soon afterwards.

07-15.title: City of Jerusalem is captured and plundered by
07-15.description: On July 15, 1099, City of Jerusalem is captured and plundered by Christian forces during the First Crusade

07-15.title: Poll Tax Triggers the Peasants' Revolt 1381 John Ball
07-15.description: On July 15, 1381, Poll Tax Triggers the Peasants' Revolt 1381 John Ball, a leader in the Peasants' Revolt, is hanged, drawn and quartered in the presence of Richard II of England

07-15.title: Battle of Grunwald 1410 Battle of Grunwald
07-15.description: On July 15, 1410, Battle of Grunwald 1410 Battle of Grunwald (First Battle of Tannenburg, Battle of Žalgiris), one of Medieval Europe's largest battles during the Polish-Lithuanian Teutonic War. Polish King Władysław Jagiełło and Lithuanian Grand Duke Vytautas defeat Teutonic Ulrich von Jungingen.

07-15.title: Rosetta Stone 1799 The Rosetta Stone is found in the
07-15.description: On July 15, 1799, Rosetta Stone 1799 The Rosetta Stone is found in the Egyptian village of Rosetta by French Captain Pierre-François Bouchard during Napoleon 's Egyptian Campaign

07-15.title: Eighteen Nobel laureates sign the Mainau Declaration
07-15.description: On July 15, 1955, Eighteen Nobel laureates sign the Mainau Declaration against nuclear weapons, later co-signed by 34 more laureates

07-16.title: Islamic Era begins: Muhammad and his followers begin
07-16.description: On July 16, 622, Islamic Era begins: Muhammad and his followers begin migration from Mecca to Medina (Hijra)

07-16.title: The Great Schism between Western and Eastern churches
07-16.description: On July 16, 1054, The Great Schism between Western and Eastern churches begins when Roman Cardinal Humbert issues a bull of excommunication against Cerularius, Patriarch of Constantinople, on the altar of the Hagia Sophia in Constantinople

07-16.title: The Protestant Reformation 1519 Public debate between
07-16.description: On July 16, 1519, The Protestant Reformation 1519 Public debate between Martin Luther and theologian Johann Eck at Pleissenburg Castle in Liepzig, during which Luther denies the divine right of the Pope

07-16.title: La Paz, Bolivia, declares its independence from the
07-16.description: On July 16, 1809, La Paz, Bolivia, declares its independence from the Spanish Crown and forms the Junta Tuitiva led by Pedro Domingo Murillo, the first independent government in Spanish America

07-16.title: Adolf Hitler orders preparations for the invasion of
07-16.description: On July 16, 1940, Adolf Hitler orders preparations for the invasion of Britain (Operation Sealion)

07-16.title: Manhattan Project 1945 First test detonation of an
07-16.description: On July 16, 1945, Manhattan Project 1945 First test detonation of an atomic bomb occurs at Trinity Site, Alamogordo, New Mexico, as part of the US Manhattan Project

07-17.title: Six residents of Carthage
07-17.description: On July 17, 180, Six residents of Carthage, North Africa, are executed for being Christian, the earliest recorded instance of Christianity in the region

07-17.title: Siege of Constantinople begins during the Fourth
07-17.description: On July 17, 1203, Siege of Constantinople begins during the Fourth Crusade, as Roman Catholic Crusaders, aboard a Venetian fleet, attack the city

07-17.title: Empress Catherine II becomes Tsarina of Russia after
07-17.description: On July 17, 1762, Empress Catherine II becomes Tsarina of Russia after the death and rumored assassination of Tsar Peter III

07-17.title: Execution of the Romanovs 1918 The Romanov royal
07-17.description: On July 17, 1918, Execution of the Romanovs 1918 The Romanov royal family and several of their retainers are executed by a Bolshevik firing squad in the basement of Ipatiev House in Yekaterinburg, Russia

07-17.title: Spanish generals Francisco Franco and Emilio Mola lead
07-17.description: On July 17, 1936, Spanish generals Francisco Franco and Emilio Mola lead a right-wing uprising, starting the Spanish Civil War

07-17.title: Potsdam Conference 1945 Leaders Harry Truman
07-17.description: On July 17, 1945, Potsdam Conference 1945 Leaders Harry Truman, Joseph Stalin and Winston Churchill hold their first post World War II meeting at the Potsdam Conference

07-17.title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 is shot down over Eastern
07-17.description: On July 17, 2014, Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 is shot down over Eastern Ukraine by a Buk surface-to-air missile launched from pro-Russian separatist-controlled territory, killing all 283 passengers and 15 crew on board

07-18.title: Great Fire of Rome begins under the Emperor Nero
07-18.description: On July 18, 64, Great Fire of Rome begins under the Emperor Nero

07-18.title: Florence Cathedral 1334 Bishop of Florence blesses the
07-18.description: On July 18, 1334, Florence Cathedral 1334 Bishop of Florence blesses the first foundation stone for the new campanile (bell tower) of the Florence Cathedral, designed by artist Giotto di Bondone

07-18.title: Adolf Hitler publishes Mein Kampf
07-18.description: On July 18, 1925, Adolf Hitler publishes Mein Kampf, original title was the catchy "Four and a Half Years (of Struggle) Against Lies, Stupidity and Cowardice"

07-18.title: Spanish Civil War: General Francisco Franco issues
07-18.description: On July 18, 1936, Spanish Civil War: General Francisco Franco issues manifesto and leads an uprising in the Spanish army stationed in Morocco

07-18.title: Kim Jong-un is officially appointed Supreme Leader of
07-18.description: On July 18, 2012, Kim Jong-un is officially appointed Supreme Leader of North Korea and given the rank of Marshal in the Korean People's Army

07-18.title: Detroit, Michigan, files for bankruptcy, becoming the
07-18.description: On July 18, 2013, Detroit, Michigan, files for bankruptcy, becoming the largest US municipal bankruptcy at $18.5 billion

07-18.title: Canadian Wildfires 2023 Wildfire season in British
07-18.description: On July 18, 2023, Canadian Wildfires 2023 Wildfire season in British Columbia becomes the most destructive on record, burning 14,100 square kilometers of land and surpassing the 2018 record [1]

07-19.title: Astronomer Johannes Kepler has an epiphany and
07-19.description: On July 19, 1595, Astronomer Johannes Kepler has an epiphany and develops his theory of the geometrical basis of the universe while teaching in Graz, Austria

07-19.title: SS Great Britain 1843 Steamship SS Great Britain is
07-19.description: On July 19, 1843, SS Great Britain 1843 Steamship SS Great Britain is launched, designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, it is the first ocean-going craft with an iron hull or screw propeller and the largest vessel afloat in the world

07-19.title: American Women Demand Their Rights 1848 First US
07-19.description: On July 19, 1848, American Women Demand Their Rights 1848 First US women's rights convention is held in Seneca Falls, NY, organized by Elizabeth Cady Stanton and Lucretia Mott

07-19.title: Sioux Indian Chief Sitting Bull surrenders to US
07-19.description: On July 19, 1881, Sioux Indian Chief Sitting Bull surrenders to US federal troops at Fort Buford in the Territory of Montana [1] [2]

07-19.title: British PM Winston Churchill launches his "V for
07-19.description: On July 19, 1941, British PM Winston Churchill launches his "V for Victory" campaign

07-20.title: Scottish explorer Alexander Mackenzie completes the
07-20.description: On July 20, 1793, Scottish explorer Alexander Mackenzie completes the first European east-to-west crossing of America north of Mexico

07-20.title: Congresswoman Alice Mary Robertson becomes the first
07-20.description: On July 20, 1921, Congresswoman Alice Mary Robertson becomes the first woman to preside over the floor of US House of Representatives

07-20.title: Apollo 11 Bootprint 1969 NASA's Apollo 11 lunar module
07-20.description: On July 20, 1969, Apollo 11 Bootprint 1969 NASA's Apollo 11 lunar module, carrying Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin, lands on the surface of the Moon. Seven hours later, Armstrong becomes the first person to step on the moon at 10:56 pm EDT, and Aldrin joins him shortly after. Michael Collins remains in orbit in the command module. [1]

07-20.title: Viking 1 lands on Mars at Chryse Planitia
07-20.description: On July 20, 1976, Viking 1 lands on Mars at Chryse Planitia, the first successful Martian landing

07-20.title: China announces a plan against "foreign garbage
07-20.description: On July 20, 2017, China announces a plan against "foreign garbage," banning the import of 24 categories of plastic and recyclable waste from 2018

07-21.title: one of the Seven Wonders of the World
07-21.description: On July 21, BC Herostratus sets fire to the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus, one of the Seven Wonders of the World

07-21.title: An earthquake on Crete followed by a tsunami around
07-21.description: On July 21, 365, An earthquake on Crete followed by a tsunami around the Eastern Mediterranean allegedly destroys Alexandria

07-21.title: First Battle of Bull Run [Battle of First Manassas]
07-21.description: On July 21, 1861, First Battle of Bull Run [Battle of First Manassas], the first major battle of the US Civil War, is fought near Manassas, Virginia, and ends in a Confederate victory

07-21.title: After 13 years, the 4,607-mile Trans-Siberian Railway
07-21.description: On July 21, 1904, After 13 years, the 4,607-mile Trans-Siberian Railway is completed

07-21.title: Test of Time for the Date of Creation 1925 John T.
07-21.description: On July 21, 1925, Test of Time for the Date of Creation 1925 John T. Scopes is found guilty of teaching evolution in the “ Scopes monkey trial ” in Dayton, Tennessee, fined $100 and costs

07-21.title: Geneva Accords for Indochina are signed
07-21.description: On July 21, 1954, Geneva Accords for Indochina are signed, dividing French colonial territories into the countries of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam (North Vietnam), the State of Vietnam (South Vietnam), Cambodia, and Laos

07-21.title: Aswan High Dam opens in Egypt
07-21.description: On July 21, 1970, Aswan High Dam opens in Egypt, enabling human control of the flooding of the Nile

07-21.title: On This Day changes its domain name and brand from
07-21.description: On July 21, 2015, On This Day changes its domain name and brand from HistoryOrb.com to OnThisDay.com

07-21.title: US President Joe Biden abandons his campaign for
07-21.description: On July 21, 2024, US President Joe Biden abandons his campaign for re-election and endorses Vice President Kamala Harris [1]

07-22.title: Godfrey of Bouillon is elected the first Defender of
07-22.description: On July 22, 1099, Godfrey of Bouillon is elected the first Defender of the Holy Sepulchre of the Kingdom of Jerusalem during the First Crusade

07-22.title: Siege of Belgrade 1456 Hungarian army under John
07-22.description: On July 22, 1456, Siege of Belgrade 1456 Hungarian army under John Hunyadi defeats the forces of Ottoman Sultan Mehmed II and ends the Siege of Belgrade (Nándorfehérvár), halting Ottoman expansion in Europe for 70 years

07-22.title: First Congress of Vienna settles issues between Poland
07-22.description: On July 22, 1515, First Congress of Vienna settles issues between Poland and the Holy Roman Empire, demonstrating the Habsburgs' growing influence

07-22.title: 300,000 Jews from the Warsaw Ghetto are sent to
07-22.description: On July 22, 1942, 300,000 Jews from the Warsaw Ghetto are sent to Treblinka Extermination Camp

07-22.title: Sarawak achieves independence from British colonial
07-22.description: On July 22, 1963, Sarawak achieves independence from British colonial rule

07-22.title: Norway is the victim of twin terror attacks
07-22.description: On July 22, 2011, Norway is the victim of twin terror attacks, a bomb blast targeting government buildings in central Oslo and a massacre at a youth camp on the island of Utøya

07-23.title: King Louis XVI of France and his Foreign Minister
07-23.description: On July 23, 1777, King Louis XVI of France and his Foreign Minister clandestinely agree to supply the United States with munitions during the American Revolution

07-23.title: 1st U.S. Typographer 1829 William Austin Burt patents
07-23.description: On July 23, 1829, 1st U.S. Typographer 1829 William Austin Burt patents America's first typewriter, the typographer

07-23.title: Union Act passed by the British Parliament
07-23.description: On July 23, 1840, Union Act passed by the British Parliament, uniting Upper and Lower Canada

07-23.title: Bretton Woods Conference ends
07-23.description: On July 23, 1944, Bretton Woods Conference ends, establishes the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, later part of the World Bank, and the International Monetary Fund

07-23.title: Comet Hale-Bopp is discovered and becomes visible to
07-23.description: On July 23, 1995, Comet Hale-Bopp is discovered and becomes visible to the naked eye nearly a year later

07-24.title: French explorer Jacques Cartier claims for France the
07-24.description: On July 24, 1534, French explorer Jacques Cartier claims for France the lands around Gaspé by erecting a 30-foot cross at Pointe-Penouille [1]

07-24.title: Mary, Queen of Scots, is forced to abdicate; her
07-24.description: On July 24, 1567, Mary, Queen of Scots, is forced to abdicate; her 1-year-old son becomes King James VI of Scotland

07-24.title: Benjamin Bonneville leads the first wagon train across
07-24.description: On July 24, 1832, Benjamin Bonneville leads the first wagon train across the Rocky Mountains through Wyoming's South Pass

07-24.title: Hiram Bingham Discovers Machu Picchu 1911 American
07-24.description: On July 24, 1911, Hiram Bingham Discovers Machu Picchu 1911 American explorer Hiram Bingham rediscovers Machu Picchu, the Lost City of the Incas

07-24.title: Operation Gomorrah: RAF begins bombing Hamburg (until
07-24.description: On July 24, 1943, Operation Gomorrah: RAF begins bombing Hamburg (until 3rd August), creating a firestorm and killing 42,600 people

07-24.title: Global warming is the fastest in 2
07-24.description: On July 24, 2019, Global warming is the fastest in 2,000 years and scientific consensus that humans are the cause is at 99%, according to three major reports published in journals "Nature" and "Nature Geoscience"

07-25.title: Constantine I is proclaimed Roman Emperor by his troops
07-25.description: On July 25, 306, Constantine I is proclaimed Roman Emperor by his troops

07-25.title: English engineer George Stephenson introduces his
07-25.description: On July 25, 1814, English engineer George Stephenson introduces his first steam locomotive, a traveling engine designed for hauling coal on the Killingworth wagonway, named Blücher

07-25.title: Fall of Benito Mussolini 1943 Benito Mussolini is
07-25.description: On July 25, 1943, Fall of Benito Mussolini 1943 Benito Mussolini is dismissed as Italian Prime Minister and arrested on the authority of King Victor Emmanuel III

07-25.title: World War II: Operation Spring is one of Canada's
07-25.description: On July 25, 1944, World War II: Operation Spring is one of Canada's bloodiest days, with 1,444 casualties, including 441 killed in a single day

07-25.title: Scientists announce the first human stem cells to be
07-25.description: On July 25, 1997, Scientists announce the first human stem cells to be cultured in a laboratory using tissue taken from aborted human embryos

07-26.title: Battle of Siffin occurs during the first Muslim civil
07-26.description: On July 26, 657, Battle of Siffin occurs during the first Muslim civil war between Ali ibn Abi Talib and Muawiyah I beside the Euphrates River

07-26.title: Francisco Pizarro receives a royal charter for the
07-26.description: On July 26, 1519, Francisco Pizarro receives a royal charter for the west coast of South America

07-26.title: How 200 Conquistadors Conquered an Empire of 10
07-26.description: On July 26, 1533, How 200 Conquistadors Conquered an Empire of 10 Million 1533 Francisco Pizarro orders the death of the last Sapa Inca Emperor, Atahualpa

07-26.title: The Surrey Iron Railway
07-26.description: On July 26, 1803, The Surrey Iron Railway, arguably the world's first public railway, opens in south London

07-26.title: US Attorney General Charles Joseph Bonaparte issues an
07-26.description: On July 26, 1908, US Attorney General Charles Joseph Bonaparte issues an order to immediately staff the Office of the Chief Examiner (later renamed the Federal Bureau of Investigation)

07-26.title: Potsdam Declaration 1945 US
07-26.description: On July 26, 1945, Potsdam Declaration 1945 US, Britain, and China demand the unconditional surrender of Japan during World War II in the Declaration of Potsdam

07-26.title: Fidel Castro leads a failed attack on the Moncada
07-26.description: On July 26, 1953, Fidel Castro leads a failed attack on the Moncada Barracks, intended to spark a revolution in Cuba

07-27.title: Walter Raleigh brings the first tobacco to England
07-27.description: On July 27, 1586, Walter Raleigh brings the first tobacco to England from Virginia

07-27.title: Battle of Killiecrankie: Jacobite Scottish Highlanders
07-27.description: On July 27, 1689, Battle of Killiecrankie: Jacobite Scottish Highlanders under Viscount Dundee defeat royalist forces under General Hugh Mackay

07-27.title: US Congress establishes the Department of Foreign
07-27.description: On July 27, 1789, US Congress establishes the Department of Foreign Affairs, now referred to as the State Department

07-27.title: Landing of the Atlantic Cable 1866 First transatlantic
07-27.description: On July 27, 1866, Landing of the Atlantic Cable 1866 First transatlantic telegraph cable comes ashore at Heart's Content, Newfoundland, after being laid out 1,686 miles by Isambard Kingdom Brunel 's Great Eastern steamship

07-27.title: Frederick Banting and Charles Best isolate insulin at
07-27.description: On July 27, 1921, Frederick Banting and Charles Best isolate insulin at the University of Toronto

07-28.title: Execution of Maximilien Robespierre 1794 French
07-28.description: On July 28, 1794, Execution of Maximilien Robespierre 1794 French Revolutionary figure Maximilien Robespierre and 22 other leaders of "the Terror" are guillotined to thunderous cheers in Paris

07-28.title: Austria-Hungary decides against mediation and declares
07-28.description: On July 28, 1914, Austria-Hungary decides against mediation and declares war on Serbia, the first declaration of war of World War I

07-28.title: Silent Parade organized by James Weldon Johnson
07-28.description: On July 28, 1917, Silent Parade organized by James Weldon Johnson, 10,000 African Americans march on Fifth Avenue in NYC to protest against lynching

07-28.title: Operation Gomorrah: RAF bombing over Hamburg causes a
07-28.description: On July 28, 1943, Operation Gomorrah: RAF bombing over Hamburg causes a firestorm that kills 42,600 German civilians

07-28.title: Tangshan Earthquake
07-28.description: On July 28, 1976, Tangshan Earthquake, 7.6 in magnitude, kills over 300,000 in northern China, the largest loss of life from an earthquake in the 20th century

07-28.title: The Provisional Irish Republican Army calls an end to
07-28.description: On July 28, 2005, The Provisional Irish Republican Army calls an end to its 30-year-long armed campaign in Northern Ireland

07-29.title: Defeat of the Spanish Armada 1588 The "Invincible"
07-29.description: On July 29, 1588, Defeat of the Spanish Armada 1588 The "Invincible" Spanish Armada is sighted approaching England, and several skirmishes follow, forcing the invading fleet to make a long and costly retreat around Scotland and Ireland

07-29.title: Samuel de Champlain shoots and kills two Iroquois
07-29.description: On July 29, 1609, Samuel de Champlain shoots and kills two Iroquois chiefs at Ticonderoga, New York, setting the stage for French-Iroquois conflicts for the next 150 years

07-29.title: Irish Potato Famine: Tipperary Revolt - an
07-29.description: On July 29, 1848, Irish Potato Famine: Tipperary Revolt - an unsuccessful nationalist revolt against British rule is put down by police

07-29.title: US Secretary of War William Howard Taft makes a secret
07-29.description: On July 29, 1905, US Secretary of War William Howard Taft makes a secret agreement with Japanese Prime Minister Katsura, agreeing to give Japan free rein in Korea in return for non-interference with the US in the Philippines

07-29.title: Adolf Hitler becomes leader of the National Socialist
07-29.description: On July 29, 1921, Adolf Hitler becomes leader of the National Socialist German Workers Party

07-30.title: but most of his army subsequently deserts
07-30.description: On July 30, BC Battle of Alexandria: Mark Antony achieves a minor victory over Octavian, but most of his army subsequently deserts, leading to Octavian's invasion of Egypt

07-30.title: Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I Barbarossa is crowned
07-30.description: On July 30, 1178, Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I Barbarossa is crowned King of Burgundy

07-30.title: First Defenestration of Prague: Anti-Catholic Hussites
07-30.description: On July 30, 1419, First Defenestration of Prague: Anti-Catholic Hussites, followers of executed reformer Jan Hus, storm Prague Town Hall and throw the judge, mayor, and several city council members out the windows. They die in the fall or are killed by the crowd outside.

07-30.title: House of Burgesses in Virginia forms
07-30.description: On July 30, 1619, House of Burgesses in Virginia forms, first elected American governing body

07-30.title: Indian Wars: Chief Pocatello of the Shoshone tribe
07-30.description: On July 30, 1863, Indian Wars: Chief Pocatello of the Shoshone tribe signs the Treaty of Box Elder, promising to stop harassing emigrant trails in southern Idaho and northern Utah

07-30.title: World's first oil tanker
07-30.description: On July 30, 1869, World's first oil tanker, "The Charles," departs the United States for Europe, carrying 7,000 barrels of oil

07-30.title: First Penguin Books 1935 First Penguin Books published
07-30.description: On July 30, 1935, First Penguin Books 1935 First Penguin Books published, starting the paperback revolution

07-30.title: Soviet Politburo issues NKVD Order No. 00447 during
07-30.description: On July 30, 1937, Soviet Politburo issues NKVD Order No. 00447 during the Great Purge to repress property-owning kulaks and anti-Soviets; 269,100 are arrested, with 76,000 executed

07-31.title: Pilgrim Fathers depart Leiden
07-31.description: On July 31, 1620, Pilgrim Fathers depart Leiden, Netherlands, for England on their way to America

07-31.title: Battle of Passchendaele 1917 World War I: Battle of
07-31.description: On July 31, 1917, Battle of Passchendaele 1917 World War I: Battle of Passchendaele (Third Battle of Ypres) begins and lasts until November 6, 1917, causing approximately 500,000 casualties

07-31.title: Israel welcomes its one-millionth immigrant
07-31.description: On July 31, 1961, Israel welcomes its one-millionth immigrant

07-31.title: Black Tot Day 1970 Black Tot Day : the last day of the
07-31.description: On July 31, 1970, Black Tot Day 1970 Black Tot Day : the last day of the officially sanctioned rum ration in the Royal Navy, which started in 1740

07-31.title: Operation Banner, the presence of the British Army in
07-31.description: On July 31, 2007, Operation Banner, the presence of the British Army in Northern Ireland, comes to an end as the longest-running British Army operation ever

08-01.title: Justinian I becomes the sole ruler of the Byzantine
08-01.description: On August 1, 527, Justinian I becomes the sole ruler of the Byzantine Empire after the death of his uncle Justin I

08-01.title: Norman Invasion of England 1086 Results of the
08-01.description: On August 1, 1086, Norman Invasion of England 1086 Results of the Domesday inquiry are presented to William the Conqueror in Salisbury (the date of compilation and the Great Domesday are historically contestable)

08-01.title: Oxygen Discovered! 1774 English chemist Joseph
08-01.description: On August 1, 1774, Oxygen Discovered! 1774 English chemist Joseph Priestley discovers oxygen by isolating it in its gaseous state

08-01.title: Britain Abolishes the Slave Trade 1834 Slavery
08-01.description: On August 1, 1834, Britain Abolishes the Slave Trade 1834 Slavery Abolition Act 1833 comes into effect, abolishing slavery across the British Empire

08-01.title: Nuclear-powered submarine USS Nautilus begins the
08-01.description: On August 1, 1958, Nuclear-powered submarine USS Nautilus begins the first transit of the North Pole in Operation Sunshine

08-01.title: Former US President Donald Trump is indicted by
08-01.description: On August 1, 2023, Former US President Donald Trump is indicted by special counsel Jack Smith on charges of conspiring to defraud the country and prevent the peaceful transfer of power [1]

08-02.title: securing Macedonian hegemony over Greece and the
08-02.description: On August 2, BC Macedonian army led by Philip II defeats the combined forces of Athens and Thebes in the Battle of Chaeronea, securing Macedonian hegemony over Greece and the Aegean Sea

08-02.title: BC Second Punic War: Battle of Cannae - Carthaginian
08-02.description: On August 2, BC Second Punic War: Battle of Cannae - Carthaginian army led by Hannibal defeats a numerically superior Roman army under the command of consuls Lucius Aemilius Paullus and Gaius Terentius Varro

08-02.title: United States Declaration of Independence 1776 Formal
08-02.description: On August 2, 1776, United States Declaration of Independence 1776 Formal signing of the US Declaration of Independence by 56 people (date most accepted by modern historians)

08-02.title: First US census conducted; population is 3
08-02.description: On August 2, 1790, First US census conducted; population is 3,929,214, including 697,624 slaves

08-02.title: Battle of Bad Axe, Wisconsin: 1,300 Illinois militia
08-02.description: On August 2, 1832, Battle of Bad Axe, Wisconsin: 1,300 Illinois militia defeat Sauk and Fox Native Americans, ending the Black Hawk War

08-02.title: The Government of India is transferred from the East
08-02.description: On August 2, 1858, The Government of India is transferred from the East India Company to the British Crown

08-02.title: Apple becomes the first American publicly listed
08-02.description: On August 2, 2018, Apple becomes the first American publicly listed company to reach $1 trillion in value

08-02.title: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is the first speaker to
08-02.description: On August 2, 2022, US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is the first speaker to visit Taiwan in 25 years, prompting condemnation from the Chinese Communist Party [1]

08-03.title: Santa María 1492 Christopher Columbus
08-03.description: On August 3, 1492, Santa María 1492 Christopher Columbus, with Juan de la Cosa as second-in-command, sets sail on his first voyage with three ships: Santa María, Pinta, and Niña from Palos de la Frontera, Spain, for the "Indies"

08-03.title: German astronomer and priest David Fabricius discovers
08-03.description: On August 3, 1596, German astronomer and priest David Fabricius discovers the light variation of Mira, the first variable star

08-03.title: Germany invades Belgium and declares war on France
08-03.description: On August 3, 1914, Germany invades Belgium and declares war on France, beginning World War I

08-03.title: Adolf Hitler merges the offices of German Chancellor
08-03.description: On August 3, 1934, Adolf Hitler merges the offices of German Chancellor and President, declaring himself "Führer" (leader)

08-03.title: US Senate ratifies the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty
08-03.description: On August 3, 1972, US Senate ratifies the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty with the Soviet Union to limit the use of missile systems capable of defending against missile-delivered nuclear weapons

08-04.title: The first printing of the Zohar in Spain popularizes
08-04.description: On August 4, 1558, The first printing of the Zohar in Spain popularizes the Jewish study of Kabbalah

08-04.title: Russian Antarctic Expedition 1821 Russian Antarctic
08-04.description: On August 4, 1821, Russian Antarctic Expedition 1821 Russian Antarctic expedition led by Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen returns to Kronstadt after being the first to circumnavigate Antarctica

08-04.title: US President Woodrow Wilson issues his "Proclamation
08-04.description: On August 4, 1914, US President Woodrow Wilson issues his "Proclamation of Neutrality" to keep the United States out of the war in Europe [1]

08-04.title: The first train carrying Jews departs from Mechelen
08-04.description: On August 4, 1942, The first train carrying Jews departs from Mechelen, Belgium, for Auschwitz

08-04.title: Anne Frank is arrested in Amsterdam by German Security
08-04.description: On August 4, 1944, Anne Frank is arrested in Amsterdam by German Security Police (Grüne Polizei) following a tip-off from an informer who is never identified

08-04.title: Rwandan Hutus and Tutsis sign a peace treaty in Arusha
08-04.description: On August 4, 1993, Rwandan Hutus and Tutsis sign a peace treaty in Arusha, Tanzania

08-05.title: The last major Viking army to raid England
08-05.description: On August 5, 910, The last major Viking army to raid England, led by King Edward and Earl Æthelred, is defeated at the Battle of Tettenhall by the allied forces of Mercia and Wessex

08-05.title: William Wallace Executed 1305 Scottish resistance
08-05.description: On August 5, 1305, William Wallace Executed 1305 Scottish resistance leader William Wallace is captured by the English near Glasgow and transported to London for trial and execution

08-05.title: Humphrey Gilbert claims Newfoundland for the English
08-05.description: On August 5, 1583, Humphrey Gilbert claims Newfoundland for the English crown, establishing the first English colony in North America and the beginning of the British Empire

08-05.title: Battle of Petrovaradin 1716 Battle of Petrovaradin
08-05.description: On August 5, 1716, Battle of Petrovaradin 1716 Battle of Petrovaradin [Peterwardein]: Habsburgs under Eugene of Savoy defeat the Ottomans in a decisive victory

08-05.title: Battle of Mobile Bay won by the Union Navy
08-05.description: On August 5, 1864, Battle of Mobile Bay won by the Union Navy, led by Rear Admiral David Farragut with the cry "Damn the torpedoes, full speed ahead!"

08-06.title: Italian explorer John Cabot returns to Bristol from
08-06.description: On August 6, 1497, Italian explorer John Cabot returns to Bristol from North America (Newfoundland), becoming the first European to do so since the Vikings

08-06.title: Treaty of The Hague signed
08-06.description: On August 6, 1661, Treaty of The Hague is signed, whereby the Dutch Republic sells New Holland (Brazil) to Portugal for 63 tons of gold

08-06.title: Murderer William Kemmler becomes the first person
08-06.description: On August 6, 1890, Murderer William Kemmler becomes the first person executed by electric chair at Auburn Prison in New York

08-06.title: Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima 1945 An atomic bomb is
08-06.description: On August 6, 1945, Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima 1945 An atomic bomb is dropped on the Japanese city of Hiroshima by the US B-29 Superfortress "Enola Gay"

08-06.title: US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Voting Rights
08-06.description: On August 6, 1965, US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Voting Rights Act, prohibiting voting discrimination against minorities

08-06.title: Tim Berners-Lee releases files describing his idea for
08-06.description: On August 6, 1991, Tim Berners-Lee releases files describing his idea for the World Wide Web and debuts WWW as a publicly available service on the internet

08-07.title: Ming Dynasty Chinese military general Cao Qin stages a
08-07.description: On August 7, 1461, Ming Dynasty Chinese military general Cao Qin stages a coup against the Tianshun Emperor

08-07.title: Battle of Gangut: Russian Navy wins its first major
08-07.description: On August 7, 1714, Battle of Gangut: Russian Navy wins its first major victory during the Great Northern War against Sweden

08-07.title: Commander of the Continental Army
08-07.description: On August 7, 1782, Commander of the Continental Army, George Washington, creates two Honorary Badges of Distinction and a Badge of Military Merit (now the Purple Heart). First time military awards are presented to common soldiers.

08-07.title: Iraqi government forces slaughter over 3
08-07.description: On August 7, 1933, Iraqi government forces slaughter over 3,000 Assyrians in the village of Simele in northern Iraq, commemorated as Assyrian Martyrs Day

08-07.title: Tokyo Telecommunications Engineering
08-07.description: On August 7, 1955, Tokyo Telecommunications Engineering, the precursor to Sony, begins selling its first transistor radios in Japan

08-07.title: Operation Desert Shield 1990 US deploys troops to
08-07.description: On August 7, 1990, Operation Desert Shield 1990 US deploys troops to Saudi Arabia, beginning Operation Desert Shield

08-08.title: Emperor Krishnadeva Raya is crowned
08-08.description: On August 8, 1509, Emperor Krishnadeva Raya is crowned, beginning the rejuvenation of the Vijayanagara Empire in southern India

08-08.title: Galileo Galilei presents his telescope to the Venetian
08-08.description: On August 8, 1609, Galileo Galilei presents his telescope to the Venetian Senate in Venice

08-08.title: United States One Dollar Bill 1786 US Congress
08-08.description: On August 8, 1786, United States One Dollar Bill 1786 US Congress unanimously chooses the dollar as the monetary unit for the United States of America

08-08.title: Soviet Union declares war on Japan during World War II
08-08.description: On August 8, 1945, Soviet Union declares war on Japan during World War II and invades Manchuria the next day

08-08.title: US President Richard Nixon announces he will resign at
08-08.description: On August 8, 1974, US President Richard Nixon announces he will resign at 12 p.m. the next day

08-08.title: Ceasefire between Iran and Iraq takes effect after
08-08.description: On August 8, 1988, Ceasefire between Iran and Iraq takes effect after eight years of war

08-09.title: forcing Pompey to flee to Egypt
08-09.description: On August 9, BC Caesar's Civil War: Julius Caesar decisively defeats Pompey the Great at the Battle of Pharsalus, forcing Pompey to flee to Egypt

08-09.title: Battle of Adrianople: Gothic rebel army defeats Roman
08-09.description: On August 9, 378, Battle of Adrianople: Gothic rebel army defeats Roman forces under Emperor Valens, who is killed

08-09.title: Robert Gray's Columbia Rediviva returns to Boston
08-09.description: On August 9, 1790, Robert Gray's Columbia Rediviva returns to Boston after a 3-year journey as the first American ship to circumnavigate the globe

08-09.title: Rudolf Diesel of Germany obtains patent #608
08-09.description: On August 9, 1898, Rudolf Diesel of Germany obtains patent #608,845 for his internal combustion engine, later known as the diesel engine

08-09.title: Mahatma Gandhi and 50 others are arrested in Bombay
08-09.description: On August 9, 1942, Mahatma Gandhi and 50 others are arrested in Bombay after the passing of a "Quit India" motion and campaign by the All India Congress Committee

08-09.title: Nuclear Bombing of Nagasaki 1945 US drops second
08-09.description: On August 9, 1945, Nuclear Bombing of Nagasaki 1945 US drops second atomic bomb "Fat Man" on Nagasaki, Japan, destroying part of the city

08-09.title: Singapore Leaves Malaysia 1965 Singapore separates
08-09.description: On August 9, 1965, Singapore Leaves Malaysia 1965 Singapore separates from the Federation of Malaysia and gains independence

08-09.title: Richard Nixon's Resignation Letter 1974 Richard Nixon
08-09.description: On August 9, 1974, Richard Nixon's Resignation Letter 1974 Richard Nixon resigns as President of the United States, and Vice President Gerald Ford takes the oath of office to become the 38th US President

08-09.title: Disputed Belarusian presidential election sees
08-09.description: On August 9, 2020, Disputed Belarusian presidential election sees longtime dictator Alexander Lukashenko officially win 80% of the votes but unofficially lose 60-70% of the votes to main opposition candidate Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya, sparking widespread protests in Belarus and international condemnation

08-10.title: leads to the sack of one of the greatest cities in the
08-10.description: On August 10, Fall of Nineveh 612 BC Fall of Nineveh to the Babylonians and the forces of Medes, leads to the sack of one of the greatest cities in the world, the destruction of the Neo-Assyrian Empire, and the death of King Sinsharishkun [date approximate]

08-10.title: Traditional date of Laylat al-Qadr / Night of Power
08-10.description: On August 10, 610, Traditional date of Laylat al-Qadr / Night of Power when Muslims believe the Quran is first sent down from heaven to the world and revealed to the Islamic prophet Muhammad

08-10.title: Explorer John Cabot tells King Henry VII of his trip
08-10.description: On August 10, 1497, Explorer John Cabot tells King Henry VII of his trip to "Asia"

08-10.title: King Charles II and John Flamsteed lay the foundation
08-10.description: On August 10, 1675, King Charles II and John Flamsteed lay the foundation stone of the Royal Observatory in Greenwich, London

08-10.title: US Act of Congress passes establishment of the
08-10.description: On August 10, 1846, US Act of Congress passes establishment of the Smithsonian Institution, now the world's largest museum and research complex

08-11.title: used by several pre-Columbian Mesoamerican
08-11.description: On August 11, Mesoamerican Long Count Calendar 3114 BC 3114-08-11 BCE is traditionally considered the start date of the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar, used by several pre-Columbian Mesoamerican civilizations, notably the Maya

08-11.title: Allies refuse Japan's offer to surrender on the
08-11.description: On August 11, 1945, Allies refuse Japan's offer to surrender on the condition that Emperor Hirohito retains his status

08-11.title: Formal peace treaty ends over seven years of fighting
08-11.description: On August 11, 1954, Formal peace treaty ends over seven years of fighting in Indochina between the French and the Communist Viet Minh

08-11.title: Al-Qaeda is formed at a meeting between Osama Bin Laden
08-11.description: On August 11, 1988, Al-Qaeda is formed at a meeting between Osama Bin Laden, Ayman al-Zawahiri, and Dr. Fadl in Peshawar, Pakistan

08-11.title: NATO takes over command of the peacekeeping force in
08-11.description: On August 11, 2003, NATO takes over command of the peacekeeping force in Afghanistan in its first major operation outside Europe in its 54-year history

08-12.title: Battle of Didgori: Georgian army under King David the
08-12.description: On August 12, 1121, Battle of Didgori: Georgian army under King David the Builder wins a decisive victory over the renowned Seljuk commander Ilghazi

08-12.title: Ottoman troops conquer Otranto in southern Italy after
08-12.description: On August 12, 1480, Ottoman troops conquer Otranto in southern Italy after a 15-day siege, killing 12,000, enslaving 5,000, and beheading 800 Christians for refusing to convert to Islam

08-12.title: American inventor Isaac Singer patents his famous
08-12.description: On August 12, 1851, American inventor Isaac Singer patents his famous sewing machine

08-12.title: Model T 1908 Ford Motor Company builds its first Model
08-12.description: On August 12, 1908, Model T 1908 Ford Motor Company builds its first Model T car, which Henry Ford himself tests on a hunting trip to Wisconsin and northern Michigan [1]

08-12.title: Don Estridge unveils the company's first personal
08-12.description: On August 12, 1981, Don Estridge unveils the company's first personal computer, the IBM PC, at New York’s Waldorf Astoria Hotel, priced at $1,565 with 16 kilobytes of RAM, helping bring computing to the masses [1]

08-13.title: Spanish conquistadors led by Hernán Cortés capture
08-13.description: On August 13, 1521, Spanish conquistadors led by Hernán Cortés capture Aztec Emperor Cuauhtémoc in Tenochtitlan, bringing the Aztec Empire to an end

08-13.title: Buddhist monks from Kyoto's Enryaku-ji Temple set fire
08-13.description: On August 13, 1536, Buddhist monks from Kyoto's Enryaku-ji Temple set fire to 21 Nichiren temples throughout Kyoto in the Tenbun Hokke Disturbance (Traditional Japanese date: July 27, 1536)

08-13.title: Dutch astronomer Christiaan Huygens discovers Mars's
08-13.description: On August 13, 1642, Dutch astronomer Christiaan Huygens discovers Mars's southern polar cap

08-13.title: Prussia joins the Anglo-Dutch alliance to form the
08-13.description: On August 13, 1788, Prussia joins the Anglo-Dutch alliance to form the Triple Alliance to prevent the spread of the Russo-Swedish War of 1788-90

08-13.title: Second Sino-Japanese War: Japanese forces start the
08-13.description: On August 13, 1937, Second Sino-Japanese War: Japanese forces start the Battle of Shanghai, a three-month conflict involving over one million troops

08-13.title: Manhattan Project 1942 The Manhattan Project commences
08-13.description: On August 13, 1942, Manhattan Project 1942 The Manhattan Project commences under the direction of US General Leslie Groves with the aim of developing an atomic bomb

08-14.title: Letter from Kublai Khan to the Japanese Emperor 1281
08-14.description: On August 14, 1281, Letter from Kublai Khan to the Japanese Emperor 1281 During Kublai Khan 's second Mongol invasion of Japan, his invading Chinese fleet of 3,500 vessels disappears in a typhoon near the Japanese coast

08-14.title: US Army Colonel Worth declares the Second Seminole War
08-14.description: On August 14, 1842, US Army Colonel Worth declares the Second Seminole War over after nearly seven years; over 3,000 surviving members of the Seminole Nation are forcibly relocated from Florida to Oklahoma, with only about 300 permitted to remain [1]

08-14.title: Victory over Japan 1945 V-J Day
08-14.description: On August 14, 1945, Victory over Japan 1945 V-J Day, the Empire of Japan surrenders unconditionally to the Allies, ending World War II (August 15 in Japan and other countries depending on the time zone)

08-14.title: Pakistan gains independence from the United Kingdom
08-14.description: On August 14, 1947, Pakistan gains independence from the United Kingdom

08-14.title: British Army deploys on the streets of Northern Ireland
08-14.description: On August 14, 1969, British Army deploys on the streets of Northern Ireland, beginning Operation Banner

08-14.title: 17,000 workers strike at the Lenin Shipyard in Gdańsk,
08-14.description: On August 14, 1980, 17,000 workers strike at the Lenin Shipyard in Gdańsk, Poland, beginning the Solidarity movement

08-15.title: Empire of Trebizond surrenders to forces of Sultan
08-15.description: On August 15, 1461, Empire of Trebizond surrenders to forces of Sultan Mehmed II, the last remnant of the Byzantine Empire to fall; Emperor David is exiled and later executed

08-15.title: The Mayflower 1620 The Mayflower sets sail from
08-15.description: On August 15, 1620, The Mayflower 1620 The Mayflower sets sail from Southampton, England, with 102 Pilgrims bound for the New World

08-15.title: Second US National Women's Rights Convention convenes
08-15.description: On August 15, 1851, Second US National Women's Rights Convention convenes in Brinley Hall, Worcester, Massachusetts

08-15.title: Chinese Empress Dowager Cixi
08-15.description: On August 15, 1900, Chinese Empress Dowager Cixi, her family, and court retainers flee Peking for Xi'an as foreign troops move through the capital in an attempt to quell the Boxer Rebellion

08-15.title: India gains independence from the United Kingdom and
08-15.description: On August 15, 1947, India gains independence from the United Kingdom and remains a dominion until 1950

08-15.title: Omagh Bombing 1998 Omagh bombing in Northern Ireland
08-15.description: On August 15, 1998, Omagh Bombing 1998 Omagh bombing in Northern Ireland, the worst terrorist incident of The Troubles, kills 29 people and injures about 220

08-15.title: Afghan President Ashraf Ghani flees the country as
08-15.description: On August 15, 2021, Afghan President Ashraf Ghani flees the country as Taliban forces enter the capital Kabul and take control

08-16.title: The Meeting of Henry VIII and the Emperor Maximilian I
08-16.description: On August 16, 1513, The Meeting of Henry VIII and the Emperor Maximilian I 1513 Battle of the Spurs at Guinegate (now Enguinegatte): King Henry VIII of England and Holy Roman Emperor Maximilian I defeat French forces, capturing the town and routing the French cavalry

08-16.title: Britain's Queen Victoria telegraphs US President James
08-16.description: On August 16, 1858, Britain's Queen Victoria telegraphs US President James Buchanan for the first time via transatlantic telegraph cable ; he replies, "It is a triumph more glorious, because far more useful to mankind, than was ever won by conqueror on the field of battle"

08-16.title: Gold is first discovered in the Klondike at Bonanza
08-16.description: On August 16, 1896, Gold is first discovered in the Klondike at Bonanza Creek in Yukon, Canada, by George Carmack

08-16.title: First British Empire Games open in Hamilton, Canada
08-16.description: On August 16, 1930, First British Empire Games open in Hamilton, Canada

08-16.title: The last Chinese Emperor and ruler of the Japanese
08-16.description: On August 16, 1945, The last Chinese Emperor and ruler of the Japanese puppet state Manchukuo, Puyi, is captured by Soviet troops while preparing to board a plane to escape to Japan

08-16.title: Direct Action Day: Widespread riots erupt in Calcutta
08-16.description: On August 16, 1946, Direct Action Day: Widespread riots erupt in Calcutta between Muslims and Hindus over whether Pakistan should be a separate state, killing over 4,000 and leaving 100,000 homeless

08-17.title: Joseph Pulitzer donates $1 million to Columbia
08-17.description: On August 17, 1903, Joseph Pulitzer donates $1 million to Columbia University and begins the Pulitzer Prizes in the United States

08-17.title: Korea is divided into North and South Korea along the
08-17.description: On August 17, 1945, Korea is divided into North and South Korea along the 38th parallel

08-17.title: Sukarno and Mohammad Hatta declare Indonesia
08-17.description: On August 17, 1945, Sukarno and Mohammad Hatta declare Indonesia (formerly the Dutch East Indies) independent from the Netherlands

08-17.title: The Radcliffe Line is revealed
08-17.description: On August 17, 1947, The Radcliffe Line is revealed, setting the border between Union of India and Dominion of Pakistan

08-17.title: I Did Not Have Sexual Relations With That Woman 1998
08-17.description: On August 17, 1998, I Did Not Have Sexual Relations With That Woman 1998 Monica Lewinsky scandal : US President Bill Clinton admits in taped testimony he had an " improper physical relationship " with the intern and on the same day admits before the nation he "misled people" about the relationship

08-18.title: Governor of Roanoke Island colony John White returns
08-18.description: On August 18, 1590, Governor of Roanoke Island colony John White returns from England to find no trace of the colonists he left there three years earlier

08-18.title: First public admission to the Salon de Paris art
08-18.description: On August 18, 1737, First public admission to the Salon de Paris art exhibition at the Louvre in Paris

08-18.title: United States Exploring Expedition headed by Charles
08-18.description: On August 18, 1838, United States Exploring Expedition headed by Charles Wilkes departs for the Pacific Ocean and Antarctica

08-18.title: Anti-Cigarette League of America forms in Chicago
08-18.description: On August 18, 1919, Anti-Cigarette League of America forms in Chicago, Illinois

08-18.title: American Women Demand Their Rights 1920 State
08-18.description: On August 18, 1920, American Women Demand Their Rights 1920 State Representative Harry T. Burn (24) casts the deciding vote in Tennessee's and thus America's ratification of the 19th Amendment to the Constitution, allowing women's suffrage after reading a letter from his mother

08-18.title: Hitler Will Have to Break Us or Lose the War 1940
08-18.description: On August 18, 1940, Hitler Will Have to Break Us or Lose the War 1940 Battle of Britain : Air battle known as "The Hardest Day" occurs; the Luftwaffe loses approximately 69 aircraft and the RAF 68 in one of the largest ever air battles

08-19.title: later known as Augustus
08-19.description: On August 19, BC Octavian, later known as Augustus, compels the Roman Senate to elect him consul

08-19.title: First Photograph of a Person 1839 Louis Daguerre 's
08-19.description: On August 19, 1839, First Photograph of a Person 1839 Louis Daguerre 's daguerreotype photographic process with complete working instructions is published "free to the world" in Paris as a gift from the French government

08-19.title: World War II: Over 4
08-19.description: On August 19, 1942, World War II: Over 4,000 Canadian and British soldiers are killed, wounded, or captured during a raid on Dieppe, France

08-19.title: Iran and Iraq begin a ceasefire in their
08-19.description: On August 19, 1988, Iran and Iraq begin a ceasefire in their eight-year-old war at 11 pm EDT

08-19.title: Conservative members of the Communist Party of the
08-19.description: On August 19, 1991, Conservative members of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union attempt to depose Mikhail Gorbachev in a coup d'état

08-19.title: Invasion of Iraq 2010 Operation Iraqi Freedom winds
08-19.description: On August 19, 2010, Invasion of Iraq 2010 Operation Iraqi Freedom winds down as the last of the United States Brigade Combat Teams cross the border into Kuwait [1]

08-20.title: First Dutch East India Company ships return from the
08-20.description: On August 20, 1597, First Dutch East India Company ships return from the Far East

08-20.title: Alaska is first sighted by a Russian expedition led by
08-20.description: On August 20, 1741, Alaska is first sighted by a Russian expedition led by Danish explorer Vitus Bering

08-20.title: Chinese revolutionary Sun Yat-sen forms the first
08-20.description: On August 20, 1905, Chinese revolutionary Sun Yat-sen forms the first chapter of Tongmenghui, a union of secret societies determined to bring down the Qing dynasty

08-20.title: Warsaw Pact Invasion of Czechoslovakia 1968 250
08-20.description: On August 20, 1968, Warsaw Pact Invasion of Czechoslovakia 1968 250,000 Soviet and Warsaw Pact troops invade Czechoslovakia at night to suppress the Prague Spring

08-20.title: Oslo Peace Accords are signed between Israel and the
08-20.description: On August 20, 1993, Oslo Peace Accords are signed between Israel and the Palestine Liberation Organization after secret negotiations in Norway, a public ceremony in Washington, D.C. is held the following month

08-21.title: Edirne Incident: Turkish army ousts Sultan Mustafa II
08-21.description: On August 21, 1703, Edirne Incident: Turkish army ousts Sultan Mustafa II, replacing him with his brother Ahmed III, reducing the power of the Sultan

08-21.title: King Gustav III of Sweden completes a coup d'état by
08-21.description: On August 21, 1772, King Gustav III of Sweden completes a coup d'état by adopting a new constitution and installing himself as an enlightened despot, ending fifty years of parliamentary rule

08-21.title: Burroughs' Adding Machine 1888 American inventor
08-21.description: On August 21, 1888, Burroughs' Adding Machine 1888 American inventor William Seward Burroughs patents the adding machine

08-21.title: The Mona Lisa is stolen from the Louvre Museum by
08-21.description: On August 21, 1911, The Mona Lisa is stolen from the Louvre Museum by Italian decorator Vincenzo Peruggia, recovered in 1913

08-21.title: Hawaii becomes the 50th state of the United States
08-21.description: On August 21, 1959, Hawaii becomes the 50th state of the United States

08-21.title: Conservative coup in the Soviet Union is crushed by
08-21.description: On August 21, 1991, Conservative coup in the Soviet Union is crushed by popular resistance led by Boris Yeltsin in three days

08-22.title: Battle of Bosworth Field: Henry Tudor 's forces defeat
08-22.description: On August 22, 1485, Battle of Bosworth Field: Henry Tudor 's forces defeat English King Richard III during the last battle in the Wars of the Roses. Richard is killed, becoming the last English monarch to die in battle.

08-22.title: Madras (now Chennai)
08-22.description: On August 22, 1639, Madras (now Chennai), India, is founded by the British East India Company on a sliver of land bought from local Nayak rulers

08-22.title: English Civil War begins between Royalists and
08-22.description: On August 22, 1642, English Civil War begins between Royalists and Parliamentarians

08-22.title: King of Great Britain and Ireland
08-22.description: On August 22, 1775, King of Great Britain and Ireland, George III, proclaims the American colonies to be in open rebellion and orders his officials to suppress them

08-22.title: First Geneva Convention 1864 First Geneva Convention
08-22.description: On August 22, 1864, First Geneva Convention 1864 First Geneva Convention adopted in Geneva "for the Amelioration of the Condition of the Wounded in Armies in the Field" is signed by 12 nations

08-23.title: William Wallace Executed 1305 Scottish patriot William
08-23.description: On August 23, 1305, William Wallace Executed 1305 Scottish patriot William Wallace is executed for high treason by Edward I of England at Smithfield, London

08-23.title: Rabbi Joseph Caro completes his major work
08-23.description: On August 23, 1542, Rabbi Joseph Caro completes his major work, the "Beit Yosef," a voluminous commentary on the "Arba'ah Turim" code

08-23.title: 600 Luftwaffe planes bomb Stalingrad
08-23.description: On August 23, 1942, Battle of Stalingrad: 600 Luftwaffe planes bomb Stalingrad, killing 40,000 people

08-23.title: Battle of Kursk, the largest tank battle in history,
08-23.description: On August 23, 1943, Battle of Kursk, the largest tank battle in history, ends after 50 days as the Soviet Union defeats Germany; over 10,000 tanks take part, and nearly 250,000 combatants are killed

08-23.title: Osama bin Laden issues a message entitled "A
08-23.description: On August 23, 1996, Osama bin Laden issues a message entitled "A Declaration of War Against the Americans Occupying the Land of the Two Holy Places"

08-24.title: The 17 Year-Old Witness to the Eruption of Vesuvius 79
08-24.description: On August 24, 79, The 17 Year-Old Witness to the Eruption of Vesuvius 79 Believed until 2018 to be the date of the massive eruption of Mt. Vesuvius which buried the cities of Pompeii, Herculaneum, Oplontis and Stabiae, killing untold thousands, latest evidence suggests the eruption occurred after 17 October [1] [2]

08-24.title: Alaric I Sacks Rome 410 Rome is overrun by Visigoths
08-24.description: On August 24, 410, Alaric I Sacks Rome 410 Rome is overrun by Visigoths under Alaric I for the first time in nearly 800 years, seen as the fall of the Western Roman Empire

08-24.title: Battle of Marj Dabiq: Ottoman forces decisively defeat
08-24.description: On August 24, 1516, Battle of Marj Dabiq: Ottoman forces decisively defeat the Mamluk Sultanate near Aleppo, ending Egyptian control in the Middle East

08-24.title: St. Bartholomew's Day Massacre of Protestants by Roman
08-24.description: On August 24, 1572, St. Bartholomew's Day Massacre of Protestants by Roman Catholics begins in Paris with the murder by defenestration of Admiral Gaspard de Coligny and later spreads to the French provinces

08-24.title: Book of Common Prayer 1662 Act of Uniformity requires
08-24.description: On August 24, 1662, Book of Common Prayer 1662 Act of Uniformity requires English government and church officials to accept the Book of Common Prayer

08-24.title: British forces capture Washington
08-24.description: On August 24, 1814, British forces capture Washington, D.C. during the War of 1812 and destroy many landmarks

08-24.title: France becomes the world's fifth thermonuclear power
08-24.description: On August 24, 1968, France becomes the world's fifth thermonuclear power with a detonation at Mururoa Atoll in the South Pacific

08-25.title: Galileo Galilei demonstrates his first telescope to
08-25.description: On August 25, 1609, Galileo Galilei demonstrates his first telescope to Venetian lawmakers, including the Doge (ruler) of Venice, Leonardo Donato

08-25.title: Slavery begins in mainland British colonies of North
08-25.description: On August 25, 1619, Slavery begins in mainland British colonies of North America when the first known African captives (approximately 20) land at Point Comfort, Virginia, before being sold or traded into servitude [1]

08-25.title: Hundreds of French colonists arrive in Louisiana and
08-25.description: On August 25, 1718, Hundreds of French colonists arrive in Louisiana and found New Orleans

08-25.title: Captain James Cook departs from Plymouth
08-25.description: On August 25, 1768, Captain James Cook departs from Plymouth, England, bound for the Pacific Ocean on his first voyage aboard the Endeavour

08-25.title: Japanese scientist Shibasaburo Kitasato discovers the
08-25.description: On August 25, 1894, Japanese scientist Shibasaburo Kitasato discovers the infectious agent of the bubonic plague and publishes his findings in The Lancet

08-25.title: Liberation of Paris 1944 German commander Dietrich von
08-25.description: On August 25, 1944, Liberation of Paris 1944 German commander Dietrich von Choltitz surrenders Paris to the Free French forces of Philippe Leclerc, disobeying Adolf Hitler 's orders to destroy the city. President of the Provisional Government of the French Republic Charles de Gaulle gives a famous speech at the Hôtel de Ville.

08-25.title: Operation Desert Shield 1990 UN Security Council
08-25.description: On August 25, 1990, Operation Desert Shield 1990 UN Security Council authorizes military action against Iraq for invading Kuwait

08-25.title: Linux is born when Linus Torvalds sends an email
08-25.description: On August 25, 1991, Linux is born when Linus Torvalds sends an email announcing his project to create a new computer operating system

08-26.title: Battle of Crécy: Edward III 's English longbows defeat
08-26.description: On August 26, 1346, Battle of Crécy: Edward III 's English longbows defeat Philip VI 's army south of Calais in northern France; cannons are used for the first time in battle

08-26.title: English astronomer Edmond Halley first observes the
08-26.description: On August 26, 1682, English astronomer Edmond Halley first observes the comet named after him

08-26.title: The first free kindergarten in the United States is
08-26.description: On August 26, 1873, The first free kindergarten in the United States is started by Susan Blow in Carondelet, a suburb of St. Louis, Missouri

08-26.title: General Franco 's Nationalist troops conquer Santander
08-26.description: On August 26, 1937, General Franco 's Nationalist troops conquer Santander during the Spanish Civil War

08-26.title: Morris Mini-Minor 1959 British Motor Corporation
08-26.description: On August 26, 1959, Morris Mini-Minor 1959 British Motor Corporation introduces the Morris Mini-Minor, designed by Alec Issigonis ; it is only 10 feet long yet seats four passengers

08-26.title: US President Bill Clinton signs welfare reform into law
08-26.description: On August 26, 1996, US President Bill Clinton signs welfare reform into law, representing a major shift in welfare policy

08-27.title: BC Greco-Persian Wars: Battle of Mycale is won by
08-27.description: On August 27, BC Greco-Persian Wars: Battle of Mycale is won by Greek forces over Persian naval troops on the Ionian coast

08-27.title: Persian forces led by Mardonius are routed by a Greek
08-27.description: On August 27, BC Greco-Persian Wars: Battle of Plataea, Persian forces led by Mardonius are routed by a Greek army under Pausanias; a double victory with the success at Mycale that ends the Persian invasion

08-27.title: Battle of Baekgang: Tang Chinese and Silla Korean
08-27.description: On August 27, 663, Battle of Baekgang: Tang Chinese and Silla Korean forces defeat Baekje Korean forces and their Yamato Japanese allies on the Geum River in Korea, the last Japanese invasion of Korea for 900 years

08-27.title: French National Assembly issues the "Declaration of
08-27.description: On August 27, 1789, French National Assembly issues the "Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen"

08-27.title: Krakatoa: The World’s Mightiest Explosion 1883
08-27.description: On August 27, 1883, Krakatoa: The World’s Mightiest Explosion 1883 Krakatoa volcano, located west of Java in Indonesia, erupts with a force of 200 megatons of TNT, killing approximately 36,000 people

08-27.title: Kellogg - Briand Pact
08-27.description: On August 27, 1928, Kellogg - Briand Pact, 60 nations agree to condemn the "recourse to war for the solution of international controversies"

08-27.title: Lord Mountbatten, 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma,
08-27.description: On August 27, 1979, Lord Mountbatten, 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma, cousin of Queen Elizabeth II and last Viceroy of India, is killed along with three companions, two of whom are children, by the IRA when his boat is blown up near Sligo, Ireland

08-27.title: US Senator Barack Obama becomes the first African
08-27.description: On August 27, 2008, US Senator Barack Obama becomes the first African American to be nominated by a major political party for President of the United States, by the Democratic Party

08-28.title: Crusaders begin the Siege of Acre under Guy of Lusignan
08-28.description: On August 28, 1189, Third Crusade: Crusaders begin the Siege of Acre under Guy of Lusignan

08-28.title: King John of England grants small town of Liverpool a
08-28.description: On August 28, 1207, King John of England grants small town of Liverpool a charter (right to elect a mayor and aldermen)

08-28.title: English explorer Henry Hudson is the first European to
08-28.description: On August 28, 1609, English explorer Henry Hudson is the first European to sail into Delaware Bay, naming it South Bay

08-28.title: Horse in Race Against a Train 1830 The first
08-28.description: On August 28, 1830, Horse in Race Against a Train 1830 The first American-built locomotive, "Tom Thumb," races a horse-drawn car from the Stockton and Stokes stagecoach company from Baltimore to Ellicott Mills; due to mechanical problems, the horse wins!

08-28.title: Scientific American magazine publishes its first issue
08-28.description: On August 28, 1845, Scientific American magazine publishes its first issue

08-28.title: March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom 1963 Martin
08-28.description: On August 28, 1963, March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom 1963 Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his "I Have a Dream" speech during the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom civil rights march at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C.

08-29.title: Battle of Mohács: In a decisive battle
08-29.description: On August 29, 1526, Battle of Mohács: In a decisive battle, the Kingdom of Hungary is conquered by the Ottoman Empire led by Suleiman the Magnificent

08-29.title: Portugal recognizes the independence of its former
08-29.description: On August 29, 1825, Portugal recognizes the independence of its former colony Brazil

08-29.title: United Kingdom and China sign the Treaty of Nanking
08-29.description: On August 29, 1842, United Kingdom and China sign the Treaty of Nanking, ending the First Opium War

08-29.title: Second Battle of Bull Run 1862 Second Battle of Bull
08-29.description: On August 29, 1862, Second Battle of Bull Run 1862 Second Battle of Bull Run begins in Manassas, Virginia, leading to a Confederate victory in the US Civil War

08-29.title: Soviet Union secretly performs its first successful
08-29.description: On August 29, 1949, Soviet Union secretly performs its first successful nuclear weapons test at the Semipalatinsk Test Site in northeast Kazakhstan

08-29.title: Hurricane Katrina 2005 Hurricane Katrina makes its
08-29.description: On August 29, 2005, Hurricane Katrina 2005 Hurricane Katrina makes its second and third landfalls as a Category 3 hurricane, devastating much of the Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle, killing more than 1,836 people and causing over $115 billion in damage

08-30.title: European leaders outlaw the crossbow
08-30.description: On August 30, 1146, European leaders outlaw the crossbow, intending to end war for all time

08-30.title: Beginning of the Battle of Lake Poyang; two Chinese
08-30.description: On August 30, 1363, Beginning of the Battle of Lake Poyang; two Chinese rebel leaders, Chen Youliang and Zhu Yuanzhang, clash in one of the largest naval battles in history during the Mongol-led Yuan Dynasty

08-30.title: Tokugawa Ieyasu enters Edo Castle
08-30.description: On August 30, 1590, Tokugawa Ieyasu enters Edo Castle (Traditional Japanese date: August 1, 1590)

08-30.title: William Penn leaves England to sail to the New World
08-30.description: On August 30, 1682, William Penn leaves England to sail to the New World

08-30.title: Second Battle of Bull Run 1862 Second Battle of Bull
08-30.description: On August 30, 1862, Second Battle of Bull Run 1862 Second Battle of Bull Run in Manassas, Virginia, ends with a Confederate victory over Union forces

08-30.title: Battle of Tannenberg (WWI) in East Prussia ends in the
08-30.description: On August 30, 1914, Battle of Tannenberg (WWI) in East Prussia ends in the destruction of the Russian Second Army, with 122,000-170,000 soldiers killed, injured, or captured by the German 8th Army led by Paul von Hindenburg and Erich Ludendorff

08-30.title: Jawaharlal Nehru submits the Nehru Report
08-30.description: On August 30, 1928, Jawaharlal Nehru submits the Nehru Report, officially requesting independence for India and outlining a federal constitution with reserved seats for minorities

08-31.title: Possible date for establishment of the Iroquois
08-31.description: On August 31, 1142, Possible date for establishment of the Iroquois (Haudenosaunee) League [disputed date - other research places date between 1450 and 1660]

08-31.title: John Snow, Cholera and the Battle for Broad Street
08-31.description: On August 31, 1854, John Snow, Cholera and the Battle for Broad Street 1854 A major outbreak of cholera occurs in Soho, London; physician John Snow calls it "the most terrible outbreak of cholera which ever occurred in this kingdom"

08-31.title: The body of Jack the Ripper's first victim
08-31.description: On August 31, 1888, The body of Jack the Ripper's first victim, Mary Ann Nichols, is found in Whitechapel in London's East End

08-31.title: Sun Yat-sen and his supporters' 'rump' parliament
08-31.description: On August 31, 1917, Sun Yat-sen and his supporters' 'rump' parliament establish a military government in China and elect Sun Yat-sen as Commander-in-Chief

08-31.title: The Liberal Party of Australia is founded by Robert
08-31.description: On August 31, 1945, The Liberal Party of Australia is founded by Robert Menzies

08-31.title: Federation of Malaya gains independence from Great
08-31.description: On August 31, 1957, Federation of Malaya gains independence from Great Britain

08-31.title: The Provisional Irish Republican Army (Sinn Féin)
08-31.description: On August 31, 1994, The Provisional Irish Republican Army (Sinn Féin) declares a ceasefire in Northern Ireland

08-31.title: Diana, Princess of Wales, dies in a car crash in a
08-31.description: On August 31, 1997, Diana, Princess of Wales, dies in a car crash in a road tunnel in Paris

09-01.title: King Louis XIV of France dies after a reign of 72 years
09-01.description: On September 1, 1715, King Louis XIV of France dies after a reign of 72 years, the longest of any major European monarch

09-01.title: First female telephone operator starts work
09-01.description: On September 1, 1878, First female telephone operator starts work, Emma Nutt, for the Edwin Holmes Telephone Dispatch Company in Boston

09-01.title: Wilfrid Laurier oversees Alberta and Saskatchewan
09-01.description: On September 1, 1905, Wilfrid Laurier oversees Alberta and Saskatchewan joining the Confederation of Canada as its 8th and 9th provinces, both separated from the Northwest Territories

09-01.title: Start of World War II 1939 World War II starts when
09-01.description: On September 1, 1939, Start of World War II 1939 World War II starts when Germany invades Poland by attacking the Free City of Danzig

09-01.title: Jews living in Germany are required to wear a yellow
09-01.description: On September 1, 1941, Jews living in Germany are required to wear a yellow Star of David

09-01.title: US, Australia and New Zealand sign the ANZUS mutual
09-01.description: On September 1, 1951, US, Australia and New Zealand sign the ANZUS mutual defense treaty

09-01.title: Colonel Muammar Gaddafi deposes King Idris in the
09-01.description: On September 1, 1969, Colonel Muammar Gaddafi deposes King Idris in the Libyan Revolution

09-02.title: BC Battle of Actium : Decisive naval battle that
09-02.description: On September 2, BC Battle of Actium : Decisive naval battle that effectively ends the Roman Republic. Octavian 's forces defeat those under Mark Antony and Cleopatra off the western coast of Greece.

09-02.title: Sultan Saladin and King Richard the Lionheart of
09-02.description: On September 2, 1192, Sultan Saladin and King Richard the Lionheart of England sign the Treaty of Jaffa ending the Third Crusade in a compromise neither is happy with. Treaty leaves Jerusalem under Islamic control with Christian pilgrimage rights and restores the Kingdom of Jerusalem.

09-02.title: The Great Fire of London 1666 Great Fire of London
09-02.description: On September 2, 1666, The Great Fire of London 1666 Great Fire of London begins at 2am in Pudding Lane, 80% of London is destroyed

09-02.title: September Massacres of the French Revolution : In
09-02.description: On September 2, 1792, September Massacres of the French Revolution : In Paris rampaging mobs slaughter three Roman Catholic bishops, more than two hundred priests, and prisoners believed to be royalist sympathizers.

09-02.title: US Civil War: Union General William T. Sherman
09-02.description: On September 2, 1864, US Civil War: Union General William T. Sherman captures and occupies Atlanta, Georgia, ending the Atlanta Campaign in the US Civil War [1]

09-03.title: San Marino, one of the smallest nations in the world
09-03.description: On September 3, 301, San Marino, one of the smallest nations in the world and the world's oldest republic still in existence, is founded by Saint Marinus

09-03.title: Oliver Cromwell 's English New Model Army defeats a
09-03.description: On September 3, 1650, Oliver Cromwell 's English New Model Army defeats a Scottish force in a surprise attack at the Battle of Dunbar

09-03.title: The Treaty of Paris is signed in Paris
09-03.description: On September 3, 1783, The Treaty of Paris is signed in Paris, ending the American Revolutionary War between Great Britain and the United States of America

09-03.title: The new French Constitution
09-03.description: On September 3, 1791, The new French Constitution, declaring France a constitutional monarchy, is passed by the National Assembly during the French Revolution

09-03.title: With a proclamation by General Lord Roberts
09-03.description: On September 3, 1900, With a proclamation by General Lord Roberts, Britain annexes the Boer Republic of South Africa

09-03.title: Scottish bacteriologist Alexander Fleming discovers a
09-03.description: On September 3, 1928, Scottish bacteriologist Alexander Fleming discovers a mold later identified as penicillin while sorting through petri dishes containing colonies of the bacteria Staphylococcus, at St. Mary's Hospital in London [1]

09-03.title: World War II: Britain declares war on Germany after
09-03.description: On September 3, 1939, World War II: Britain declares war on Germany after the invasion of Poland; France follows six hours later, quickly joined by Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, and Canada

09-03.title: Holocaust diarist Anne Frank (15) is among the
09-03.description: On September 3, 1944, Holocaust diarist Anne Frank (15) is among the prisoners on the 68th and final transport of Dutch Jews sent from Westerbrooksent to Auschwitz concentration camp [1]

09-03.title: Sweden Switches to Driving on the Right Hand Side 1967
09-03.description: On September 3, 1967, Sweden Switches to Driving on the Right Hand Side 1967 Sweden begins driving on the right-hand side of the road (Dagen H)

09-03.title: An estimated 50,000 Kurdish civilians and soldiers are
09-03.description: On September 3, 1988, An estimated 50,000 Kurdish civilians and soldiers are killed by Iraq by this date, many using chemical weapons, in the aftermath of the Iran-Iraq War

09-04.title: End of the Western Roman Empire 476 Romulus Augustulus
09-04.description: On September 4, 476, End of the Western Roman Empire 476 Romulus Augustulus, the last Western Roman Emperor, abdicates after forces led by Odoacer invade Rome, the traditional date for the end of the Western Roman Empire

09-04.title: Navigator Henry Hudson is the first European to
09-04.description: On September 4, 1609, Navigator Henry Hudson is the first European to discover the island of Manhattan [or September 11]

09-04.title: Los Angeles is founded by 44 Spanish-speaking mestizos
