09-04.description: On September 4, 1781, Los Angeles is founded by 44 Spanish-speaking mestizos in the Bahía de las Fumas (Bay of Smokes)

09-04.title: General Lee begins the Maryland Campaign
09-04.description: On September 4, 1862, General Lee begins the Maryland Campaign, invading the North with 50,000 Confederate troops (U.S. Civil War)

09-04.title: Little Rock Crisis 1957 Governor of Arkansas
09-04.description: On September 4, 1957, Little Rock Crisis 1957 Governor of Arkansas, Orval Faubus, calls out the National Guard to prevent nine Black students from entering Little Rock Central High School

09-05.title: The Great Fire of London 1666 Firebreaks finally bring
09-05.description: On September 5, 1666, The Great Fire of London 1666 Firebreaks finally bring the Great Fire of London under control, leaving 13,200 houses destroyed and eight dead

09-05.title: Twelve of the thirteen American colonies adopt a trade
09-05.description: On September 5, 1774, Twelve of the thirteen American colonies adopt a trade embargo against Great Britain at the First Continental Congress in Carpenters' Hall, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

09-05.title: Battle That Gave Birth To The USA 1781 A French fleet
09-05.description: On September 5, 1781, Battle That Gave Birth To The USA 1781 A French fleet of 24 ships under Comte de Grasse defeats British forces under Admiral Thomas Graves and Samuel Hood at the Battle of the Chesapeake (Battle of the Virginia Capes) and traps General Lord Charles Cornwallis during the American Revolutionary War

09-05.title: First Opium War begins between the British Empire and
09-05.description: On September 5, 1839, First Opium War begins between the British Empire and the Qing dynasty of China

09-05.title: First color video recording on magnetic tape is
09-05.description: On September 5, 1958, First color video recording on magnetic tape is presented in Charlotte, North Carolina

09-05.title: Hurricane Irma 2017 Hurricane Irma becomes one of the
09-05.description: On September 5, 2017, Hurricane Irma 2017 Hurricane Irma becomes one of the most powerful hurricanes ever recorded in the Atlantic Basin region with winds of 185 mph (280 km/h)

09-06.title: Ferdinand Magellan 's Spanish expedition
09-06.description: On September 6, 1522, Ferdinand Magellan 's Spanish expedition, now led by Juan Sebastián Elcano, returns to Seville without its captain after a three-year epic voyage, becoming the first to circumnavigate the globe

09-06.title: The Great Fire of London 1666 After St. Paul's
09-06.description: On September 6, 1666, The Great Fire of London 1666 After St. Paul's Cathedral and much of the city burned down over four days, the Great Fire of London is finally extinguished

09-06.title: US President William McKinley is shot and assassinated
09-06.description: On September 6, 1901, US President William McKinley is shot and assassinated by anarchist Leon Czolgosz while visiting the Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo, New York

09-06.title: New York Times headline announces American explorer
09-06.description: On September 6, 1909, New York Times headline announces American explorer Robert Peary discovered the North Pole 5 months earlier (now thought unlikely)

09-06.title: First Battle of the Marne 1914 World War I: First
09-06.description: On September 6, 1914, First Battle of the Marne 1914 World War I: First Battle of the Marne begins as French and British forces prevent the German advance on Paris

09-07.title: Treaty of Baden signed
09-07.description: On September 7, 1714, Treaty of Baden is signed by the Holy Roman Empire and France, ending the War of the Spanish Succession; France retains Alsace and Landau, and Austria gains the east bank of the Rhine

09-07.title: Battle of Borodino: Napoleon Bonaparte wins a Pyrrhic
09-07.description: On September 7, 1812, Battle of Borodino: Napoleon Bonaparte wins a Pyrrhic victory against Russian General Mikhail Kutuzov in the most ferocious battle of the Napoleonic era; 70,000 are killed

09-07.title: Pedro I, son of King John VI, declares Brazil's
09-07.description: On September 7, 1822, Pedro I, son of King John VI, declares Brazil's independence from Portugal (Independence Day)

09-07.title: Baby Incubator 1888 Edith Eleanor McLean is the first
09-07.description: On September 7, 1888, Baby Incubator 1888 Edith Eleanor McLean is the first baby placed in an incubator at State Emigrant Hospital on Ward's Island, New York

09-07.title: Eugene Lefebvre becomes the first pilot to die in an
09-07.description: On September 7, 1909, Eugene Lefebvre becomes the first pilot to die in an aircraft while test piloting a new French-built Wright biplane at Juvisy

09-07.title: Hitler Will Have to Break Us or Lose the War 1940
09-07.description: On September 7, 1940, Hitler Will Have to Break Us or Lose the War 1940 Beginning of the Blitz as the German Luftwaffe bombs London for the first of 57 consecutive nights, losing 41 bombers as the Nazis prepare to invade Britain [1]

09-08.title: Roman army under General Titus completes the siege of
09-08.description: On September 8, 70, Roman army under General Titus completes the siege of Jerusalem by destroying what remained after four months of occupation and plundering

09-08.title: Battle of Kulikovo: Moscow's great monarch Dmitry
09-08.description: On September 8, 1380, Battle of Kulikovo: Moscow's great monarch Dmitry defeats the Mongols, beginning the decline of the Tatars

09-08.title: The Statue of David 1504 Michelangelo 's statue of
09-08.description: On September 8, 1504, The Statue of David 1504 Michelangelo 's statue of David is unveiled in Florence

09-08.title: First permanent European settlement in the US is
09-08.description: On September 8, 1565, First permanent European settlement in the US is founded in St. Augustine, Florida

09-08.title: Dutch surrender colony of New Netherland
09-08.description: On September 8, 1664, Dutch surrender colony of New Netherland, including New York, to 300 English soldiers

09-08.title: Siege of Leningrad 1941 Siege of Leningrad by German
09-08.description: On September 8, 1941, Siege of Leningrad 1941 Siege of Leningrad by German, Finnish, and eventually Spanish troops begins during World War II; battle lasts over 28 months as Soviets repel the invasion; well over a million lives are lost

09-08.title: Black September hijackings begin as three airliners
09-08.description: On September 8, 1970, Black September hijackings begin as three airliners are hijacked and destroyed by the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine

09-08.title: Queen Elizabeth II dies at Balmoral Castle after
09-08.description: On September 8, 2022, Queen Elizabeth II dies at Balmoral Castle after ruling for 70 years as the UK's longest-serving monarch; her eldest son inherits the throne as King Charles III [1]

09-09.title: Battle of Svolder 1000 Battle of Svolder
09-09.description: On September 9, 1000, Battle of Svolder 1000 Battle of Svolder, Baltic Sea: King Olaf on board the Long Serpent is defeated in one of the greatest naval battles of the Viking Age and leaps to his death overboard

09-09.title: Mary Stuart, at nine months old, is crowned Queen of
09-09.description: On September 9, 1543, Mary Stuart, at nine months old, is crowned Queen of Scots in the central Scottish town of Stirling

09-09.title: Congress officially renames the country as the United
09-09.description: On September 9, 1776, Congress officially renames the country as the United States of America (from the United Colonies)

09-09.title: Alexander Twilight
09-09.description: On September 9, 1817, Alexander Twilight, likely the first African American to graduate from a US college, receives a BA degree from Middlebury College

09-09.title: the Canadian Automobile Machine Gun Brigade (WWI)
09-09.description: On September 9, 1914, First fully mechanized unit in the British Army is created: the Canadian Automobile Machine Gun Brigade (WWI)

09-09.title: Israel and the Palestine Liberation Organization
09-09.description: On September 9, 1993, Israel and the Palestine Liberation Organization exchange letters of mutual recognition

09-09.title: Queen Elizabeth II becomes Great Britain's
09-09.description: On September 9, 2015, Queen Elizabeth II becomes Great Britain's longest-reigning monarch at 63 years and seven months, beating the previous record set by her great-great-grandmother, Queen Victoria

09-10.title: George Washington asks for a spy
09-10.description: On September 10, 1776, George Washington asks for a spy, and Nathan Hale volunteers

09-10.title: American naval commander Oliver Hazard Perry defeats
09-10.description: On September 10, 1813, American naval commander Oliver Hazard Perry defeats the British in the Battle of Lake Erie

09-10.title: Howe Sewing Machine 1846 Elias Howe takes out a US
09-10.description: On September 10, 1846, Howe Sewing Machine 1846 Elias Howe takes out a US patent for a lockstitch sewing machine

09-10.title: Leopold and Loeb are found guilty of the murder of
09-10.description: On September 10, 1924, Leopold and Loeb are found guilty of the murder of Bobby Franks in Chicago in "the crime of the century"

09-10.title: Hamida Djandoubi, convicted of torture and murder, is
09-10.description: On September 10, 1977, Hamida Djandoubi, convicted of torture and murder, is the last person to be executed by guillotine in France

09-10.title: The Large Hadron Collider at CERN
09-10.description: On September 10, 2008, The Large Hadron Collider at CERN, described as the biggest scientific experiment in the history of mankind, is powered up in Geneva, Switzerland

09-10.title: California's August Complex wildfire becomes the
09-10.description: On September 10, 2020, California's August Complex wildfire becomes the largest recorded in state history at 471,000 acres (736 square miles)

09-11.title: Scottish rebel William Wallace defeats the English
09-11.description: On September 11, 1297, Battle of Stirling Bridge: Scottish rebel William Wallace defeats the English

09-11.title: An expulsion order is issued against the Moriscos of
09-11.description: On September 11, 1609, An expulsion order is issued against the Moriscos of Valencia, beginning the expulsion of all of Spain's Moriscos (former Muslims and their descendants)

09-11.title: Battle of Zenta: Holy League forces led by Prince
09-11.description: On September 11, 1697, Battle of Zenta: Holy League forces led by Prince Eugene of Savoy defeat an Ottoman army under Mustafa II near Zenta in the Kingdom of Hungary, ending Ottoman control over large parts of Central Europe

09-11.title: Great Northern War: Charles XII of Sweden stops his
09-11.description: On September 11, 1708, Great Northern War: Charles XII of Sweden stops his march to conquer Moscow outside Smolensk, the turning point in the war

09-11.title: First Supermarket 1916 First true self-service
09-11.description: On September 11, 1916, First Supermarket 1916 First true self-service supermarket, Clarence Saunders' " Piggly Wiggly," opens in Memphis, Tennessee [1]

09-11.title: Passengers and crew of United Airlines Flight 93
09-11.description: On September 11, 2001, Passengers and crew of United Airlines Flight 93 attempt to retake control of their hijacked plane from terrorists, causing the plane to crash in a Pennsylvania field, killing all 44 people on board

09-11.title: Terrorists hijack a passenger plane and crash it into
09-11.description: On September 11, 2001, Terrorists hijack a passenger plane and crash it into the Pentagon, killing 125 people

09-11.title: 9/11 Attack on NY's World Trade Towers 2001 Two
09-11.description: On September 11, 2001, 9/11 Attack on NY's World Trade Towers 2001 Two passenger planes hijacked by Al-Qaeda terrorists crash into New York's World Trade Center towers, causing the collapse of both and the deaths of 2,606 people

09-12.title: The first submarine is publicly tested in London on
09-12.description: On September 12, 1624, The first submarine is publicly tested in London on the Thames for King James I

09-12.title: French astronomer Charles Messier mistakes the Crab
09-12.description: On September 12, 1758, French astronomer Charles Messier mistakes the Crab Nebula for a comet while searching for Halley's Comet, leading him to begin his Messier Catalogue

09-12.title: World's first patent for synthetic rubber granted to
09-12.description: On September 12, 1909, World's first patent for synthetic rubber granted to German chemist Fritz Hofmann

09-12.title: Dog Unearths Cave of Antiquity 1940 Four teenagers
09-12.description: On September 12, 1940, Dog Unearths Cave of Antiquity 1940 Four teenagers follow their dog down a hole near Lascaux, France, and discover 17,000-year-old drawings now known as the Lascaux Cave Paintings

09-12.title: Little Rock Crisis 1958 US Supreme Court orders the
09-12.description: On September 12, 1958, Little Rock Crisis 1958 US Supreme Court orders the all-white Central High School in Little Rock, Arkansas, to integrate

09-12.title: Luna 2 is launched by the Soviet Union
09-12.description: On September 12, 1959, Luna 2 is launched by the Soviet Union, becoming the first spacecraft to impact the Moon

09-13.title: BC Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus on Rome's
09-13.description: On September 13, BC Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus on Rome's Capitoline Hill is dedicated on the Ides of September

09-13.title: Church of the Holy Sepulchre is consecrated in
09-13.description: On September 13, 335, Church of the Holy Sepulchre is consecrated in Jerusalem

09-13.title: Francis of Assisi is afflicted with stigmata after a
09-13.description: On September 13, 1224, Francis of Assisi is afflicted with stigmata after a vision while praying on Mount La Verna

09-13.title: The Statue of David 1501 Michelangelo begins work on
09-13.description: On September 13, 1501, The Statue of David 1501 Michelangelo begins work on his statue of David, a masterpiece of Renaissance sculpture

09-13.title: Grand Assault on Gibraltar 1782 The Grand Assault on
09-13.description: On September 13, 1782, Grand Assault on Gibraltar 1782 The Grand Assault on Gibraltar by the allied French and Spanish fleets, including ten floating batteries and land forces, is heavily defeated by the British garrison, with all floating batteries destroyed and allied casualties of 1,473 compared to only 83 for the British

09-13.title: English chemist Michael Faraday discovers the "Faraday
09-13.description: On September 13, 1845, English chemist Michael Faraday discovers the "Faraday effect," the influence of a magnetic field on polarized light

09-13.title: Battle of Chapultepec: American forces capture
09-13.description: On September 13, 1847, Battle of Chapultepec: American forces capture Chapultepec Castle during the Mexican–American War, allowing US General Winfield Scott to take Mexico City

09-13.title: Public unveiling of the Oslo Accords
09-13.description: On September 13, 1993, Public unveiling of the Oslo Accords, an Israeli-Palestinian peace agreement initiated by Norway, signed by Israeli Minister of Foreign Affairs Shimon Peres and PLO official Mahmoud Abbas

09-14.title: Gregory Conquers Julius Caesar 1752 Britain and the
09-14.description: On September 14, 1752, Gregory Conquers Julius Caesar 1752 Britain and the British Empire, including the American colonies, adopt the Gregorian Calendar after skipping 11 days between September 3 and September 13

09-14.title: Burning of Smyrna, the Asia Minor Catastrophe to
09-14.description: On September 14, 1922, Burning of Smyrna, the Asia Minor Catastrophe to Greeks: Ottoman army expels Greeks and other non-Turks from Asia Minor, destroying much of the port city of Smyrna (August 13 OS)

09-14.title: First prefrontal lobotomy in America performed by
09-14.description: On September 14, 1936, First prefrontal lobotomy in America performed by Walter Freeman and James W. Watts at George Washington University Hospital in Washington, D.C.

09-14.title: World's first practical helicopter
09-14.description: On September 14, 1939, World's first practical helicopter, the VS-300, designed by Igor Sikorsky, takes a short tethered flight in Stratford, Connecticut [1]

09-14.title: India's Constituent Assembly adopts Hindi as an
09-14.description: On September 14, 1949, India's Constituent Assembly adopts Hindi as an official language, celebrated today as Hindi Day

09-14.title: IBM 305 RAMAC 1956 IBM introduces the RAMAC 305
09-14.description: On September 14, 1956, IBM 305 RAMAC 1956 IBM introduces the RAMAC 305, the first commercial computer with a hard drive featuring magnetic disk storage, which weighs over a ton

09-14.title: Iraq, Iran, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and Venezuela form
09-14.description: On September 14, 1960, Iraq, Iran, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and Venezuela form the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC)

09-14.title: Astronomers report a possible sign of life on Venus
09-14.description: On September 14, 2020, Astronomers report a possible sign of life on Venus after detecting phosphine in the planet's atmosphere through a telescope [1]

09-14.title: One in 500 Americans has died of COVID-19 as the
09-14.description: On September 14, 2021, One in 500 Americans has died of COVID-19 as the nation's known death toll reaches 663,913 (Johns Hopkins) [1]

09-15.title: First non-aristocratic
09-15.description: On September 15, 1616, First non-aristocratic, free public school in Europe is opened in Frascati, Italy

09-15.title: Act of Independence of Central America: Costa Rica
09-15.description: On September 15, 1821, Act of Independence of Central America: Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras and Nicaragua declare their independence from the Spanish Empire

09-15.title: HMS Beagle, with Charles Darwin on board, reaches the
09-15.description: On September 15, 1835, HMS Beagle, with Charles Darwin on board, reaches the Galápagos Islands

09-15.title: 1st Use of Tanks in War 1916 First use of tanks in
09-15.description: On September 15, 1916, 1st Use of Tanks in War 1916 First use of tanks in warfare, Britain's Mark I "Little Willies" at the Battle of Flers-Courcelette, part of the Battle of the Somme

09-15.title: Hitler Will Have to Break Us or Lose the War 1940
09-15.description: On September 15, 1940, Hitler Will Have to Break Us or Lose the War 1940 Battle of Britain Day: Royal Air Force repulses a major Luftwaffe attack, losing 29 aircraft to the Germans' 57-61 as the tide begins to turn

09-15.title: George Soros ' Quantum Fund begins selling large
09-15.description: On September 15, 1992, George Soros ' Quantum Fund begins selling large amounts of pound sterling, helping force the pound out of the European Exchange Rate Mechanism the next day and earning him the label "the man who broke the Bank of England"

09-16.title: The Mayflower 1620 The Mayflower departs Plymouth
09-16.description: On September 16, 1620, The Mayflower 1620 The Mayflower departs Plymouth, England, with 102 Pilgrims and about 30 crew for the New World [O.S. Sep 6]

09-16.title: British capture Cape Town, South Africa, from the Dutch
09-16.description: On September 16, 1795, British capture Cape Town, South Africa, from the Dutch

09-16.title: Priest Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla rings the church
09-16.description: On September 16, 1810, Priest Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla rings the church bells in Dolores, Mexico, issuing a call to arms known as the "Grito de Dolores" (Cry of Dolores), calling for the end of Spanish rule. Celebrated today as Mexican Independence Day.

09-16.title: Slavery is abolished in all French territories
09-16.description: On September 16, 1848, Slavery is abolished in all French territories

09-16.title: Wall Street Bombing 1920 The " Wall Street bombing "
09-16.description: On September 16, 1920, Wall Street Bombing 1920 The " Wall Street bombing " occurs at 12:01 when a horse-drawn wagon explodes on Wall Street, New York, killing 38 and injuring 143

09-16.title: Federation of Malaysia formed by Malaya
09-16.description: On September 16, 1963, Federation of Malaysia formed by Malaya, Singapore, British North Borneo (Sabah) and Sarawak

09-16.title: Apple Computer Inc. names co-founder Steve Jobs as
09-16.description: On September 16, 1997, Apple Computer Inc. names co-founder Steve Jobs as interim CEO

09-17.title: Arab forces under Amr ibn al-'As conquer Alexandria
09-17.description: On September 17, 642, Arab forces under Amr ibn al-'As conquer Alexandria

09-17.title: Dutch scientist Antonie van Leeuwenhoek is the first
09-17.description: On September 17, 1683, Dutch scientist Antonie van Leeuwenhoek is the first to report the existence of bacteria

09-17.title: Constitution of the United States 1787 US Constitution
09-17.description: On September 17, 1787, Constitution of the United States 1787 US Constitution is signed by delegates at the Philadelphia Convention

09-17.title: Battle of Antietam [Battle of Sharpsburg]: Bloodiest
09-17.description: On September 17, 1862, Battle of Antietam [Battle of Sharpsburg]: Bloodiest day in the American Civil War with 22,000 dead, wounded, or missing in the first major battle on Union soil

09-17.title: World War I flying ace
09-17.description: On September 17, 1916, World War I flying ace, the Red Baron of the German Luftstreitkräfte, wins his first aerial combat near Cambrai, France

09-17.title: Adolf Hitler indefinitely postpones Operation Sealion
09-17.description: On September 17, 1940, Adolf Hitler indefinitely postpones Operation Sealion, the planned German invasion of Great Britain

09-17.title: Anwar Sadat, Menachem Begin, and Jimmy Carter sign
09-17.description: On September 17, 1978, Anwar Sadat, Menachem Begin, and Jimmy Carter sign the Camp David Accords, frameworks for peace in the Middle East and between Egypt and Israel

09-18.title: British East India Company force led by Baron Minto
09-18.description: On September 18, 1811, British East India Company force led by Baron Minto conquers Java, then part of the Dutch East Indies. Stamford Raffles is appointed lieutenant-governor.

09-18.title: Great Fire of Moscow 1812 Great Fire of Moscow burns
09-18.description: On September 18, 1812, Great Fire of Moscow 1812 Great Fire of Moscow burns out after five days, destroys 75% of the city and kills 12,000 people

09-18.title: Government bond agent Jay Cooke & Co collapses
09-18.description: On September 18, 1873, Government bond agent Jay Cooke & Co collapses, causing panic on Wall Street and the start of the Panic of 1873 and the Long Depression

09-18.title: Irish Home Rule Bill receives Royal Assent
09-18.description: On September 18, 1914, Irish Home Rule Bill receives Royal Assent

09-18.title: Mukden Incident: To create a pretext for the invasion
09-18.description: On September 18, 1931, Mukden Incident: To create a pretext for the invasion of Chinese Manchuria, Japanese forces detonate a small quantity of dynamite near a railway line owned by Japan's South Manchuria Railway

09-18.title: Central Intelligence Agency officially comes into
09-18.description: On September 18, 1947, Central Intelligence Agency officially comes into existence after being established by President Truman in July

09-18.title: Chinese Communist Party Chairman Mao Zedong 's funeral
09-18.description: On September 18, 1976, Chinese Communist Party Chairman Mao Zedong 's funeral takes place in Beijing, China

09-19.title: English forces under Edward the Black Prince defeat
09-19.description: On September 19, 1356, English forces under Edward the Black Prince defeat the French at the Battle of Poitiers and capture French King John II during the Hundred Years' War

09-19.title: Siege of Paris by Prussian forces begins
09-19.description: On September 19, 1870, Siege of Paris by Prussian forces begins (lasts until January 28, 1871)

09-19.title: The First Country to Grant Women the Vote 1893 New
09-19.description: On September 19, 1893, The First Country to Grant Women the Vote 1893 New Zealand becomes the first country to grant all women the right to vote

09-19.title: Magnitude 8.0 earthquake rocks Mexico City
09-19.description: On September 19, 1985, Magnitude 8.0 earthquake rocks Mexico City, killing an estimated 10,000 people and leaving 250,000 homeless

09-19.title: US Federal health officials announce the first
09-19.description: On September 19, 1986, US Federal health officials announce the first antiretroviral medication (AZT) to prevent and treat HIV/AIDS will be available to patients

09-20.title: Prophet Muhammad arrives in Yathrib (Medina)
09-20.description: On September 20, 622, Prophet Muhammad arrives in Yathrib (Medina)

09-20.title: Spanish expedition led by Portuguese navigator
09-20.description: On September 20, 1519, Spanish expedition led by Portuguese navigator Ferdinand Magellan sets off on the first successful circumnavigation of the globe ( Magellan is killed en route)

09-20.title: Siege of Ostend 1604 Siege of Ostend ends after Dutch
09-20.description: On September 20, 1604, Siege of Ostend 1604 Siege of Ostend ends after Dutch and English forces surrender the city, allowing Ambrosio Spinola's Spanish army to recapture the devastated city and end one of the bloodiest sieges in history that caused an estimated 100,000 casualties

09-20.title: Battle of the Alma 1854 Battle of the Alma : British
09-20.description: On September 20, 1854, Battle of the Alma 1854 Battle of the Alma : British, French, and Ottoman alliance defeats the Russian Empire in the first major battle of the Crimean War

09-20.title: Rome is captured by the Italian army after Pope Pius
09-20.description: On September 20, 1870, Rome is captured by the Italian army after Pope Pius IX surrenders to King Victor Emmanuel II, unifying Italy and ending the 1,116-year reign of the Papal States

09-20.title: East Germany and West Germany both ratify the
09-20.description: On September 20, 1990, East Germany and West Germany both ratify the reunification plan

09-20.title: In an address to a joint session of Congress and the
09-20.description: On September 20, 2001, In an address to a joint session of Congress and the American people, US President George W. Bush declares a "war on terror"

09-20.title: Students from 185 countries stage the world's
09-20.description: On September 20, 2019, Students from 185 countries stage the world's largest-ever protest on climate change, culminating in a Manhattan rally led by Greta Thunberg

09-21.title: King James I of England gives Scottish courtier and
09-21.description: On September 21, 1621, King James I of England gives Scottish courtier and poet William Alexander a royal charter to colonize Nova Scotia

09-21.title: French First Republic is formed by the National
09-21.description: On September 21, 1792, French First Republic is formed by the National Convention, stripping the French king of his powers

09-21.title: French Revolution : The National Convention passes a
09-21.description: On September 21, 1792, French Revolution : The National Convention passes a proclamation announcing the formal abolition of the French monarchy

09-21.title: Empress Dowager Cixi seizes power and ends the Hundred
09-21.description: On September 21, 1898, Empress Dowager Cixi seizes power and ends the Hundred Days' Reform in China, imprisoning the Guangxu Emperor

09-21.title: Stonehenge 1915 Cecil Chubb buys the prehistoric
09-21.description: On September 21, 1915, Stonehenge 1915 Cecil Chubb buys the prehistoric monument Stonehenge for £6,600 and later donates it to the British nation

09-21.title: US President Warren G. Harding signs a joint
09-21.description: On September 21, 1922, US President Warren G. Harding signs a joint resolution of approval to establish a Jewish homeland in Palestine

09-21.title: Spanish fascist junta names Francisco Franco
09-21.description: On September 21, 1936, Spanish fascist junta names Francisco Franco Generalísimo and Supreme Commander

09-21.title: Mao Zedong and Chinese Communist leaders announce the
09-21.description: On September 21, 1949, Mao Zedong and Chinese Communist leaders announce the establishment of the People's Republic of China at the first plenary session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference at the Huairen Hall in Zhongnanhai, Peking

09-22.title: Salem Witch Trials 1692 The last eight people - Martha
09-22.description: On September 22, 1692, Salem Witch Trials 1692 The last eight people - Martha Corey, Margaret Scott, Mary Easty, Alice Parker, Ann Pudeator, Wilmott Redd, Samuel Wardwell, and Mary Parker - are hanged for allegedly practicing witchcraft as a result of the Salem witch trials in Massachusetts Bay Colony; 19 are hanged overall, with six other deaths caused by the hysteria [1]

09-22.title: Emancipation Proclamation 1862 US President Abraham
09-22.description: On September 22, 1862, Emancipation Proclamation 1862 US President Abraham Lincoln issues the preliminary Emancipation Proclamation, threatening to free all enslaved people in the rebel Southern states if those states fail to rejoin the Union by January 1, 1863 [1]

09-22.title: Ceasefire between India and Pakistan goes into effect
09-22.description: On September 22, 1965, Ceasefire between India and Pakistan goes into effect, ending the Indo-Pakistani War

09-22.title: Iraq invades Iran in an attempt to control the Shatt
09-22.description: On September 22, 1980, Iraq invades Iran in an attempt to control the Shatt al-Arab waterway

09-23.title: Concordat of Worms is agreed between Pope Calixtus II
09-23.description: On September 23, 1122, Concordat of Worms is agreed between Pope Calixtus II and Holy Roman Emperor Henry V

09-23.title: Fall of Tripolitsa: Greek forces massacre 6
09-23.description: On September 23, 1821, Fall of Tripolitsa: Greek forces massacre 6,000 to 15,000 Muslim and Jewish civilians during the Greek War of Independence

09-23.title: Otto von Bismarck is appointed Prime Minister and
09-23.description: On September 23, 1862, Otto von Bismarck is appointed Prime Minister and Foreign Minister of Prussia by King Wilhelm I

09-23.title: American Herman Hollerith patents his mechanical
09-23.description: On September 23, 1884, American Herman Hollerith patents his mechanical tabulating machine, beginning the era of data processing

09-23.title: Little Rock Crisis 1957 President Dwight D. Eisenhower
09-23.description: On September 23, 1957, Little Rock Crisis 1957 President Dwight D. Eisenhower orders US troops to support the integration of nine Black students at Little Rock Central High School in Arkansas after a white mob forces them to withdraw

09-23.title: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi launches "Modicare
09-23.description: On September 23, 2018, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi launches "Modicare," a free healthcare program for 500 million people, the world's largest healthcare initiative

09-24.title: With the death of Manuel I Komnenos
09-24.description: On September 24, 1180, With the death of Manuel I Komnenos, the last Byzantine Emperor of the Komnenian restoration, the Byzantine Empire begins its terminal decline

09-24.title: Christopher Columbus embarks on his second expedition
09-24.description: On September 24, 1493, Christopher Columbus embarks on his second expedition to the New World, setting sail with a fleet of 17 ships

09-24.title: US Federal Judiciary Act passes
09-24.description: On September 24, 1789, US Federal Judiciary Act passes, creating a six-member Supreme Court

09-24.title: Black Friday: Panic on Wall Street after investors Jay
09-24.description: On September 24, 1869, Black Friday: Panic on Wall Street after investors Jay Gould and James Fisk attempt to corner the gold market

09-24.title: Imperial Japanese Army decisively defeats the Satsuma
09-24.description: On September 24, 1877, Battle of Shiroyama: Imperial Japanese Army decisively defeats the Satsuma Rebellion

09-24.title: Operation Magic Carpet 1950 Operation Magic Carpet
09-24.description: On September 24, 1950, Operation Magic Carpet 1950 Operation Magic Carpet concludes after transporting 45,000 Yemenite Jews to Israel

09-25.title: Battle of Stamford Bridge: English army under King
09-25.description: On September 25, 1066, Battle of Stamford Bridge: English army under King Harold II defeats invading Norwegians led by King Harald Hardrada and Harold's brother Tostig, who are both killed

09-25.title: Treaty of York signed
09-25.description: On September 25, 1237, Treaty of York is signed between Kings Henry III of England and Alexander II of Scotland, establishing a boundary between the two countries that remains mostly unchanged in modern times

09-25.title: Spanish explorer Vasco Núñez de Balboa crosses the
09-25.description: On September 25, 1513, Spanish explorer Vasco Núñez de Balboa crosses the Isthmus of Panama, becoming the first European to see the Pacific Ocean

09-25.title: Bill of Rights 1789 The First U.S. Congress proposes
09-25.description: On September 25, 1789, Bill of Rights 1789 The First U.S. Congress proposes the ​ Bill of Rights ​, a set of amendments to the constitution guaranteeing essential liberties, including freedom of speech, freedom of the press, and the right to peaceful assembly

09-25.title: Leonardo Torres Quevedo successfully demonstrates the
09-25.description: On September 25, 1906, Leonardo Torres Quevedo successfully demonstrates the Telekino in Bilbao before a large crowd, guiding a boat from the shore, considered the birth of remote control

09-25.title: Henry Ford announces an 8-hour
09-25.description: On September 25, 1926, Henry Ford announces an 8-hour, 5-day workweek for workers at Ford Motor Company

09-25.title: Sandra Day O'Connor is sworn in as the first female US
09-25.description: On September 25, 1981, Sandra Day O'Connor is sworn in as the first female US Supreme Court Justice

09-26.title: Francis Drake's Circumnavigation 1580 Francis Drake
09-26.description: On September 26, 1580, Francis Drake's Circumnavigation 1580 Francis Drake completes his circumnavigation of the world, sailing into Plymouth, England aboard the Golden Hind

09-26.title: Parthenon 1687 The Acropolis in Athens is attacked by
09-26.description: On September 26, 1687, Parthenon 1687 The Acropolis in Athens is attacked by the Venetian army in an attempt to expel the Turks, damaging the Parthenon

09-26.title: City council of Amsterdam votes to support Prince
09-26.description: On September 26, 1688, City council of Amsterdam votes to support Prince William of Orange 's invasion of England, known as "The Glorious Revolution" in the Netherlands

09-26.title: Russia, Prussia, and Austria sign the Holy Alliance
09-26.description: On September 26, 1815, Russia, Prussia, and Austria sign the Holy Alliance

09-26.title: United Kingdom annexes the Ashanti Kingdom and places
09-26.description: On September 26, 1901, United Kingdom annexes the Ashanti Kingdom and places it under the governor of the Gold Coast (Ghana)

09-26.title: Physics journal Annalen der Physik publishes Albert
09-26.description: On September 26, 1905, Physics journal Annalen der Physik publishes Albert Einstein 's paper "On the Electrodynamics of Moving Bodies"; later considered his special theory of relativity

09-26.title: Meuse-Argonne Offensive begins in western France
09-26.description: On September 26, 1918, Meuse-Argonne Offensive begins in western France, the largest and most costly American offensive of World War I, with more than 1 million US soldiers participating [1]

09-27.title: Norman Invasion of England 1066 William the Conqueror
09-27.description: On September 27, 1066, Norman Invasion of England 1066 William the Conqueror 's troops set sail from Normandy to invade England

09-27.title: Earthquake in the Gulf of Chihli (Bohai Sea) near
09-27.description: On September 27, 1290, Earthquake in the Gulf of Chihli (Bohai Sea) near China reportedly kills 100,000 people

09-27.title: John Adams is appointed to negotiate Revolutionary War
09-27.description: On September 27, 1779, John Adams is appointed to negotiate Revolutionary War peace terms with Great Britain

09-27.title: Mexican revolutionary forces led by Agustín de
09-27.description: On September 27, 1821, Mexican revolutionary forces led by Agustín de Iturbide occupy Mexico City as the Spanish withdraw, bringing an end to the Mexican War of Independence

09-27.title: Rosetta Stone 1822 French scholar Jean-François
09-27.description: On September 27, 1822, Rosetta Stone 1822 French scholar Jean-François Champollion announces he has deciphered Egyptian hieroglyphs using the Rosetta Stone

09-27.title: Ioannis Kapodistrias
09-27.description: On September 27, 1831, Ioannis Kapodistrias, the first Head of State of modern Greece, is assassinated in Nafplion

09-27.title: Model T 1908 Henry Ford 's first Ford Model T
09-27.description: On September 27, 1908, Model T 1908 Henry Ford 's first Ford Model T automobile leaves the Piquette Avenue Plant in Detroit, Michigan

09-28.title: Saint Wenceslas is murdered by his brother Boleslaus I
09-28.description: On September 28, 935, Saint Wenceslas is murdered by his brother Boleslaus I of Bohemia

09-28.title: Norman Invasion of England 1066 William the Conqueror
09-28.description: On September 28, 1066, Norman Invasion of England 1066 William the Conqueror, Duke of Normandy, lands at Pevensey Bay in Sussex, beginning the Norman Conquest of England

09-28.title: Surrender at Yorktown 1781 9
09-28.description: On September 28, 1781, Surrender at Yorktown 1781 9,000 American and 7,000 French troops begin the Siege of Yorktown

09-28.title: Yellow River or Huáng Hé floods in China
09-28.description: On September 28, 1887, Yellow River or Huáng Hé floods in China, killing between 900,000 and 2 million people, one of the deadliest natural disasters in history

09-28.title: German–Soviet Boundary and Friendship Treaty signed
09-28.description: On September 28, 1939, German–Soviet Boundary and Friendship Treaty is signed by Joachim von Ribbentrop and Vyacheslav Molotov ; redraws German and Soviet spheres of influence in central Europe and transfers most of Lithuania to the USSR

09-29.title: securing his position as king of the Persian Empire
09-29.description: On September 29, BC Darius I of Persia kills the Magian usurper Gaumâta, securing his position as king of the Persian Empire

09-29.title: BC Battle of Salamis: The Greek fleet under
09-29.description: On September 29, BC Battle of Salamis: The Greek fleet under Themistocles defeats the Persian fleet under Xerxes I

09-29.title: War of Religion breaks out in France as Huguenots try
09-29.description: On September 29, 1567, War of Religion breaks out in France as Huguenots try to kidnap King Charles IX

09-29.title: ‘Bobbies’ Take To The Streets Of London 1829 First
09-29.description: On September 29, 1829, ‘Bobbies’ Take To The Streets Of London 1829 First units of the London Metropolitan Police appear on the streets of the British capital, the city's first modern police force

09-29.title: Dow Jones Industrial Average falls 777.68 points
09-29.description: On September 29, 2008, Dow Jones Industrial Average falls 777.68 points, its then-largest single-day point loss, following the bankruptcies of Lehman Brothers and Washington Mutual

09-30.title: Suleiman the Magnificent succeeds his father
09-30.description: On September 30, 1520, Suleiman the Magnificent succeeds his father, Selim I, as Ottoman Sultan and rules until 1566

09-30.title: Anesthetic ether is used for the first time by
09-30.description: On September 30, 1846, Anesthetic ether is used for the first time by American dentist Dr. William Morton to extract a tooth

09-30.title: Minister-President of Prussia Otto von Bismarck
09-30.description: On September 30, 1862, Minister-President of Prussia Otto von Bismarck delivers his famous "Blood and Iron" speech on the unification of German territories

09-30.title: The Treaty of Munich signed
09-30.description: On September 30, 1938, The Treaty of Munich is signed by Adolf Hitler, Benito Mussolini, Édouard Daladier, and Neville Chamberlain, forcing Czechoslovakia to give territory to Germany. Chamberlain infamously declares "Peace for our time" upon his return to London.

09-30.title: Nuremberg Trials 1946 Twenty-two Nazi leaders
09-30.description: On September 30, 1946, Nuremberg Trials 1946 Twenty-two Nazi leaders, including Joachim von Ribbentrop and Hermann Goering, are found guilty of war crimes and sentenced to death or prison at the Nuremberg war trials

09-30.title: Ethernet specifications are published by Xerox in
09-30.description: On September 30, 1980, Ethernet specifications are published by Xerox in collaboration with Intel and Digital Equipment Corporation [1]

10-01.title: BC Alexander the Great defeats Darius III of Persia in
10-01.description: On October 1, BC Alexander the Great defeats Darius III of Persia in the Battle of Gaugamela

10-01.title: Prince William of Orange accepts invitation to take up
10-01.description: On October 1, 1688, Prince William of Orange accepts invitation to take up the British crown

10-01.title: Opening of the Congress of Vienna
10-01.description: On October 1, 1814, Opening of the Congress of Vienna, redraws Europe's political map after the defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte

10-01.title: Karl Marx publishes "Das Kapital" in Berlin
10-01.description: On October 1, 1867, Karl Marx publishes "Das Kapital" in Berlin, describing the capitalist system, its instability, and its tendency toward self-destruction

10-01.title: Model T 1908 Henry Ford introduces the Model T car
10-01.description: On October 1, 1908, Model T 1908 Henry Ford introduces the Model T car, priced at $825

10-01.title: World War I: A combined Arab and British force
10-01.description: On October 1, 1918, World War I: A combined Arab and British force, led by Lawrence of Arabia, captures Damascus from the Ottoman Empire

10-01.title: Mikhail Gorbachev becomes Chairman of the Presidium of
10-01.description: On October 1, 1988, Mikhail Gorbachev becomes Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet, effectively head of state of the Soviet Union

10-02.title: Sultan of Egypt Saladin captures Jerusalem from the
10-02.description: On October 2, 1187, Sultan of Egypt Saladin captures Jerusalem from the Crusaders

10-02.title: King Henry VII of England invades France
10-02.description: On October 2, 1492, King Henry VII of England invades France

10-02.title: Bill of Rights 1789 George Washington transmits the
10-02.description: On October 2, 1789, Bill of Rights 1789 George Washington transmits the proposed constitutional amendments, known as the United States Bill of Rights, to the states for ratification

10-02.title: "Prelature of the Holy Cross and the Work of God
10-02.description: On October 2, 1928, "Prelature of the Holy Cross and the Work of God," known as Opus Dei, is founded by Catholic priest Josemaría Escrivá in Madrid, Spain

10-02.title: Polish resistance fighters capitulate in the Warsaw
10-02.description: On October 2, 1944, Polish resistance fighters capitulate in the Warsaw Uprising after an estimated 250,000 people are killed

10-02.title: President Roh Moo-hyun of South Korea walks across the
10-02.description: On October 2, 2007, President Roh Moo-hyun of South Korea walks across the Military Demarcation Line into North Korea on his way to the second Inter-Korean Summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Il

10-03.title: the state of Gojoseon (modern-day Korea) is founded by
10-03.description: On October 3, BC In 2333 BC, the state of Gojoseon (modern-day Korea) is founded by Dangun Wanggeom during the reign of Chinese Emperor Yao

10-03.title: leader of the Gauls
10-03.description: On October 3, BC Vercingetorix, leader of the Gauls, surrenders to the Romans under Julius Caesar, ending the siege and Battle of Alesia

10-03.title: Dafydd ap Gruffydd
10-03.description: On October 3, 1283, Dafydd ap Gruffydd, Prince of Gwynedd, Wales, becomes the first person to be executed by being hanged, drawn, and quartered

10-03.title: First facsimile photo is sent over city telephone
10-03.description: On October 3, 1922, First facsimile photo is sent over city telephone lines in Washington, D.C.

10-03.title: Italy invades Ethiopia
10-03.description: On October 3, 1935, Italy invades Ethiopia, starting the Second Italo-Ethiopian War

10-03.title: German Reunification 1990 Reunification of East
10-03.description: On October 3, 1990, German Reunification 1990 Reunification of East Germany and West Germany; the West German flag is raised above the Brandenburg Gate at the stroke of midnight

10-04.title: First printing in England of the complete
10-04.description: On October 4, 1537, First printing in England of the complete English-language Bible, the "Matthew's Bible," with translations by William Tyndale and Miles Coverdale (an update of the earlier "Coverdale Bible") [exact month/day unclear] [1]

10-04.title: Gregory Conquers Julius Caesar 1582 Last Julian
10-04.description: On October 4, 1582, Gregory Conquers Julius Caesar 1582 Last Julian calendar day in Spain, Portugal, and the Papal States. To sync to the Gregorian calendar 10 days are skipped, and the next date is Oct 15.

10-04.title: The Orient Express 1883 The Orient Express departs on
10-04.description: On October 4, 1883, The Orient Express 1883 The Orient Express departs on its first official journey from Paris to Istanbul

10-04.title: In a final confrontation
10-04.description: On October 4, 1900, In a final confrontation, around 4,000 Ashantis are defeated by the British in the Gold Coast (Ghana)

10-04.title: Soviet Union launches Sputnik I
10-04.description: On October 4, 1957, Soviet Union launches Sputnik I, the first artificial Earth satellite, into an elliptical low Earth orbit

10-04.title: Troops and tanks under President Boris Yeltsin shell
10-04.description: On October 4, 1993, Troops and tanks under President Boris Yeltsin shell and occupy the Russian White House in Moscow, the seat of government of the Russian Federation

10-04.title: Kevin McCarthy becomes the first Speaker of the US
10-04.description: On October 4, 2023, Kevin McCarthy becomes the first Speaker of the US House of Representatives to be removed from office after fellow Republican hardliners, led by Matt Gaetz, vote for his ouster [1]

10-05.title: Letter from Kublai Khan to the Japanese Emperor 1274
10-05.description: On October 5, 1274, Letter from Kublai Khan to the Japanese Emperor 1274 Around 1,000 soldiers of the Mongol army land on the Japanese island of Tsushima in the first attack of Kublai Khan 's Mongol invasion of Japan

10-05.title: Women's March on Versailles 1789 Women of Paris march
10-05.description: On October 5, 1789, Women's March on Versailles 1789 Women of Paris march to Versailles in the March on Versailles to confront Louis XVI about his refusal to promulgate the decrees on the abolition of feudalism, demand bread, and have the king and his court moved to Paris

10-05.title: Battle of the Thames: American forces under General
10-05.description: On October 5, 1813, Battle of the Thames: American forces under General William Henry Harrison defeat Tecumseh 's Confederacy and their British allies led by Henry Procter near Chatham, Upper Canada

10-05.title: Most of Calcutta is destroyed by a cyclone
10-05.description: On October 5, 1864, Most of Calcutta is destroyed by a cyclone, killing approximately 60,000 people

10-05.title: Over 30 major nations ratify the Environmental
10-05.description: On October 5, 1978, Over 30 major nations ratify the Environmental Modification Convention, which prohibits weather warfare that has widespread, long-lasting or severe effects

10-05.title: Chile votes in a referendum 56-44 against extending
10-05.description: On October 5, 1988, Chile votes in a referendum 56-44 against extending Augusto Pinochet 's regime by 8 years, ending the dictator's 16½ years in power

10-05.title: Mass demonstrations in Belgrade culminate in the
10-05.description: On October 5, 2000, Mass demonstrations in Belgrade culminate in the resignation of Serbian strongman Slobodan Milošević, often called the Bulldozer Revolution

10-06.title: Battle of Passchendaele 1917 Third Battle of Ypres:
10-06.description: On October 6, 1917, Battle of Passchendaele 1917 Third Battle of Ypres: Canadian troops recapture the high ground in the village of Passchendaele from the Germans in West Flanders, Belgium, during World War I; over 200,000 casualties occur on each side, and 24,000 German prisoners are taken

10-06.title: Earthquake in Ashgabat kills 100
10-06.description: On October 6, 1948, Earthquake in Ashgabat kills 100,000 in Turkmen Soviet Socialist Republic

10-06.title: Paleoanthropologist Mary Leakey finds the first
10-06.description: On October 6, 1948, Paleoanthropologist Mary Leakey finds the first partial fossil skull of Proconsul africanus, an ancestor of apes and humans, on Rusinga Island, Kenya

10-06.title: US President Harry Truman signs the Mutual Defense
10-06.description: On October 6, 1949, US President Harry Truman signs the Mutual Defense Assistance Act to strengthen NATO allies especially Greece and Turkey

10-06.title: Joseph Stalin announces that the Soviet Union has an
10-06.description: On October 6, 1951, Joseph Stalin announces that the Soviet Union has an atomic bomb

10-06.title: Polio 1956 Scientist Albert Sabin announces that his
10-06.description: On October 6, 1956, Polio 1956 Scientist Albert Sabin announces that his oral polio vaccine is ready for testing; it soon replaces Jonas Salk 's vaccine in many parts of the world

10-06.title: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus
10-06.description: On October 6, 2021, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus recommends the world's first malaria vaccine, Mosquirix, for children after a pilot program proves effective in Africa [1]

10-07.title: Lepanto – The Battle That Saved Europe 1571 Battle of
10-07.description: On October 7, 1571, Lepanto – The Battle That Saved Europe 1571 Battle of Lepanto : Holy League of Catholic states formed by Pope Pius V destroys an Ottoman fleet in a significant defeat off Western Greece

10-07.title: A cyclone causes 40-foot waves that are believed to
10-07.description: On October 7, 1737, A cyclone causes 40-foot waves that are believed to kill 300,000 in Calcutta, India

10-07.title: George III of Great Britain issues the Proclamation of
10-07.description: On October 7, 1763, George III of Great Britain issues the Proclamation of 1763, closing lands in North America north and west of the Alleghenies to white settlement

10-07.title: KLM, Royal Dutch Airlines, is founded in Amsterdam,
10-07.description: On October 7, 1919, KLM (Koninklijke Luchtvaart Maatschappij), Royal Dutch Airlines, is founded in Amsterdam, making it one of the world's oldest airlines

10-07.title: US invasion of Afghanistan begins with an air assault
10-07.description: On October 7, 2001, US invasion of Afghanistan begins with an air assault and covert ground operations

10-07.title: Hamas launches a major air and ground attack on Israel
10-07.description: On October 7, 2023, Hamas launches a major air and ground attack on Israel from Gaza, killing over a thousand people and taking hundreds of hostages, prompting Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to declare, "We are at war" [1]

10-08.title: The Great Stand on the Ugra River 1480 Great Stand on
10-08.description: On October 8, 1480, The Great Stand on the Ugra River 1480 Great Stand on the Ugra River: Standoff between forces of Akhmat Khan, Khan of the Great Horde, and Ivan III, Grand Prince of all Rus, ends with a Tatar-Mongol retreat, leading to the disintegration of the Horde

10-08.title: Captain James Cook lands in New Zealand for the first
10-08.description: On October 8, 1769, Captain James Cook lands in New Zealand for the first time near present-day Gisborne on the East Coast of the North Island. A misunderstanding, possibly over a ceremonial challenge, causes the English to shoot and kill Ngāti Oneone leader Te Maro. [1]

10-08.title: Second Opium War or Second Anglo-Chinese War begins
10-08.description: On October 8, 1856, Second Opium War or Second Anglo-Chinese War begins with the Arrow Incident on the Pearl River

10-08.title: Great Chicago Fire 1871 The Great Chicago Fire kills
10-08.description: On October 8, 1871, Great Chicago Fire 1871 The Great Chicago Fire kills an estimated 300 people and destroys over 4 square miles (10 square km) of buildings and the original Emancipation Proclamation

10-08.title: Battle of Loos ends as German forces contain the
10-08.description: On October 8, 1915, Battle of Loos ends as German forces contain the British attack, resulting in 85,000 casualties

10-08.title: Leon Trotsky is named chairman of the Petrograd Soviet
10-08.description: On October 8, 1917, Leon Trotsky is named chairman of the Petrograd Soviet as Bolsheviks gain control

10-08.title: US President George W. Bush announces the
10-08.description: On October 8, 2001, US President George W. Bush announces the establishment of the Office of Homeland Security

10-08.title: Israel and Hamas agree to first phase of U.S. backed
10-08.description: On October 8, 2025, Israel and Hamas agree to first phase of U.S. backed cease-fire plan two years and a day after the Hamas terrorist attack on Israel that sparked military assault of Gaza. Plan calls for exchanging remaining Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners, Israeli troops pulling back from Gaza, and expansion of humanitarian aid there [1]

10-09.title: Charlemagne and his brother Carloman I are both
10-09.description: On October 9, 768, Charlemagne and his brother Carloman I are both crowned King of the Franks

10-09.title: Leif Erikson reaches "Vinland"
10-09.description: On October 9, 1000, Leif Erikson reaches "Vinland" (possibly L'Anse aux Meadows, Canada), reputedly becoming the first European to reach North America

10-09.title: Korean Hangul alphabet is first published by King
10-09.description: On October 9, 1446, Korean Hangul alphabet is first published by King Sejong the Great

10-09.title: Manhattan Project 1941 US President Franklin D.
10-09.description: On October 9, 1941, Manhattan Project 1941 US President Franklin D. Roosevelt approves an atomic program that would become the Manhattan Project

10-09.title: North Korea conducts its first nuclear test with an
10-09.description: On October 9, 2006, North Korea conducts its first nuclear test with an estimated yield of between 0.4 and 2 kilotons

10-10.title: The Great Hurricane of 1780 hits Barbados and goes on
10-10.description: On October 10, 1780, The Great Hurricane of 1780 hits Barbados and goes on to kill 20,000 to 30,000 people in the Caribbean, making it the deadliest recorded hurricane in the Atlantic

10-10.title: Great Chicago Fire 1871 The Great Chicago Fire is
10-10.description: On October 10, 1871, Great Chicago Fire 1871 The Great Chicago Fire is finally extinguished after three days, leaving approximately 300 dead, 100,000 homeless, and causing $222 million in damage

10-10.title: Chinese revolutionaries begin an armed rebellion
10-10.description: On October 10, 1911, Chinese revolutionaries begin an armed rebellion against the ruling Qing dynasty in Wuchang, causing the Viceroy of Huguang to flee the city (Taiwan National Day)

10-10.title: Ho Chi Minh enters Hanoi after the withdrawal of
10-10.description: On October 10, 1954, Ho Chi Minh enters Hanoi after the withdrawal of French troops

10-10.title: A fire at the Windscale nuclear plant in Cumbria
10-10.description: On October 10, 1957, A fire at the Windscale nuclear plant in Cumbria, England, becomes the world's first major nuclear accident

10-11.title: Earthquake in Aleppo
10-11.description: On October 11, 1138, Earthquake in Aleppo, Syria, kills an estimated 230,000 people

10-11.title: Burchardi flood, known as the second "Grote
10-11.description: On October 11, 1634, Burchardi flood, known as the second "Grote Mandrenke," kills about 15,000 in North Friesland, Denmark, and Germany

10-11.title: An earthquake is reported to have killed 300
10-11.description: On October 11, 1737, An earthquake is reported to have killed 300,000 and destroyed half of Calcutta in India, now thought to have been an exaggerated account of a hurricane that claimed 3,000 of the city's estimated 20,000 residents [1]

10-11.title: Battle of Camperdown: British North Sea fleet led by
10-11.description: On October 11, 1797, Battle of Camperdown: British North Sea fleet led by Admiral Adam Duncan decisively defeats a Dutch fleet led by Vice-Admiral Jan de Winter, capturing eleven Dutch ships

10-11.title: Chinese Civil War begins between the Kuomintang
10-11.description: On October 11, 1945, Chinese Civil War begins between the Kuomintang government led by Chiang Kai-shek and Mao Zedong 's Communist Party

10-11.title: First man-made object to escape the atmosphere (WAC
10-11.description: On October 11, 1945, First man-made object to escape the atmosphere (WAC Corporal) is fired from White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico, reaching 235,000 feet

10-11.title: Second Vatican Council (21st ecumenical) is convened
10-11.description: On October 11, 1962, Second Vatican Council (21st ecumenical) is convened by Pope John XXIII

10-11.title: Reagan and Gorbachev 1986 Ronald Reagan and Mikhail
10-11.description: On October 11, 1986, Reagan and Gorbachev 1986 Ronald Reagan and Mikhail Gorbachev open talks at a summit in Reykjavik, Iceland

10-12.title: BC Army of Cyrus the Great of Persia takes Babylon
10-12.description: On October 12, BC Army of Cyrus the Great of Persia takes Babylon

10-12.title: Nichiren, a Japanese Buddhist monk, founder of
10-12.description: On October 12, 1279, Nichiren, a Japanese Buddhist monk, founder of Nichiren Buddhism, inscribes the Dai-Gohonzon

10-12.title: Christopher Columbus 's expedition makes landfall on a
10-12.description: On October 12, 1492, Christopher Columbus 's expedition makes landfall on a Caribbean island he names San Salvador (likely Watling Island, Bahamas). The explorer believes he has reached East Asia (OS 21 Oct)

10-12.title: Brazilian troops under the command of Gen. João
10-12.description: On October 12, 1864, Brazilian troops under the command of Gen. João Propício Mena Barreto invade Uruguay in a prelude to the War of the Triple Alliance

10-12.title: USS Holland (SS-1) 1900 First modern submarine is
10-12.description: On October 12, 1900, USS Holland (SS-1) 1900 First modern submarine is commissioned by the US Navy as the USS Holland, named for its designer John Philip Holland

10-12.title: Model T 1915 Ford Motor Company under Henry Ford
10-12.description: On October 12, 1915, Model T 1915 Ford Motor Company under Henry Ford manufactures its 1 millionth automobile at the River Rouge plant in Detroit

10-12.title: The Day of Six Billion is proclaimed as the 6
10-12.description: On October 12, 1999, The Day of Six Billion is proclaimed as the 6 billionth living human in the world is born

10-13.title: Agrippina the Younger murders her husband
10-13.description: On October 13, 54, Agrippina the Younger murders her husband, Roman Emperor Claudius, with poison to secure the succession for her son Nero

10-13.title: French King Philip IV has Grand Master Jacques de
10-13.description: On October 13, 1307, French King Philip IV has Grand Master Jacques de Molay and the Knights Templar arrested and charged with idolatry and corruption

10-13.title: International Meridian Conference in Washington
10-13.description: On October 13, 1884, International Meridian Conference in Washington, DC, establishes Greenwich in London, England, as the prime meridian of longitude and establishes Universal Time

10-13.title: Mecca falls without a struggle to Saudi forces led by
10-13.description: On October 13, 1924, Mecca falls without a struggle to Saudi forces led by Abdulaziz Ibn Saud

10-13.title: Italy switches sides and declares war on its former
10-13.description: On October 13, 1943, Italy switches sides and declares war on its former Axis partner, Germany

10-13.title: Battle of Aachen: US 1st Army attacks Aachen
10-13.description: On October 13, 1944, Battle of Aachen: US 1st Army attacks Aachen, the first German city captured during World War II

10-13.title: Copiapó Mine Rescue 2010 Copiapó mining accident in
10-13.description: On October 13, 2010, Copiapó Mine Rescue 2010 Copiapó mining accident in Chile comes to a happy end as all 33 miners arrive at the surface after surviving a record 69 days underground

10-14.title: Norman Invasion of England 1066 Battle of Hastings:
10-14.description: On October 14, 1066, Norman Invasion of England 1066 Battle of Hastings: William, Duke of Normandy and his Norman army defeat the English forces of Harold II, who is killed in the battle

10-14.title: Robert the Bruce of Scotland defeats King Edward II of
10-14.description: On October 14, 1322, Robert the Bruce of Scotland defeats King Edward II of England at the Battle of Old Byland, forcing Edward to accept Scotland's independence

10-14.title: First Continental Congress makes Declaration of
10-14.description: On October 14, 1774, First Continental Congress makes Declaration of Colonial Rights in Philadelphia

10-14.title: George Eastman patents paper strip photographic film
10-14.description: On October 14, 1884, George Eastman patents paper strip photographic film

10-14.title: Nazi Germany announces its withdrawal from the League
10-14.description: On October 14, 1933, Nazi Germany announces its withdrawal from the League of Nations

10-14.title: US President Ronald Reagan proclaims a war on drugs
10-14.description: On October 14, 1982, US President Ronald Reagan proclaims a war on drugs

10-15.title: The first ballet "Ballet Comique de la Reine
10-15.description: On October 15, 1581, The first ballet "Ballet Comique de la Reine," commissioned by Catherine de Medici, is staged in Paris

10-15.title: Gregory Conquers Julius Caesar 1582 Gregorian calendar
10-15.description: On October 15, 1582, Gregory Conquers Julius Caesar 1582 Gregorian calendar is introduced in Spain, Portugal, and the Papal States after skipping 10 days from October 4 to sync the calendar to the solar year and compensate for the drift that has occurred due to the Julian calendar having too many leap days

10-15.title: Napoleon Bonaparte arrives on the island of Saint
10-15.description: On October 15, 1815, Napoleon Bonaparte arrives on the island of Saint Helena to begin his exile

10-15.title: Millions nationwide protest against the Vietnam War on
10-15.description: On October 15, 1969, Millions nationwide protest against the Vietnam War on Moratorium Day in the US

10-15.title: Nelson Mandela and South African President F. W. de
10-15.description: On October 15, 1993, Nelson Mandela and South African President F. W. de Klerk are awarded the Nobel Peace Prize

10-16.title: Battle of Leipzig begins; the largest battle in Europe
10-16.description: On October 16, 1813, Battle of Leipzig begins; the largest battle in Europe prior to World War I, sees Napoleon 's forces defeated by Prussia, Austria, and Russia after 3 days [1]

10-16.title: Great Britain and Germany sign the Yangtze Agreement
10-16.description: On October 16, 1900, Great Britain and Germany sign the Yangtze Agreement, agreeing to maintain the territorial integrity of China and support the "Open Door" policy called for by the US Secretary of State

10-16.title: Mao Zedong and 25,000 troops begin their 6,000-mile
10-16.description: On October 16, 1934, Mao Zedong and 25,000 troops begin their 6,000-mile Long March from the south of China to the north and west

10-16.title: Cuban Missile Crisis 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis begins
10-16.description: On October 16, 1962, Cuban Missile Crisis 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis begins as US President John F. Kennedy is shown photos confirming the presence of Soviet missiles in Cuba

10-16.title: Polish Cardinal Karol Wojtyla is elected Pope John
10-16.description: On October 16, 1978, Polish Cardinal Karol Wojtyla is elected Pope John Paul II

10-16.title: Former Chilean dictator General Augusto Pinochet is
10-16.description: On October 16, 1998, Former Chilean dictator General Augusto Pinochet is arrested in London on a Spanish warrant requesting his extradition on murder charges

10-17.title: French and British forces bombard Sevastopol for the
10-17.description: On October 17, 1854, French and British forces bombard Sevastopol for the first time during the Crimean War

10-17.title: Guglielmo Marconi 's company begins the first
10-17.description: On October 17, 1907, Guglielmo Marconi 's company begins the first commercial transatlantic wireless service between Glace Bay, Nova Scotia, Canada and Clifden, Ireland

10-17.title: Death Railway Completed 1943 Burma Railway
10-17.description: On October 17, 1943, Death Railway Completed 1943 Burma Railway, built by Allied POWs and Asian laborers, is completed for use by the Japanese army

10-17.title: OPEC oil ministers use oil as an economic weapon in
10-17.description: On October 17, 1973, OPEC oil ministers use oil as an economic weapon in the Arab-Israeli War, mandate a cut in exports, and recommend an embargo against unfriendly states [1]

10-17.title: Islamic State headquarters in Raqqa is declared under
10-17.description: On October 17, 2017, Islamic State headquarters in Raqqa is declared under full control of the US-led alliance by Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) spokesperson Talal Sello after four months of fighting

10-18.title: Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem is destroyed
10-18.description: On October 18, 1009, Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem is destroyed by the Fatimid caliph Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah, who hacks the church's foundations down to the bedrock

10-18.title: French King Louis XIV revokes the Edict of Nantes
10-18.description: On October 18, 1685, French King Louis XIV revokes the Edict of Nantes, canceling the rights of French Protestants

10-18.title: Alaska Purchase 1867 US takes formal possession of
10-18.description: On October 18, 1867, Alaska Purchase 1867 US takes formal possession of Alaska from Russia, after paying $7.2 million in the Alaska Purchase

10-18.title: Gangster Al Capone is convicted on five of the 23
10-18.description: On October 18, 1931, Gangster Al Capone is convicted on five of the 23 counts of tax evasion against him, later fined $50,000 and sentenced to 11 years in prison

10-18.title: James Watson (US), Francis Crick (UK), and Maurice
10-18.description: On October 18, 1962, James Watson (US), Francis Crick (UK), and Maurice Wilkins (UK) win the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their work in determining the structure of DNA [1]

10-19.title: BC Battle of Zama: Hannibal Barca and the Carthaginian army are…
10-19.description: On October 19, BC Battle of Zama: Hannibal Barca and the Carthaginian army are defeated by Roman legions under Scipio Africanus, ending the Second Punic War

10-19.title: Surrender at Yorktown 1781 British forces under
10-19.description: On October 19, 1781, Surrender at Yorktown 1781 British forces under General Charles Cornwallis sign terms of surrender to George Washington and Comte de Rochambeau at Yorktown at 2 p.m., effectively ending the American Revolutionary War

10-19.title: Russian Politburo expels Leon Trotsky and his followers
10-19.description: On October 19, 1926, Russian Politburo expels Leon Trotsky and his followers

10-19.title: Streptomycin, the first antibiotic remedy for
10-19.description: On October 19, 1943, Streptomycin, the first antibiotic remedy for tuberculosis, is isolated by researchers at Rutgers University in Piscataway, New Jersey

10-19.title: US Senate establishes Martin Luther King Jr. Day as a
10-19.description: On October 19, 1983, US Senate establishes Martin Luther King Jr. Day as a federal holiday, observed on the third Monday in January (on or near his January 15 birthday)

10-19.title: Black Monday: Stock markets around the world crash
10-19.description: On October 19, 1987, Black Monday: Stock markets around the world crash, including the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which falls 508.32 points (22%), 4.5 times the previous daily record

10-19.title: Scientists from the University of California find
10-19.description: On October 19, 2015, Scientists from the University of California find evidence that life on Earth may have begun 4.1 billion years ago, 300 million years earlier than previously thought

10-20.title: The first Crusaders arrive in Antioch
10-20.description: On October 20, 1097, The first Crusaders arrive in Antioch, Ancient Syria, during the First Crusade

10-20.title: Chinese uprising in the Philippines fails after 23
10-20.description: On October 20, 1603, Chinese uprising in the Philippines fails after 23,000 people are killed

10-20.title: US Senate ratifies the Louisiana Purchase
10-20.description: On October 20, 1803, US Senate ratifies the Louisiana Purchase

10-20.title: US suffragette Alice Paul begins a seven-month jail
10-20.description: On October 20, 1917, US suffragette Alice Paul begins a seven-month jail sentence for peacefully picketing in support of the Women's Suffrage (right to vote) Amendment at the White House in Washington, D.C.

10-20.title: Communist forces end their Long March at Yan'an in
10-20.description: On October 20, 1935, Communist forces end their Long March at Yan'an in Shaanxi, China, bringing Mao Zedong to prominence

10-20.title: 'I Shall Return' 1944 US forces under General Douglas
10-20.description: On October 20, 1944, 'I Shall Return' 1944 US forces under General Douglas MacArthur return to the Philippines with the landing of the US Sixth Army on the island of Leyte

10-20.title: US Justice Department sues Google for an illegal
10-20.description: On October 20, 2020, US Justice Department sues Google for an illegal monopoly over search and search advertising

10-21.title: Horatio Nelson: From Frail Boy to National Hero 1805
10-21.description: On October 21, 1805, Horatio Nelson: From Frail Boy to National Hero 1805 Battle of Trafalgar: British Admiral Horatio Nelson defeats the combined French and Spanish fleet. Nelson is shot and killed during the battle.

10-21.title: Florence Nightingale
10-21.description: On October 21, 1854, Florence Nightingale, with a staff of 38 nurses, is sent to the Crimean War

10-21.title: US troops capture Aachen
10-21.description: On October 21, 1944, US troops capture Aachen, the first large German city to fall in World War II

10-21.title: UN rejects Russian proposal to destroy atomic weapons
10-21.description: On October 21, 1948, UN rejects Russian proposal to destroy atomic weapons

10-21.title: Chinese Communist forces occupy Tibet
10-21.description: On October 21, 1950, Chinese Communist forces occupy Tibet

10-21.title: The Tragedy of Aberfan 1966 116 children and 28 adults
10-21.description: On October 21, 1966, The Tragedy of Aberfan 1966 116 children and 28 adults die as a coal waste heap slides and engulfs a school in Aberfan, South Wales

10-21.title: A failed military coup in Burundi led by ex-President
10-21.description: On October 21, 1993, A failed military coup in Burundi led by ex-President Jean-Baptiste Bagaza, causes 525,000 Hutus to flee and the assassination of President Melchior Ndadaye

10-22.title: Battle of Liaoluo Bay: Dutch East India Company is
10-22.description: On October 22, 1633, Battle of Liaoluo Bay: Dutch East India Company is defeated by Chinese Ming naval forces in the southern Fujian Sea

10-22.title: Emperor of All Russia 1721 Tsar Peter the Great titles
10-22.description: On October 22, 1721, Emperor of All Russia 1721 Tsar Peter the Great titles himself " Emperor of All Russia "

10-22.title: Thomas Edison perfects the carbonized cotton filament
10-22.description: On October 22, 1879, Thomas Edison perfects the carbonized cotton filament light bulb

10-22.title: International Meridian Conference in Washington
10-22.description: On October 22, 1884, International Meridian Conference in Washington, D.C. adopts Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) worldwide and creates 24 international time zones with longitude zero at the Greenwich Meridian

10-22.title: A run on Knickerbocker Trust Company stock leads to a
10-22.description: On October 22, 1907, A run on Knickerbocker Trust Company stock leads to a nationwide run on US banks and the Panic of 1907

10-22.title: Cuban Missile Crisis 1962 US President John F. Kennedy
10-22.description: On October 22, 1962, Cuban Missile Crisis 1962 US President John F. Kennedy makes a live television address about Soviet missile bases in Cuba and imposes a naval blockade on Cuba, beginning the Cuban Missile Crisis

10-23.title: BC Second Battle of Philippi : Brutus 's army is
10-23.description: On October 23, BC Second Battle of Philippi : Brutus 's army is decisively defeated by Mark Antony and Octavian during the Roman Republican civil wars causing Brutus to fall on his sword

10-23.title: Italo-Turkish War 1911 First aerial reconnaissance
10-23.description: On October 23, 1911, Italo-Turkish War 1911 First aerial reconnaissance mission is flown by an Italian pilot over Turkish lines during the Italo-Turkish War

10-23.title: Britain and its Allies launch a major offensive at El
10-23.description: On October 23, 1942, Britain and its Allies launch a major offensive at El Alamein, Egypt, during ​World War II

10-23.title: Paleontologist Elso Barghoorn announces the discovery
10-23.description: On October 23, 1977, Paleontologist Elso Barghoorn announces the discovery of a 3.4 billion-year-old single-celled fossil, one of the earliest life forms on Earth

10-23.title: US national debt reaches $1 trillion
10-23.description: On October 23, 1981, US national debt reaches $1 trillion

10-23.title: Provisional Irish Republican Army of Northern Ireland
10-23.description: On October 23, 2001, Provisional Irish Republican Army of Northern Ireland commences disarmament following peace talks

10-24.title: Qutuz, Mamluk Sultan of Egypt (1259-60), is
10-24.description: On October 24, 1260, Qutuz, Mamluk Sultan of Egypt (1259-60), is assassinated by Baibars, a fellow Mamluk leader, who seizes power for himself

10-24.title: Treaty of Westphalia ends the Thirty Years' War in the
10-24.description: On October 24, 1648, Treaty of Westphalia ends the Thirty Years' War in the Holy Roman Empire; Switzerland's independence is recognized

10-24.title: Another Panic, Another Market Crash 1929 Black
10-24.description: On October 24, 1929, Another Panic, Another Market Crash 1929 Black Thursday: Dow Jones Industrial Average drops 12.8%, starting the stock market crash of 1929

10-24.title: Cuban Missile Crisis 1962 Soviet ships approach but
10-24.description: On October 24, 1962, Cuban Missile Crisis 1962 Soviet ships approach but stop short of the US blockade of Cuba during the Cuban Missile Crisis

10-24.title: Bloody Friday: Many of the world's stock exchanges
10-24.description: On October 24, 2008, Bloody Friday: Many of the world's stock exchanges experience the worst decline in their history, with drops of around 10% in most indices

10-25.title: Battle of Agincourt: Henry V 's forces defeat a larger
10-25.description: On October 25, 1415, Battle of Agincourt: Henry V 's forces defeat a larger French army as the longbow overcomes the armored knight at Azincourt, France

10-25.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
10-25.description: On October 25, 1854, The Charge of the Light Brigade, a Brave and Foolish Tale 1854 Infamous "Charge of the Light Brigade" during the Battle of Balaclava in the Crimean War results in over 100 deaths

10-25.title: US Ambassador to the UN Adlai Stevenson demands USSR
10-25.description: On October 25, 1962, US Ambassador to the UN Adlai Stevenson demands USSR UN representative Valerian Zorin answer concerns about Cuban missile bases, saying, "I am prepared to wait for my answer until hell freezes over"

10-25.title: United Nations votes to expel the Chinese
10-25.description: On October 25, 1971, United Nations votes to expel the Chinese Nationalist-ruled Taiwan and admit the Communist People's Republic of China

10-25.title: Chinese Premier Xi Jinping unveils his new ruling
10-25.description: On October 25, 2017, Chinese Premier Xi Jinping unveils his new ruling council in the Great Hall of the People; none of the five members are young enough to succeed him

10-26.title: Robert McClure sights the fabled Northwest Passage for
10-26.description: On October 26, 1850, Robert McClure sights the fabled Northwest Passage for the first time, from Banks Island towards Melville Island

10-26.title: Pony Express 1861 The Pony Express ends after 19 months
10-26.description: On October 26, 1861, Pony Express 1861 The Pony Express (Missouri to California) ends after 19 months

10-26.title: International conference begins in Geneva aimed at
10-26.description: On October 26, 1863, International conference begins in Geneva aimed at improving medical conditions on battlefields, leads to the formation of the Red Cross

10-26.title: Last natural case of smallpox is discovered in Merca
10-26.description: On October 26, 1977, Last natural case of smallpox is discovered in Merca District, Somalia, and is considered the anniversary of the eradication of smallpox, the most spectacular success of vaccination

10-26.title: Raid by US Special Forces kills ISIS founder and
10-26.description: On October 26, 2019, Raid by US Special Forces kills ISIS founder and leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in Syria

10-27.title: Vision of the Cross 312 Roman Emperor Constantine the
10-27.description: On October 27, 312, Vision of the Cross 312 Roman Emperor Constantine the Great is said to have received his famous Vision of the Cross

10-27.title: Pinckney's Treaty [Treaty of San Lorenzo] signed
10-27.description: On October 27, 1795, Pinckney's Treaty [Treaty of San Lorenzo] is signed by Spain and the US, establishing the southern boundary of the US and giving Americans the right to navigate the Mississippi River

10-27.title: Cuban Missile Crisis 1962 Black Saturday during the
10-27.description: On October 27, 1962, Cuban Missile Crisis 1962 Black Saturday during the Cuban Missile Crisis : An American spy plane is shot down over Cuba and the navy drops warning depth charges on Soviet submarines

10-27.title: China announces its population has exceeded one
10-27.description: On October 27, 1982, China announces its population has exceeded one billion people

10-27.title: British government deregulates financial markets in a
10-27.description: On October 27, 1986, British government deregulates financial markets in a "Big Bang," enhancing London's status as a financial capital and increasing income inequality

10-28.title: Christopher Columbus sights Cuba and claims it for
10-28.description: On October 28, 1492, Christopher Columbus sights Cuba and claims it for Spain under the name "Juana"

10-28.title: The first university in the Americas
10-28.description: On October 28, 1538, The first university in the Americas, the Universidad Santo Tomás de Aquino, is established in Santo Domingo

10-28.title: The Peruvian cities of Lima and Callao are demolished
10-28.description: On October 28, 1746, The Peruvian cities of Lima and Callao are demolished by an earthquake, killing 18,000

10-28.title: Faraday, the Blacksmith's Boy Who Changed the World
