10-28.description: On October 28, 1831, Faraday, the Blacksmith's Boy Who Changed the World 1831 Michael Faraday demonstrates his dynamo invention, an electric generator

10-28.title: Statue of Liberty 1886 The Statue of Liberty is
10-28.description: On October 28, 1886, Statue of Liberty 1886 The Statue of Liberty is dedicated by President Grover Cleveland and is celebrated with the first confetti (ticker tape) parade in New York City

10-28.title: The Volstead Act is passed by Congress
10-28.description: On October 28, 1919, The Volstead Act is passed by Congress, establishing a nationwide ban on alcohol, despite President Woodrow Wilson 's veto

10-28.title: Miner M. de Bruin discovers the infant fossil skull
10-28.description: On October 28, 1924, Miner M. de Bruin discovers the infant fossil skull, "Taung child," in a lime quarry in Taung, South Africa; paleoanthropologist Raymond Dart identifies the fossil as a new hominin species, Australopithecus africanus

10-29.title: freeing Jewish captives and allowing them to return
10-29.description: On October 29, BC King Cyrus "the Great" of Persia marches into Babylon, freeing Jewish captives and allowing them to return home

10-29.title: Conradin, the last legitimate male heir of the German
10-29.description: On October 29, 1268, Conradin, the last legitimate male heir of the German Hohenstaufen dynasty of kings and Holy Roman Emperors, is executed with Frederick I, Margrave of Baden, by Charles I of Sicily

10-29.title: Battle of Mbwila [Ambuila]: Portuguese forces defeat
10-29.description: On October 29, 1665, Battle of Mbwila [Ambuila]: Portuguese forces defeat the Kingdom of Kongo and decapitate King António I of Kongo, also known as Nvita a Nkanga

10-29.title: Another Panic, Another Market Crash 1929 Stock market
10-29.description: On October 29, 1929, Another Panic, Another Market Crash 1929 Stock market crash on Wall Street, known as " Black Tuesday," triggers the Great Depression

10-29.title: China announces the end of its one-child policy after
10-29.description: On October 29, 2015, China announces the end of its one-child policy after 35 years

10-30.title: Battle of Rio Salado (or Tarifa): King Afonso IV of
10-30.description: On October 30, 1340, Battle of Rio Salado (or Tarifa): King Afonso IV of Portugal and King Alfonso XI of Castile defeat Sultan Abu al-Hasan 'Ali of Morocco and Yusuf I of Granada in the last Marinid invasion of the Iberian Peninsula

10-30.title: Boers defeat the British
10-30.description: On October 30, 1899, Battle of Ladysmith: Boers defeat the British, leading to the Siege of Ladysmith in Natal

10-30.title: Russian Tsar Nicholas II grants civil liberties and
10-30.description: On October 30, 1905, Russian Tsar Nicholas II grants civil liberties and accepts the first Duma (Parliament) in the "October Manifesto"

10-30.title: Opening of the Bosphorus Bridge 1973 The Bosphorus
10-30.description: On October 30, 1973, Opening of the Bosphorus Bridge 1973 The Bosphorus Bridge in Istanbul, Turkey, is completed, connecting the continents of Europe and Asia over the Bosphorus for the first time

10-31.title: The Protestant Reformation 1517 Martin Luther sends
10-31.description: On October 31, 1517, The Protestant Reformation 1517 Martin Luther sends his Ninety-five Theses to Albert of Brandenburg, Archbishop of Mainz, precipitating the Protestant Reformation

10-31.title: Michelangelo finishes painting "The Last Judgment" on
10-31.description: On October 31, 1541, Michelangelo finishes painting "The Last Judgment" on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City [1]

10-31.title: Great Backerganj Cyclone of 1876 ravages British India
10-31.description: On October 31, 1876, Great Backerganj Cyclone of 1876 ravages British India (modern-day Bangladesh), killing an estimated 200,000 people

10-31.title: British War Cabinet gives final approval to issue the
10-31.description: On October 31, 1917, British War Cabinet gives final approval to issue the Balfour Declaration to support a "national home for the Jewish people" in what is then Ottoman-controlled Palestine

10-31.title: Spanish Flu 1918 The Spanish flu kills 21
10-31.description: On October 31, 1918, Spanish Flu 1918 The Spanish flu kills 21,000 people in the US in a single week

10-31.title: The world population reaches 7 billion inhabitants
10-31.description: On October 31, 2011, The world population reaches 7 billion inhabitants according to the United Nations

11-01.title: Lisbon earthquake kills more than 50,000 in Portugal
11-01.description: On November 1, 1755, Lisbon earthquake kills more than 50,000 in Portugal

11-01.title: Congress of Vienna opens to re-draw the European
11-01.description: On November 1, 1814, Congress of Vienna opens to re-draw the European political map after the defeat of France, in the Napoleonic Wars

11-01.title: Vaccine for diphtheria is announced by Dr. Émile Roux
11-01.description: On November 1, 1894, Vaccine for diphtheria is announced by Dr. Émile Roux of Paris

11-01.title: Paul Miliukov delivers in the Russian State Duma the
11-01.description: On November 1, 1916, Paul Miliukov delivers in the Russian State Duma the famous "stupidity or treason" speech, precipitating the downfall of the Boris Stürmer government

11-01.title: End of the Ottoman Empire 1922 Mustafa Kemal Atatürk
11-01.description: On November 1, 1922, End of the Ottoman Empire 1922 Mustafa Kemal Atatürk takes Constantinople from Mehmed VI, proclaiming the Republic of Turkey and bringing an end to the Ottoman Empire

11-01.title: "Ivy Mike", the first thermonuclear weapon to utilize
11-01.description: On November 1, 1952, "Ivy Mike", the first thermonuclear weapon to utilize the H-bomb design of Edward Teller and Stanislaw Ulam, is detonated in the Marshall Islands, Pacific Ocean

11-01.title: Maastricht Treaty 1993 The Maastricht Treaty comes
11-01.description: On November 1, 1993, Maastricht Treaty 1993 The Maastricht Treaty comes into effect creating the European Union

11-01.title: Scientists detect evidence of light from the
11-01.description: On November 1, 2012, Scientists detect evidence of light from the universe's first stars, estimated to have formed 500 million years after the Big Bang

11-02.title: Verney Cameron reaches Benguela in Angola from
11-02.description: On November 2, 1875, Verney Cameron reaches Benguela in Angola from Africa's east coast, the first European to cross equatorial Africa from sea to sea

11-02.title: British government proclaims support for a Jewish
11-02.description: On November 2, 1917, British government proclaims support for a Jewish homeland in Palestine in the Balfour Declaration

11-02.title: Coronation of Ras Tafari Makonnen as Haile Selassie I
11-02.description: On November 2, 1930, Coronation of Ras Tafari Makonnen as Haile Selassie I, the 225th Emperor of the Ethiopian Solomonic Dynasty

11-02.title: The Netherlands recognizes its former colony Indonesia
11-02.description: On November 2, 1949, The Netherlands recognizes its former colony Indonesia as a sovereign state at conclusion of the Round Table Conference at the Hague, Netherlands

11-02.title: The Cuban Adjustment Act comes into force
11-02.description: On November 2, 1966, The Cuban Adjustment Act comes into force, allowing 123,000 Cubans opportunity to apply for permanent residence in the US

11-03.title: The second Muslim caliph
11-03.description: On November 3, 644, The second Muslim caliph, Umar ibn al-Khattab, is injured in an assassination attempt in Medina by Lu'lu, an enslaved Persian captive. The caliph dies four days later.

11-03.title: English Parliament passes the Act of Supremacy
11-03.description: On November 3, 1534, English Parliament passes the Act of Supremacy, making Henry VIII and all subsequent monarchs the Head of the Church of England

11-03.title: Great Patent granted to Plymouth Colony
11-03.description: On November 3, 1620, Great Patent granted to Plymouth Colony

11-03.title: English Long Parliament forms
11-03.description: On November 3, 1640, English Long Parliament forms

11-03.title: International Radiotelegraph Conference in Berlin
11-03.description: On November 3, 1906, International Radiotelegraph Conference in Berlin selects the "SOS" (· · · – – – · · ·) distress signal as the worldwide standard for help

11-03.title: Space Dog Laika Launched to her Death 1957 Soviet
11-03.description: On November 3, 1957, Space Dog Laika Launched to her Death 1957 Soviet Union launches Sputnik 2 with space dog Laika aboard, a mostly Siberian Husky, the first animal to orbit the earth; she dies in flight

11-03.title: US President Richard Nixon promises to gradually
11-03.description: On November 3, 1970, US President Richard Nixon promises to gradually remove troops from Vietnam

11-04.title: In Flanders, the Spanish defeat the Walloons and
11-04.description: On November 4, 1576, Eighty Years' War: In Flanders, the Spanish defeat the Walloons and capture Antwerp

11-04.title: Emigrants Crossing the Plains 1841 The first wagon
11-04.description: On November 4, 1841, Emigrants Crossing the Plains 1841 The first wagon train arrives in California after a five-and-a-half-month, 1,730-mile journey over the Sierra Nevada from Missouri [1]

11-04.title: First nationally observed uniform election day in the
11-04.description: On November 4, 1845, First nationally observed uniform election day in the United States, the first Tuesday after the first Monday in November

11-04.title: American inventor Richard Jordan Gatling patents the
11-04.description: On November 4, 1862, American inventor Richard Jordan Gatling patents the hand-cranked Gatling machine gun in Indianapolis

11-04.title: African American inventor Thomas Elkins patents the
11-04.description: On November 4, 1879, African American inventor Thomas Elkins patents the Refrigerating Apparatus [1]

11-04.title: Tutankhamun's Burial Chamber Found 1922 Howard Carter
11-04.description: On November 4, 1922, Tutankhamun's Burial Chamber Found 1922 Howard Carter discovers the intact tomb of Pharaoh Tutankhamun in Egypt

11-04.title: Barack Obama becomes the first African-American to be
11-04.description: On November 4, 2008, Barack Obama becomes the first African-American to be elected President of the United States, defeating Republican candidate John McCain

11-05.title: Christopher Columbus learns how to grow and harvest
11-05.description: On November 5, 1492, Christopher Columbus learns how to grow and harvest maize (corn) from Cuba's Indigenous population

11-05.title: Second Battle of Panipat: Hindu Emperor of North India
11-05.description: On November 5, 1556, Second Battle of Panipat: Hindu Emperor of North India Hem Chandra Vikramaditya is defeated by forces of Mughal Emperor Akbar, who captures and later beheads Hem Chandra

11-05.title: Years of Celebration After Plotters Fail to Kill a
11-05.description: On November 5, 1605, Years of Celebration After Plotters Fail to Kill a King 1605 Catholic conspirator Guy Fawkes attempts to blow up King James I and the British Parliament in the Gunpowder Plot . The plot is discovered, and Guy Fawkes is caught, tortured, and later executed along with seven others. Celebrated ever since as Guy Fawkes Day, his effigy is traditionally burned on a bonfire, accompanied by fireworks.

11-05.title: Adolf Hitler informs his military leaders in a secret
11-05.description: On November 5, 1937, Adolf Hitler informs his military leaders in a secret meeting of his intention to go to war

11-05.title: Britain and France land airborne forces at Port Said
11-05.description: On November 5, 1956, Britain and France land airborne forces at Port Said in Egypt, escalating the Suez Crisis

11-05.title: Supreme Leader of Iran Ayatollah Khomeini describes
11-05.description: On November 5, 1979, Supreme Leader of Iran Ayatollah Khomeini describes the United States as "The Great Satan" amid accusations of imperialism and the sponsoring of corruption

11-06.title: Congress of Chilpancingo declares Mexico independent
11-06.description: On November 6, 1813, Congress of Chilpancingo declares Mexico independent from Spain

11-06.title: Republican Abraham Lincoln of Illinois is elected the
11-06.description: On November 6, 1860, Republican Abraham Lincoln of Illinois is elected the 16th President of the United States of America

11-06.title: Indian civil rights activist M.K. Gandhi is arrested
11-06.description: On November 6, 1913, Indian civil rights activist M.K. Gandhi is arrested for leading an Indian miners' march in South Africa

11-06.title: Red October 1917 Bolshevik Revolution begins with the
11-06.description: On November 6, 1917, Red October 1917 Bolshevik Revolution begins with the bombardment of the Winter Palace in Petrograd during the Russian October Revolution [OS Oct 24]

11-06.title: Shah of Iran Mohammad Reza Pahlavi places the country
11-06.description: On November 6, 1978, Shah of Iran Mohammad Reza Pahlavi places the country under military rule, allowing General Gholām Reza Azhāri to form a government

11-07.title: Ensisheim Meteorite strikes a wheat field near the
11-07.description: On November 7, 1492, Ensisheim Meteorite strikes a wheat field near the village of Ensisheim in Alsace, France. Oldest meteorite with a known date of impact.

11-07.title: Cargo ship Mary Celeste sails from Staten Island for
11-07.description: On November 7, 1872, Cargo ship Mary Celeste sails from Staten Island for Genoa and is mysteriously found abandoned four weeks later

11-07.title: Red October 1917 October Revolution in Russia; Lenin
11-07.description: On November 7, 1917, Red October 1917 October Revolution in Russia; Lenin and the Bolsheviks seize power, capture the Winter Palace and overthrow the Provisional Government [OS Oct 25]

11-07.title: Chinese Soviet Republic
11-07.description: On November 7, 1931, Chinese Soviet Republic, covering parts of 18 provinces and 4 counties under Communist Party control, is proclaimed by leaders Mao Zedong and Zhu De

11-07.title: Controversial US presidential election between George
11-07.description: On November 7, 2000, Controversial US presidential election between George W. Bush and Al Gore is inconclusive; the result in Bush's favor is eventually decided by the Supreme Court

11-07.title: Former Vice President Joe Biden is declared the winner
11-07.description: On November 7, 2020, Former Vice President Joe Biden is declared the winner of the US presidential race four days after the US election, defeating sitting President Donald Trump . Kamala Harris makes history as the first woman and first woman of color elected vice president.

11-08.title: Roman Emperor Theodosius I declares Christianity the
11-08.description: On November 8, 392, Roman Emperor Theodosius I declares Christianity the state religion

11-08.title: First meeting of Aztec Emperor Moctezuma II and
11-08.description: On November 8, 1519, First meeting of Aztec Emperor Moctezuma II and Spanish Conquistador Hernán Cortés in Tenochtitlan, Mexico

11-08.title: William Penn presents the Charter of Privileges
11-08.description: On November 8, 1701, William Penn presents the Charter of Privileges, guaranteeing religious freedom for the colony of Pennsylvania

11-08.title: Vincent La Chapelle
11-08.description: On November 8, 1734, Vincent La Chapelle, master cook to various nobility and royalty, forms a Freemasons Lodge in the Netherlands

11-08.title: German physicist Wilhelm Röntgen produces and detects
11-08.description: On November 8, 1895, German physicist Wilhelm Röntgen produces and detects electromagnetic radiation in a wavelength range today known as X-rays or Röntgen rays

11-08.title: UN Security Council unanimously approves Resolution
11-08.description: On November 8, 2002, UN Security Council unanimously approves Resolution 1441 on Iraq, forcing Saddam Hussein to disarm or face "serious consequences"

11-08.title: Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf is elected president of Liberia
11-08.description: On November 8, 2005, Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf is elected president of Liberia, the first woman to lead an African country

11-08.title: Republican Donald Trump is elected 45th President of
11-08.description: On November 8, 2016, Republican Donald Trump is elected 45th President of the United States, defeating Democrat Hillary Clinton with an Electoral College victory of 304-227; Clinton receives just under 2.9 million more popular votes [1]

11-09.title: Piero the Unfortunate of the de' Medici family
11-09.description: On November 9, 1494, Piero the Unfortunate of the de' Medici family, ruler of Florence, loses power and flees the state

11-09.title: Napoleon Bonaparte pulls off a coup and becomes the
11-09.description: On November 9, 1799, Napoleon Bonaparte pulls off a coup and becomes the dictator of France under the title of First Consul

11-09.title: Tokugawa Yoshinobu
11-09.description: On November 9, 1867, Tokugawa Yoshinobu, the 15th and last Tokugawa Shogun in Japan, resigns due to intense political pressure from pro-imperial factions

11-09.title: Iraqi President Saddam Hussein declares a holy war
11-09.description: On November 9, 1980, Iraqi President Saddam Hussein declares a holy war against Iran

11-09.title: Fall of the Berlin Wall 1989 East Berlin opens its
11-09.description: On November 9, 1989, Fall of the Berlin Wall 1989 East Berlin opens its borders at the Bornholmer Strasse crossing when thousands arrive after East German government official Günter Schabowski mistakenly announces that restrictions on travel to the West will be lifted "immediately, without delay"

11-09.title: Darmstadtium, chemical element 110, is discovered at
11-09.description: On November 9, 1994, Darmstadtium, chemical element 110, is discovered at GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research near Darmstadt, Germany

11-09.title: Brokerage houses are ordered to pay $1.03 billion to
11-09.description: On November 9, 1998, Brokerage houses are ordered to pay $1.03 billion to NASDAQ investors to compensate for price-fixing, the largest civil settlement in US history

11-09.title: Drugmakers BioNTech and Pfizer announce their COVID-19
11-09.description: On November 9, 2020, Drugmakers BioNTech and Pfizer announce their COVID-19 vaccine is over 90% effective in a first look at the results from their phase 3 trial involving nearly 44,000 people

11-10.title: René Descartes has a dream that inspires his
11-10.description: On November 10, 1619, René Descartes has a dream that inspires his "Meditations on First Philosophy"

11-10.title: Dutch Republic formally cedes New Netherland to England
11-10.description: On November 10, 1674, Dutch Republic formally cedes New Netherland to England, who rename it New York

11-10.title: German engineer Gottlieb Daimler unveils his
11-10.description: On November 10, 1885, German engineer Gottlieb Daimler unveils his "Reitwagen", the world's first gasoline-powered motorcycle

11-10.title: Western Union Cable Office in North Sydney
11-10.description: On November 10, 1918, Western Union Cable Office in North Sydney, Nova Scotia, receives a top-secret coded message from Europe stating that on November 11, 1918, all fighting will cease on land, sea, and in the air

11-10.title: How Britain Fell in Love with Lady Chatterley 1960
11-10.description: On November 10, 1960, How Britain Fell in Love with Lady Chatterley 1960 Uncensored version of D. H. Lawrence 's " Lady Chatterley’s Lover " finally goes on sale in the UK after a jury finds publisher Penguin Books not guilty in an obscenity trial

11-10.title: Fall of the Berlin Wall 1989 German crowds begin
11-10.description: On November 10, 1989, Fall of the Berlin Wall 1989 German crowds begin demolishing the Berlin Wall, quickly followed by officials with bulldozers

11-11.title: The Mayflower 1620 Mayflower Compact signed
11-11.description: On November 11, 1620, The Mayflower 1620 Mayflower Compact is signed by Pilgrims at Cape Cod, establishing the first framework of government in the territory that is now the USA [N.S. Nov 21]

11-11.title: German mathematician Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz
11-11.description: On November 11, 1675, German mathematician Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz demonstrates integral calculus for the first time to find the area under the graph of the function y = f(x)

11-11.title: Bonnie Prince Charlie 's Jacobite army invades England
11-11.description: On November 11, 1745, Bonnie Prince Charlie 's Jacobite army invades England in an attempt to restore the House of Stuart to the British throne

11-11.title: End of World War I 1918 World War I Armistice signed
11-11.description: On November 11, 1918, End of World War I 1918 World War I Armistice signed by the Allies and Germany comes into effect, with hostilities ending at 11 a.m., "the eleventh hour of the eleventh day of the eleventh month"

11-11.title: Australian Prime Minister Gough Whitlam is removed
11-11.description: On November 11, 1975, Australian Prime Minister Gough Whitlam is removed from office by Governor-General Sir John Kerr, the first elected Prime Minister removed in Australian history

11-11.title: The Church of England approves the ordination of
11-11.description: On November 11, 1992, The Church of England approves the ordination of female priests

11-11.title: Yasser Arafat 's death from unidentified causes is
11-11.description: On November 11, 2004, Yasser Arafat 's death from unidentified causes is confirmed by the Palestine Liberation Organization, and Mahmoud Abbas is elected PLO chairman shortly after

11-12.title: Tibetan troops occupy Chang'an for 15 days
11-12.description: On November 12, 764, Tibetan troops occupy Chang'an for 15 days, capital of the Chinese Tang Dynasty

11-12.title: A Tale of the Christ " by soldier Lew Wallace is
11-12.description: On November 12, 1880, Ben-Hur Turns Author Into a Soldier of Fortune 1880 Best-selling American novel " Ben-Hur: A Tale of the Christ " by soldier Lew Wallace is published

11-12.title: Leon Trotsky is expelled from the Soviet Communist
11-12.description: On November 12, 1927, Leon Trotsky is expelled from the Soviet Communist Party, paving the way for Joseph Stalin to consolidate complete power

11-12.title: Naval Battle of Guadalcanal begins between Allied and
11-12.description: On November 12, 1942, Naval Battle of Guadalcanal begins between Allied and Japanese naval forces in the Solomon Islands; US forces prevail after days of intense fighting

11-12.title: A Selfie in Space 1966 Buzz Aldrin takes the first "
11-12.description: On November 12, 1966, A Selfie in Space 1966 Buzz Aldrin takes the first " space selfie," a photo of himself performing extravehicular activity in space during the Gemini 12 mission

11-12.title: US Supreme Court: Epperson v. Arkansas declares
11-12.description: On November 12, 1968, US Supreme Court: Epperson v. Arkansas declares unconstitutional the Arkansas law banning the teaching of evolution in public schools

11-12.title: Cyclone Bhola makes landfall in East Pakistan (now
11-12.description: On November 12, 1970, Cyclone Bhola makes landfall in East Pakistan (now Bangladesh), killing up to 500,000 people, making it the deadliest tropical cyclone ever recorded

11-12.title: The World Wide Web is first proposed by CERN computer
11-12.description: On November 12, 1990, The World Wide Web is first proposed by CERN computer scientists Tim Berners-Lee and Robert Cailliau [1]

11-13.title: In a letter to Jean-Baptiste Le Roy
11-13.description: On November 13, 1789, In a letter to Jean-Baptiste Le Roy, Benjamin Franklin writes "in this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes"

11-13.title: First modern sit-down strike by Hormel meatpackers in
11-13.description: On November 13, 1933, First modern sit-down strike by Hormel meatpackers in Austin, Minnesota

11-13.title: US Supreme Court rules racial segregation on buses in
11-13.description: On November 13, 1956, US Supreme Court rules racial segregation on buses in Alabama unconstitutional

11-13.title: US spacecraft Voyager 1 sends back first close-up
11-13.description: On November 13, 1980, US spacecraft Voyager 1 sends back first close-up pictures of Saturn during its fly-by

11-13.title: Nevado del Ruiz volcano erupts in Colombia
11-13.description: On November 13, 1985, Nevado del Ruiz volcano erupts in Colombia, killing 25,000 in the town of Armero

11-13.title: El Chapo Finally Recaptured 2018 Trial of Mexican drug
11-13.description: On November 13, 2018, El Chapo Finally Recaptured 2018 Trial of Mexican drug lord Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán begins in New York, he is charged with drug trafficking, money laundering, and murder

11-14.title: Gottfried Kirch discovers the Great Comet of 1680
11-14.description: On November 14, 1680, Gottfried Kirch discovers the Great Comet of 1680 (Kirch's Comet/Newton's Comet)

11-14.title: American Gail Borden is issued a patent for technology
11-14.description: On November 14, 1856, American Gail Borden is issued a patent for technology related to his invention of condensed milk

11-14.title: Power plant at Niagara Falls begins operation
11-14.description: On November 14, 1896, Power plant at Niagara Falls begins operation

11-14.title: Russia's Bolshevik army occupies Sevastopol
11-14.description: On November 14, 1920, Russia's Bolshevik army occupies Sevastopol, ending anti-communist attempts to regain control of the Russian government

11-14.title: Latest Wonder of the World 1994 First public trains
11-14.description: On November 14, 1994, Latest Wonder of the World 1994 First public trains run through the Channel Tunnel, linking England and France under the English Channel

11-15.title: Christopher Columbus notes in his journal the first
11-15.description: On November 15, 1492, Christopher Columbus notes in his journal the first recorded reference to tobacco

11-15.title: European colonization and trade in Africa are
11-15.description: On November 15, 1884, European colonization and trade in Africa are officially regulated at the international Berlin Conference, formalizing the "Scramble for Africa" among European powers

11-15.title: King C. Gillette patents the safety razor as the
11-15.description: On November 15, 1904, King C. Gillette patents the safety razor as the Gillette razor blade

11-15.title: Mackenzie King retires after 21 years and 154 days as
11-15.description: On November 15, 1948, Mackenzie King retires after 21 years and 154 days as Prime Minister of Canada and is replaced by Louis St. Laurent, who is sworn in as the 12th Prime Minister of Canada

11-15.title: Vietnam War Moratorium Demonstration 1969 An estimated
11-15.description: On November 15, 1969, Vietnam War Moratorium Demonstration 1969 An estimated 2 million people take part in the Vietnam War Moratorium demonstration across the United States

11-15.title: PLO delegation led by Yasser Arafat proclaims the
11-15.description: On November 15, 1988, PLO delegation led by Yasser Arafat proclaims the State of Palestine and recognizes the existence of the State of Israel for the first time, at a conference in Algiers, Algeria.

11-15.title: Leonardo da Vinci 's painting "Salvator Mundi" sells
11-15.description: On November 15, 2017, Leonardo da Vinci 's painting "Salvator Mundi" sells for $450.3 million at auction in New York, a record price for any artwork

11-16.title: Second and final revision of the Justinian Code is
11-16.description: On November 16, 534, Second and final revision of the Justinian Code is published, a codified set of imperial and classical laws initially begun in 528

11-16.title: How 200 Conquistadors Conquered an Empire of 10
11-16.description: On November 16, 1532, How 200 Conquistadors Conquered an Empire of 10 Million 1532 Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro captures Inca Emperor Atahualpa after a surprise ambush at Cajamarca in the Peruvian Andes

11-16.title: Scottish explorer David Livingstone becomes the first
11-16.description: On November 16, 1855, Scottish explorer David Livingstone becomes the first European to see Mosi-oa-Tunya waterfall, which he christens as Victoria Falls, on the Zambezi River in Barotseland, Africa (now Zambia and Zimbabwe)

11-16.title: Founding of the United Nations Educational
11-16.description: On November 16, 1945, Founding of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

11-16.title: Judge With a Passion For Civil Rights 1960 US Marshals
11-16.description: On November 16, 1960, Judge With a Passion For Civil Rights 1960 US Marshals escort four six-year-old African American girls to previously all-white public schools in New Orleans in response to death threats against the girls and race riots

11-17.title: Bloody Mary, England’s Most Hated Queen 1558 Elizabeth
11-17.description: On November 17, 1558, Bloody Mary, England’s Most Hated Queen 1558 Elizabeth I, aged 25, ascends the English throne upon the death of her half-sister, Queen Mary I

11-17.title: Ecuador and Venezuela separate from Gran Colombia
11-17.description: On November 17, 1831, Ecuador and Venezuela separate from Gran Colombia

11-17.title: Suez Canal in Egypt opens
11-17.description: On November 17, 1869, Suez Canal in Egypt opens, linking the Mediterranean and Red Seas

11-17.title: End of the Ottoman Empire 1922 The last sultan of the
11-17.description: On November 17, 1922, End of the Ottoman Empire 1922 The last sultan of the Ottoman Empire, Mehmed VI, is expelled to Malta on a British warship

11-17.title: Stanford Research Institute scientist Douglas
11-17.description: On November 17, 1970, Stanford Research Institute scientist Douglas Engelbart receives the first patent for the computer mouse

11-18.title: "Dictes and Sayings of the Philosophers
11-18.description: On November 18, 1477, "Dictes and Sayings of the Philosophers," the first dated printed book in England, is printed by William Caxton at his press in Westminster

11-18.title: St. Peter's Basilica 1626 St. Peter's Basilica is
11-18.description: On November 18, 1626, St. Peter's Basilica 1626 St. Peter's Basilica is consecrated in Rome, replacing an earlier basilica on the same site and becoming the world's largest Christian church

11-18.title: Battle of the Somme 1916 British General Douglas Haig
11-18.description: On November 18, 1916, Battle of the Somme 1916 British General Douglas Haig finally calls off the First Battle of the Somme in World War I after more than 1 million soldiers are killed or wounded

11-18.title: In Jonestown, Guyana, 918 members of the Peoples
11-18.description: On November 18, 1978, In Jonestown, Guyana, 918 members of the Peoples Temple are murdered or commit suicide under the leadership of cult leader Jim Jones

11-18.title: Black and white leaders in South Africa approve a new
11-18.description: On November 18, 1993, Black and white leaders in South Africa approve a new democratic constitution

11-19.title: Final decree of the Diet of Augsburg
11-19.description: On November 19, 1530, Final decree of the Diet of Augsburg, "The Recess," is signed by Charles V and the Catholic princes, reaffirming Catholic rites and principles after the departure of the Protestant princes

11-19.title: The Mayflower 1620 The Mayflower reaches Cape Cod and
11-19.description: On November 19, 1620, The Mayflower 1620 The Mayflower reaches Cape Cod and explores the coast

11-19.title: Lewis and Clark Expedition
11-19.description: On November 19, 1805, Lewis and Clark Expedition, led by Meriwether Lewis and William Clark, reaches the Pacific Ocean, the first European Americans to cross the West

11-19.title: Words That Echoed Down The Decades 1863 US President
11-19.description: On November 19, 1863, Words That Echoed Down The Decades 1863 US President Abraham Lincoln delivers his Gettysburg Address, starts with " Four score and seven years ago ..."

11-19.title: Operation Uranus: Soviet offensive begins during the
11-19.description: On November 19, 1942, Operation Uranus: Soviet offensive begins during the Battle of Stalingrad, 1 million Soviet soldiers encircle the German Sixth Army

11-19.title: Apollo 12's Charles Conrad and Alan Bean become the
11-19.description: On November 19, 1969, Apollo 12's Charles Conrad and Alan Bean become the 3rd and 4th humans on the Moon

11-19.title: US President Ronald Reagan and Soviet leader Mikhail
11-19.description: On November 19, 1985, US President Ronald Reagan and Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev meet for the first time

11-20.title: Roman General Diocletian is proclaimed emperor by the
11-20.description: On November 20, 284, Roman General Diocletian is proclaimed emperor by the armies of the East and West after the death of Carinus at the Battle of the Margus

11-20.title: Khan of the Uyghurs
11-20.description: On November 20, 762, Khan of the Uyghurs, Bögü Qaghan, conquers Luoyang, the capital of the Chinese Empire

11-20.title: Zumbi, the last king of the Quilombo dos Palmares in
11-20.description: On November 20, 1695, Zumbi, the last king of the Quilombo dos Palmares in early Brazil and a former slave, is executed and decapitated; his head is displayed on a pike to dispel any legends of his immortality

11-20.title: Second Treaty of Paris: France has its borders reduced
11-20.description: On November 20, 1815, Second Treaty of Paris: France has its borders reduced to those of 1790 and agrees to pay 700 million francs in indemnities to end the Napoleonic Wars

11-20.title: Nuremberg Trials 1945 Nuremberg war trials begin as 24
11-20.description: On November 20, 1945, Nuremberg Trials 1945 Nuremberg war trials begin as 24 Nazi leaders are put on trial before judges representing the victorious Allied powers

11-20.title: World Health Organization announces first global
11-20.description: On November 20, 1986, World Health Organization announces first global effort to combat AIDS

11-21.title: commemorated since as the Jewish festival of Hanukkah
11-21.description: On November 21, BC Judas Maccabeus recaptures Jerusalem and rededicates the Second Temple during the Maccabean Revolt, commemorated since as the Jewish festival of Hanukkah

11-21.title: China prohibits the opium trade
11-21.description: On November 21, 1906, China prohibits the opium trade

11-21.title: General Hafez al-Assad becomes Prime Minister of Syria
11-21.description: On November 21, 1970, General Hafez al-Assad becomes Prime Minister of Syria following a military coup known as the Corrective Revolution

11-21.title: Battle of Garibpur: Indian troops aided by the Mukti
11-21.description: On November 21, 1971, Battle of Garibpur: Indian troops aided by the Mukti Bahini, Bengali guerrillas, defeat the army of Pakistan

11-21.title: Robert Mugabe Ousted 2017 Robert Mugabe 's resignation
11-21.description: On November 21, 2017, Robert Mugabe Ousted 2017 Robert Mugabe 's resignation after 37 years in power is read out in Zimbabwe's parliament during impeachment proceedings

11-22.title: Portuguese navigator Vasco da Gama rounds the Cape of
11-22.description: On November 22, 1497, Portuguese navigator Vasco da Gama rounds the Cape of Good Hope on the first voyage from Europe to reach India

11-22.title: Clipper Cutty Sark is launched in Dumbarton
11-22.description: On November 22, 1869, Clipper Cutty Sark is launched in Dumbarton, Scotland, one of the last clippers ever built and the only one still surviving - now serving as a museum ship in Greenwich, England [1]

11-22.title: Imperial Conference ends
11-22.description: On November 22, 1926, Imperial Conference ends, granting autonomy within the British Commonwealth

11-22.title: Flying boat "China Clipper" takes off from Alameda
11-22.description: On November 22, 1935, Flying boat "China Clipper" takes off from Alameda, California, carrying 100,000 pieces of mail on the first trans-Pacific airmail flight

11-22.title: Assassination of John F. Kennedy 1963 While riding in
11-22.description: On November 22, 1963, Assassination of John F. Kennedy 1963 While riding in an open-topped motorcade in Dallas, Texas, US President John F. Kennedy is assassinated by Lee Harvey Oswald

11-22.title: Isolation of a single gene is announced by scientists
11-22.description: On November 22, 1969, Isolation of a single gene is announced by scientists at Harvard University

11-22.title: Angela Merkel becomes the first female Chancellor of
11-22.description: On November 22, 2005, Angela Merkel becomes the first female Chancellor of Germany

11-23.title: Conquest of Seville 1248 Conquest of Seville occurs by
11-23.description: On November 23, 1248, Conquest of Seville 1248 Conquest of Seville occurs by Christian troops under King Ferdinand III of Castile after the city surrenders

11-23.title: "Areopagitica", a pamphlet by John Milton decrying
11-23.description: On November 23, 1644, "Areopagitica", a pamphlet by John Milton decrying censorship, is published

11-23.title: Louis Ducos du Hauron patents a process of making
11-23.description: On November 23, 1868, Louis Ducos du Hauron patents a process of making color photographs, in Paris, France

11-23.title: US Federal Climate report estimates climate change
11-23.description: On November 23, 2018, US Federal Climate report estimates climate change will reduce economy by 10% by 2100 with $141 billion cost from heat-related deaths, $118 billion from sea level rise

11-23.title: Sumatran rhino is officially declared extinct in
11-23.description: On November 23, 2019, Sumatran rhino is officially declared extinct in Malaysia after the last known specimen, 25-year-old Iman, dies of cancer in Sabah, Malaysian Borneo

11-24.title: Theodosius I makes his adventus
11-24.description: On November 24, 380, Theodosius I makes his adventus, or first formal entry, into Constantinople

11-24.title: Transit of Venus 1639 English astronomers Jeremiah
11-24.description: On November 24, 1639, Transit of Venus 1639 English astronomers Jeremiah Horrocks and William Crabtree make the first recorded observations of a transit of Venus by accurately predicting its path using Johannes Kepler 's methods [1]

11-24.title: Dutch explorer Abel Tasman is the first European to
11-24.description: On November 24, 1642, Dutch explorer Abel Tasman is the first European to discover Van Diemen's Land (Tasmania)

11-24.title: English naturalist Charles Darwin publishes "On the
11-24.description: On November 24, 1859, English naturalist Charles Darwin publishes "On the Origin of Species," radically changing the view of evolution and laying the foundation for evolutionary biology

11-24.title: UN troops begin an assault intending to end the Korean
11-24.description: On November 24, 1950, UN troops begin an assault intending to end the Korean War by Christmas

11-24.title: The most complete early human skeleton is discovered
11-24.description: On November 24, 1974, The most complete early human skeleton (Lucy, Australopithecus) is discovered by Donald Johanson, Maurice Taieb, Yves Coppens, and Tim White in the Middle Awash of Ethiopia's Afar Depression [1] [2]

11-25.title: Baldwin IV of Jerusalem defeats Saladin and a larger
11-25.description: On November 25, 1177, Battle of Montgisard: Baldwin IV of Jerusalem defeats Saladin and a larger Ayyubid force

11-25.title: Britain evacuates New York City
11-25.description: On November 25, 1783, Britain evacuates New York City, its last military position in the United States

11-25.title: Cyclone slams southeastern India with high winds and a
11-25.description: On November 25, 1839, Cyclone slams southeastern India with high winds and a 40-foot storm surge, destroying the city of Coringa. Storm waves sweep inland, destroying 20,000 ships and killing an estimated 300,000 people.

11-25.title: First Ad for a Radio Set 1905 The first telegraph
11-25.description: On November 25, 1905, First Ad for a Radio Set 1905 The first telegraph transmitter with a one-mile range is advertised in "Scientific American" for $8.50

11-25.title: Iran-Contra affair erupts as President Reagan reveals
11-25.description: On November 25, 1986, Iran-Contra affair erupts as President Reagan reveals a secret arms deal

11-26.title: Marcus Aemilius Lepidus, and Mark Antony
11-26.description: On November 26, BC Second Triumvirate alliance of Roman leaders formed by Octavian (later Caesar Augustus ), Marcus Aemilius Lepidus, and Mark Antony

11-26.title: British explorer Captain James Cook is the first
11-26.description: On November 26, 1778, British explorer Captain James Cook is the first European to visit Maui in the Sandwich Islands (now Hawaii)

11-26.title: First national Thanksgiving in the US
11-26.description: On November 26, 1789, First national Thanksgiving in the US

11-26.title: First US Cabinet Meeting 1791 First US cabinet meeting
11-26.description: On November 26, 1791, First US Cabinet Meeting 1791 First US cabinet meeting is held at George Washington 's home in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Secretary of State Thomas Jefferson, Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton, Secretary of War Henry Knox, and Attorney General Edmund Randolph attend.

11-26.title: "Alice in Wonderland" by Lewis Carroll is published in
11-26.description: On November 26, 1865, "Alice in Wonderland" by Lewis Carroll is published in America

11-26.title: Tutankhamun's Burial Chamber Found 1922 English
11-26.description: On November 26, 1922, Tutankhamun's Burial Chamber Found 1922 English archaeologist Howard Carter opens Tutankhamun 's nearly intact tomb in Egypt

11-27.title: Pope Urban II preaches to the West to wrest control of
11-27.description: On November 27, 1095, Pope Urban II preaches to the West to wrest control of the Holy Land from the Seljuk Turks at the Council of Clermont, triggering the First Crusade

11-27.title: English King Edward I calls what later becomes known
11-27.description: On November 27, 1295, English King Edward I calls what later becomes known as "The Model Parliament," extending the authority of its representatives

11-27.title: Christopher Columbus returns to the colony of La
11-27.description: On November 27, 1493, Christopher Columbus returns to the colony of La Navidad, finding it destroyed by the first Native American uprising against Spanish rule. Taíno Cacique Caonabo led his people to attack the settlement after the brutal treatment they received from the garrison who disobeyed Columbus's orders.

11-27.title: Portuguese Royal Family Leave for Brazil 1807
11-27.description: On November 27, 1807, Portuguese Royal Family Leave for Brazil 1807 Portuguese Royal Family and its court of nearly 15,000 people leave Lisbon for their colony of Brazil to escape invading Napoleonic troops

11-27.title: Swedish chemist Alfred Nobel establishes the Nobel
11-27.description: On November 27, 1895, Swedish chemist Alfred Nobel establishes the Nobel Prizes through his will, dedicating the bulk of his fortune to funding annual awards for those who have conferred the "greatest benefit to humankind"

11-28.title: Portuguese navigator Ferdinand Magellan begins
11-28.description: On November 28, 1520, Portuguese navigator Ferdinand Magellan begins crossing the Pacific Ocean

11-28.title: The Times of London is first printed by automatic
11-28.description: On November 28, 1814, The Times of London is first printed by automatic, steam-powered presses built by German inventors Friedrich Koenig and Andreas Friedrich Bauer, making newspapers available to a mass audience

11-28.title: The First Country to Grant Women the Vote 1893 New
11-28.description: On November 28, 1893, The First Country to Grant Women the Vote 1893 New Zealand women vote for the first time in a national election [1]

11-28.title: American-born Lady Nancy Astor is elected as the first
11-28.description: On November 28, 1919, American-born Lady Nancy Astor is elected as the first female member of the British House of Commons to take her seat

11-28.title: First radio pulsars are detected by British
11-28.description: On November 28, 1967, First radio pulsars are detected by British postgraduate Jocelyn Bell Burnell and her supervisor Antony Hewish at the University of Cambridge

11-29.title: Thomas Edison's Phonograph 1877 US inventor Thomas
11-29.description: On November 29, 1877, Thomas Edison's Phonograph 1877 US inventor Thomas Edison demonstrates his hand-cranked phonograph for the first time

11-29.title: The first US patent for a traffic light system is
11-29.description: On November 29, 1910, The first US patent for a traffic light system is issued to Chicago engineer Ernest Sirrine [1]

11-29.title: Physicist Erwin Schrödinger publishes his famous
11-29.description: On November 29, 1935, Physicist Erwin Schrödinger publishes his famous thought experiment "Schrödinger's cat", a paradox that illustrates the problem of the Copenhagen interpretation of quantum mechanics

11-29.title: Operation Buster-Jangle: First underground atomic
11-29.description: On November 29, 1951, Operation Buster-Jangle: First underground atomic explosion at Frenchman Flat, Nevada, codenamed "Uncle"

11-29.title: American Airlines begins the first regular commercial
11-29.description: On November 29, 1953, American Airlines begins the first regular commercial New York to Los Angeles air service

11-29.title: US President Gerald Ford signs the Education for All
11-29.description: On November 29, 1975, US President Gerald Ford signs the Education for All Handicapped Children Act, requiring states to provide free education for children with disabilities

11-30.title: King of Denmark, Cnut the Great [Canute], claims the
11-30.description: On November 30, 1016, King of Denmark, Cnut the Great [Canute], claims the English throne after the death of Edmund Ironside

11-30.title: water, malt, and hops
11-30.description: On November 30, 1487, German Beer Purity Law 1487 The first German Beer Purity Law (Reinheitsgebot) is promulgated in Munich by Albert IV, Duke of Bavaria, stating that beer should be brewed from only three ingredients: water, malt, and hops

11-30.title: Grand Duke of Tuscany Leopold II promulgates a penal
11-30.description: On November 30, 1786, Grand Duke of Tuscany Leopold II promulgates a penal reform, making Tuscany the first state to abolish the death penalty; November 30 is now commemorated as Cities for Life Day

11-30.title: Mask of Agamemnon 1876 Archaeologist Heinrich
11-30.description: On November 30, 1876, Mask of Agamemnon 1876 Archaeologist Heinrich Schliemann discovers the gold Mask of Agamemnon at Mycenae in modern Greece, known as "the Mona Lisa of prehistory"

11-30.title: The British House of Lords rejects David Lloyd George
11-30.description: On November 30, 1909, The British House of Lords rejects David Lloyd George 's 'People's Budget,' which aims to shift the tax burden to the wealthy. This leads to the Parliament Act, designed to prevent the unelected House from overruling the will of the elected House

12-01.title: Model T 1913 Ford Motor Company institutes the world's
12-01.description: On December 1, 1913, Model T 1913 Ford Motor Company institutes the world's first moving assembly line for the Model T Ford

12-01.title: Leningrad mayor Sergei Kirov is assassinated; Joseph
12-01.description: On December 1, 1934, Leningrad mayor Sergei Kirov is assassinated; Joseph Stalin uses it as an excuse to begin his Great Purge of 1934-38

12-01.title: Rosa Parks is arrested for refusing to move to the
12-01.description: On December 1, 1955, Rosa Parks is arrested for refusing to move to the back of a bus and give up her seat to a white passenger in Montgomery, Alabama

12-01.title: Latest Wonder of the World 1990 British and French
12-01.description: On December 1, 1990, Latest Wonder of the World 1990 British and French workers meet in the middle of the Channel Tunnel, 40 meters under the English Channel, achieving a major engineering feat and fulfilling the long-held dream of linking Britain to Europe

12-02.title: Coronation of Napoleon Bonaparte 1804 Napoleon
12-02.description: On December 2, 1804, Coronation of Napoleon Bonaparte 1804 Napoleon Bonaparte is crowned Emperor of the French at Notre Dame de Paris in a ceremony officiated by Pope Pius VII

12-02.title: US President James Monroe declares the "Monroe
12-02.description: On December 2, 1823, US President James Monroe declares the "Monroe Doctrine" opposing European colonialism in the Americas, arguing any European political intervention in the New World would be a hostile act against the United States

12-02.title: US President James K. Polk announces to Congress that
12-02.description: On December 2, 1845, US President James K. Polk announces to Congress that the United States should aggressively expand into the West, a widely held belief termed "manifest destiny" by newspaper editor John O'Sullivan

12-02.title: The first skull of Peking Man is found in the caves of
12-02.description: On December 2, 1929, The first skull of Peking Man is found in the caves of Zhoukoudian, 50 km outside of Peking, China, and is later dated to be roughly 750,000 years old [1]

12-02.title: Communist revolutionary Fidel Castro becomes President
12-02.description: On December 2, 1976, Communist revolutionary Fidel Castro becomes President of Cuba, replacing Osvaldo Dorticós Torrado

12-02.title: Benazir Bhutto becomes Prime Minister of Pakistan
12-02.description: On December 2, 1988, Benazir Bhutto becomes Prime Minister of Pakistan, the first female leader of a Muslim country

12-03.title: Eureka Stockade 1854 Eureka Stockade : In what many
12-03.description: On December 3, 1854, Eureka Stockade 1854 Eureka Stockade : In what many claim to be the birth of Australian democracy, more than 20 gold miners at Ballarat, Victoria, are killed by state troopers in an uprising over mining licences

12-03.title: South African surgeon Dr. Christiaan Barnard performs
12-03.description: On December 3, 1967, South African surgeon Dr. Christiaan Barnard performs the world's first human-to-human heart transplant, on Louis Washkansky, at Groote Schuur Hospital in Cape Town; he survives for 18 days

12-03.title: Bhopal disaster: A Union Carbide pesticide plant leaks
12-03.description: On December 3, 1984, Bhopal disaster: A Union Carbide pesticide plant leaks 45 tons of methyl isocyanate and other toxic compounds in Bhopal, India, officially killing 2,259. Other estimates are as high as 16,000 (including later deaths) and over half a million injured.

12-03.title: Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev and US President
12-03.description: On December 3, 1989, Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev and US President George H. W. Bush declare the Cold War over

12-04.title: Ottoman Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent occupies
12-04.description: On December 4, 1534, Ottoman Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent occupies Baghdad

12-04.title: Council of Trent holds its last session after 18 years
12-04.description: On December 4, 1563, Council of Trent holds its last session after 18 years, the last ecumenical council for more than 300 years

12-04.title: The First Thanksgiving 1619 Thirty-eight colonists
12-04.description: On December 4, 1619, The First Thanksgiving 1619 Thirty-eight colonists from Berkeley Parish, England, disembark in Virginia and give thanks to God, considered by many the first Thanksgiving in the Americas

12-04.title: First Issue of The Observer 1791 Britain's " The
12-04.description: On December 4, 1791, First Issue of The Observer 1791 Britain's " The Observer " is first published and becomes the world's oldest Sunday newspaper

12-04.title: Britain outlaws "suttee" in India
12-04.description: On December 4, 1829, Britain outlaws "suttee" in India, a Hindu practice where a widow burns herself to death on her husband's funeral pyre

12-04.title: US President Woodrow Wilson sails for the Versailles
12-04.description: On December 4, 1918, US President Woodrow Wilson sails for the Versailles Peace Conference in France

12-05.title: Charlemagne becomes the sole King of the Franks after
12-05.description: On December 5, 771, Charlemagne becomes the sole King of the Franks after the death of his brother Carloman

12-05.title: Black Death 1349 500 Jews of the Free Imperial City of
12-05.description: On December 5, 1349, Black Death 1349 500 Jews of the Free Imperial City of Nuremberg are massacred during Black Death riots, part of a wave of pogroms across Western Europe

12-05.title: Earthquake strikes Naples
12-05.description: On December 5, 1456, Earthquake strikes Naples, killing an estimated 35,000 people

12-05.title: Discovery of Gold in California 1848 US President
12-05.description: On December 5, 1848, Discovery of Gold in California 1848 US President James K. Polk triggers the Gold Rush of 1849 by confirming a gold discovery in California

12-05.title: Prohibition ends in the US at 5:32 PM EST when the
12-05.description: On December 5, 1933, Prohibition ends in the US at 5:32 PM EST when the 21st Amendment to the US Constitution is ratified, repealing the 18th Amendment

12-05.title: Four-node ARPANET network is established between the
12-05.description: On December 5, 1969, Four-node ARPANET network is established between the University of California, Los Angeles, Stanford Research Institute, U.C. Santa Barbara, and the University of Utah

12-06.title: Mongol Siege of Kyiv 1240 Mongols led by Batu Khan
12-06.description: On December 6, 1240, Mongol Siege of Kyiv 1240 Mongols led by Batu Khan occupy and destroy Kyiv after an eight-day siege; out of 50,000 people in the city, only 2,000 survive

12-06.title: 13th Amendment of the United States Constitution is
12-06.description: On December 6, 1865, 13th Amendment of the United States Constitution is ratified, abolishing slavery except as a punishment for crime where the party has been duly convicted [1]

12-06.title: Thomas Edison's Phonograph 1877 Thomas Edison enters
12-06.description: On December 6, 1877, Thomas Edison's Phonograph 1877 Thomas Edison enters the offices of Scientific American and turns the crank on his cylinder phonograph, astonishing those present by having it say, "Good morning. How do you do? How do you like the phonograph?" [1]

12-06.title: Anglo-Irish Treaty 1921 Anglo-Irish Treaty is signed;
12-06.description: On December 6, 1921, Anglo-Irish Treaty 1921 Anglo-Irish Treaty is signed; Ireland receives dominion status; partition creates Northern Ireland

12-06.title: Hugo Chávez is elected President of Venezuela
12-06.description: On December 6, 1998, Hugo Chávez is elected President of Venezuela

12-06.title: NASA reveals photographs taken by Mars Global Surveyor
12-06.description: On December 6, 2006, NASA reveals photographs taken by Mars Global Surveyor that suggest the presence of liquid water on Mars

12-07.title: BC Roman orator and politician Marcus Tullius Cicero
12-07.description: On December 7, BC Roman orator and politician Marcus Tullius Cicero is assassinated in Formiae by soldiers under the command of Mark Antony

12-07.title: Inventor Leo Baekeland patents the first thermosetting
12-07.description: On December 7, 1909, Inventor Leo Baekeland patents the first thermosetting plastic, Bakelite, sparking the birth of the plastics industry

12-07.title: Attack on Pearl Harbor 1941 The Imperial Japanese Navy
12-07.description: On December 7, 1941, Attack on Pearl Harbor 1941 The Imperial Japanese Navy, with 353 planes, attacks the US fleet at Pearl Harbor Naval Base, Hawaii, killing 2,403 people

12-07.title: Roman Catholic Pope Paul VI and Orthodox Patriarch
12-07.description: On December 7, 1965, Roman Catholic Pope Paul VI and Orthodox Patriarch Athenagoras I simultaneously lift the mutual excommunications that led to the split of the two churches in 1054 during the Great Schism

12-07.title: A 6.9 magnitude earthquake in Spitak
12-07.description: On December 7, 1988, A 6.9 magnitude earthquake in Spitak, Armenia, kills 25,000 to 50,000 people and leaves up to 500,000 homeless

12-07.title: After widespread public protests
12-07.description: On December 7, 2022, After widespread public protests, China announces a major loosening of COVID-19 restrictions for the entire country, allowing home quarantine and scrapping QR codes, effectively ending China's zero-COVID policy [1]

12-08.title: Abraham Lincoln issues his Amnesty Proclamation and
12-08.description: On December 8, 1863, Abraham Lincoln issues his Amnesty Proclamation and plan for the Reconstruction of the South

12-08.title: US and Britain declare war on Japan
12-08.description: On December 8, 1941, US and Britain declare war on Japan, US enters World War II

12-08.title: FDR’s Day of Infamy Speech 1941 US President Franklin
12-08.description: On December 8, 1941, FDR’s Day of Infamy Speech 1941 US President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivers his famous " Day of Infamy " speech to a joint session of Congress a day after the bombing of Pearl Harbor

12-08.title: Pope Paul VI closes the final session of the Second
12-08.description: On December 8, 1965, Pope Paul VI closes the final session of the Second Vatican Council, an influential ecumenical council that significantly modernizes church practices

12-08.title: The US and USSR reach an agreement on a treaty to
12-08.description: On December 8, 1966, The US and USSR reach an agreement on a treaty to prohibit nuclear weapons in outer space (the Outer Space Treaty), which is signed the following month

12-08.title: The Cuzco Declaration is signed in Cuzco
12-08.description: On December 8, 2004, The Cuzco Declaration is signed in Cuzco, Peru, establishing the Union of South American Nations

12-08.title: Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad resigns and flees to
12-08.description: On December 8, 2024, Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad resigns and flees to Moscow after rebel forces sweep into the capital, Damascus [1]

12-09.title: Byzantine general Belisarius enters Rome while the
12-09.description: On December 9, 536, Byzantine general Belisarius enters Rome while the Ostrogothic garrison peacefully leaves the city, returning the old capital to its empire

12-09.title: Frederick II, later Holy Roman Emperor, is crowned
12-09.description: On December 9, 1212, Frederick II, later Holy Roman Emperor, is crowned King of Germany in Mainz

12-09.title: Douglas Engelbart demonstrates in "The Mother of All
12-09.description: On December 9, 1968, Douglas Engelbart demonstrates in "The Mother of All Demos" the computer system NLS (oN-Line System) to a live audience in San Francisco, showcasing for the first time the mouse, word processing, windows, hypertext links, video conferencing, real-time collaboration, and other modern computing concepts [1]

12-09.title: Solidarity leader Lech Wałęsa wins Poland's first
12-09.description: On December 9, 1990, Solidarity leader Lech Wałęsa wins Poland's first direct presidential election

12-09.title: Operation Restore Hope 1992 US Marines and allied
12-09.description: On December 9, 1992, Operation Restore Hope 1992 US Marines and allied nations launch an amphibious and airborne operation in Mogadishu, Somalia, to restore order to the war-torn nation. Authorized by UN Security Council Resolution 794, passed on December 3.

12-10.title: The Protestant Reformation 1520 Martin Luther publicly
12-10.description: On December 10, 1520, The Protestant Reformation 1520 Martin Luther publicly burns Pope Leo X's papal bull 'Exsurge Domine' which demanded that Luther recant his writings

12-10.title: Isaac Newton 's derivation of Kepler's laws from his
12-10.description: On December 10, 1684, Isaac Newton 's derivation of Kepler's laws from his theory of gravity, contained in the paper “De motu corporum in gyrum” (On the motion of bodies in an orbit), is read to the Royal Society by Edmond Halley .

12-10.title: The metric system is first adopted in France
12-10.description: On December 10, 1799, The metric system is first adopted in France

12-10.title: First Nobel Peace Prizes are awarded
12-10.description: On December 10, 1901, First Nobel Peace Prizes are awarded, first recipients are Red Cross co-founder Henry Dunant and peace activist Frédéric Passy

12-10.title: King Abdicates for Love of Wallis Simpson 1936 Edward
12-10.description: On December 10, 1936, King Abdicates for Love of Wallis Simpson 1936 Edward VIII signs Instrument of Abdication, giving up the British throne to marry American divorcee Wallis Simpson

12-10.title: Nobel Peace Prize presented to Dr. Martin Luther King
12-10.description: On December 10, 1964, Nobel Peace Prize presented to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in Oslo, Norway

12-11.title: Llywelyn ap Gruffydd
12-11.description: On December 11, 1282, Llywelyn ap Gruffydd, the last native and independent Prince of Wales, is killed at the Battle of Orewin Bridge near Cilmeri, close to Builth Wells in mid Wales, by forces of Edward I of England. Gruffydd reigned from 1259 and is known as Llywelyn the Last.

12-11.title: The Mayflower 1620 Mayflower Pilgrims come ashore in
12-11.description: On December 11, 1620, The Mayflower 1620 Mayflower Pilgrims come ashore in Plymouth Bay, traditionally thought to be at Plymouth Rock, Massachusetts [NS: Dec 21]

12-11.title: French King Louis XVI goes on trial
12-11.description: On December 11, 1792, French King Louis XVI goes on trial, accused of high treason and crimes against the state

12-11.title: Iconic painting the "Mona Lisa" is recovered two years
12-11.description: On December 11, 1913, Iconic painting the "Mona Lisa" is recovered two years after it was stolen from the Louvre Museum in Paris

12-11.title: Statute of Westminster gives complete legislative
12-11.description: On December 11, 1931, Statute of Westminster gives complete legislative independence to Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, the Irish Free State, and Newfoundland (not then part of Canada)

12-11.title: United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund
12-11.description: On December 11, 1946, United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF) is established by resolution 57(I) of the UN General Assembly

12-11.title: Delegates from 150 industrialized nations attend a UN
12-11.description: On December 11, 1997, Delegates from 150 industrialized nations attend a UN climate conference in Kyoto, Japan, and reach an agreement to control heat-trapping greenhouse gas emissions

12-12.title: Battle of Nineveh 627 Battle of Nineveh : Byzantine
12-12.description: On December 12, 627, Battle of Nineveh 627 Battle of Nineveh : Byzantine Emperor Heraclius' Byzantine army heavily defeats Persian forces during the Byzantine–Sasanian War of 602–628

12-12.title: Constituent Assembly of Iran votes 257 to 3 to amend
12-12.description: On December 12, 1925, Constituent Assembly of Iran votes 257 to 3 to amend the constitution, officially overthrowing the Qajar dynasty and bestowing the crown upon Reza Shah Pahlavi

12-12.title: United Nations accepts six Manhattan blocks as a gift
12-12.description: On December 12, 1946, United Nations accepts six Manhattan blocks as a gift from John D. Rockefeller Jr .

12-12.title: Kenya becomes an independent republic with Jomo
12-12.description: On December 12, 1964, Kenya becomes an independent republic with Jomo Kenyatta as its first president

12-12.title: US Supreme Court issues its 5-4 decision in Bush v.
12-12.description: On December 12, 2000, US Supreme Court issues its 5-4 decision in Bush v. Gore, resolving the recount dispute in Florida's 2000 presidential election in George W. Bush 's favor and effectively awarding him the presidency over Al Gore

12-12.title: COP21 climate change summit in Paris reaches an
12-12.description: On December 12, 2015, COP21 climate change summit in Paris reaches an agreement between 195 countries to limit the rise in the global average temperature to less than 2°C above pre-industrial levels

12-12.title: British general election is won by Boris Johnson 's
12-12.description: On December 12, 2019, British general election is won by Boris Johnson 's Conservative Party in a landslide victory with an 80 seat majority, while the Scottish National Party wins 48 of 59 seats in Scotland

12-13.title: Francis Drake's Circumnavigation 1577 Francis Drake
12-13.description: On December 13, 1577, Francis Drake's Circumnavigation 1577 Francis Drake sets sail from England on an epic three-year circumnavigation of the world aboard the "Pelican," later renamed the " Golden Hind "

12-13.title: The Massachusetts Bay Colony organizes three militia
12-13.description: On December 13, 1636, The Massachusetts Bay Colony organizes three militia regiments to defend the colony against the Pequot Indians. Recognized today as the founding of the United States National Guard.

12-13.title: Dutch explorer Abel Tasman sights the South Island of
12-13.description: On December 13, 1642, Dutch explorer Abel Tasman sights the South Island of present day New Zealand; initially he calls it Staten Landt and changes it a year later to Nieuw Zeeland [1]

12-13.title: League of Nations establishes the International Court
12-13.description: On December 13, 1920, League of Nations establishes the International Court of Justice in The Hague

12-13.title: The European Union announces that Cyprus
12-13.description: On December 13, 2002, The European Union announces that Cyprus, the Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Slovakia and Slovenia will become members from May 1, 2004

12-13.title: Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein is captured in a
12-13.description: On December 13, 2003, Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein is captured in a spider hole near his home town of Tikrit, during Operation Red Dawn by US forces

12-14.title: Uthman ibn Affan, a companion of Muhammad, is
12-14.description: On December 14, 644, Uthman ibn Affan, a companion of Muhammad, is appointed the third caliph of Islam (644-656)

12-14.title: During St. Lucia's Flood in northwest Netherlands
12-14.description: On December 14, 1287, During St. Lucia's Flood in northwest Netherlands, the Zuiderzee seawall collapses with the loss of over 50,000 lives, the fifth largest recorded flood in history

12-14.title: Princess Mary Stuart succeeds her father James V and
12-14.description: On December 14, 1542, Princess Mary Stuart succeeds her father James V and becomes Queen Mary I of Scotland at 6 days old

12-14.title: First incident of the American Revolution
12-14.description: On December 14, 1774, First incident of the American Revolution, 400 New Hampshire militiamen successfully attack Fort William and Mary and seize its gunpowder and weapons

12-14.title: Heartbreak and Tragedy for Captain Scott 1911
12-14.description: On December 14, 1911, Heartbreak and Tragedy for Captain Scott 1911 Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen 's Antarctic expedition is the first to reach the South Pole

12-14.title: Dayton Agreement 1995 The Dayton Agreement is signed
12-14.description: On December 14, 1995, Dayton Agreement 1995 The Dayton Agreement is signed in Paris by leaders of various governments, including Slobodan Milošević, Alija Izetbegović, Franjo Tuđman, and Bill Clinton, formally ending the Bosnian War in the former Yugoslavia

12-15.title: Byzantine general Belisarius defeats the Vandals led
12-15.description: On December 15, 533, Byzantine general Belisarius defeats the Vandals led by King Gelimer at the Battle of Tricamarum

12-15.title: Hulagu Khan captures and destroys the Hashshashin
12-15.description: On December 15, 1256, Hulagu Khan captures and destroys the Hashshashin stronghold at Alamut in present-day Iran as part of the Mongol offensive in Southwest Asia

12-15.title: Bartolomeu Dias returns to Portugal after becoming the
12-15.description: On December 15, 1488, Bartolomeu Dias returns to Portugal after becoming the first known European to sail around the Cape of Good Hope

12-15.title: German astronomer Simon Marius is the first to observe
12-15.description: On December 15, 1612, German astronomer Simon Marius is the first to observe the Andromeda Galaxy through a telescope, describing it as "like a candle seen at night through a horn"

12-15.title: Bill of Rights 1791 US Bill of Rights is ratified and
12-15.description: On December 15, 1791, Bill of Rights 1791 US Bill of Rights is ratified and becomes Amendments 1 through 10 of the US Constitution when Virginia gives its approval

12-15.title: Napoleon Bonaparte receives a French state funeral in
12-15.description: On December 15, 1840, Napoleon Bonaparte receives a French state funeral in Paris 19 years after his death

12-15.title: Gallipoli: Guts, Glory and Defeat 1915 ANZAC forces
12-15.description: On December 15, 1915, Gallipoli: Guts, Glory and Defeat 1915 ANZAC forces begin their withdrawal from the Gallipoli Peninsula after Ottoman forces successfully defend access to Constantinople

12-15.title: American Psychiatric Association removes homosexuality
12-15.description: On December 15, 1973, American Psychiatric Association removes homosexuality from its list of mental disorders

12-16.title: An Lushan revolts against Chancellor Yang Guozhong at
12-16.description: On December 16, 755, An Lushan revolts against Chancellor Yang Guozhong at Fanyang, initiating the An Lushan Rebellion during the Chinese Tang dynasty

12-16.title: Battle of Noryang Point: In the final naval battle of
12-16.description: On December 16, 1598, Battle of Noryang Point: In the final naval battle of the Imjin War, the allied Korean and Chinese fleets decisively defeat the Japanese

12-16.title: Parliamentarian General Oliver Cromwell appointed as
12-16.description: On December 16, 1653, Parliamentarian General Oliver Cromwell appointed as Lord Protector of England, Scotland and Ireland

12-16.title: Boston Tea Party 1773 Boston Tea Party incident – Sons
12-16.description: On December 16, 1773, Boston Tea Party 1773 Boston Tea Party incident – Sons of Liberty protesters throw tea shipments into Boston Harbor to protest the British-imposed Tea Act and escalating taxation without representation in the British Parliament

12-16.title: 8.5 magnitude earthquake rocks Gansu Province in China
12-16.description: On December 16, 1920, 8.5 magnitude earthquake rocks Gansu Province in China, killing an estimated 200,000 people

12-16.title: Nazi Germany launches a counteroffensive against the
12-16.description: On December 16, 1944, Nazi Germany launches a counteroffensive against the Allies in the Ardennes region of Belgium, beginning the Battle of the Bulge

12-16.title: Iraq disarmament crisis: Operation Desert Fox - the
12-16.description: On December 16, 1998, Iraq disarmament crisis: Operation Desert Fox - the United States and United Kingdom bomb targets in Iraq to degrade its ability to produce, store, maintain, and deliver weapons of mass destruction

12-17.title: Tamerlane captures and sacks Delhi
12-17.description: On December 17, 1398, Tamerlane captures and sacks Delhi, defeating Sultan Nasir-ud-Din Mahmud's armies by setting camels loaded with hay alight and driving them toward the Sultan's armored war elephants

12-17.title: Pope Clement VII publishes the papal bull "Cum ad
12-17.description: On December 17, 1531, Pope Clement VII publishes the papal bull "Cum ad nihil magis", authorizing the Inquisition in Portugal at Evora, Coimbra, and Lisbon; it is rescinded in 1535

12-17.title: Russian army led by Grigory Potemkin assaults and
12-17.description: On December 17, 1788, Russian army led by Grigory Potemkin assaults and captures the fortress of Ochakov in modern-day Ukraine after a five-month siege during a major campaign of the Russo-Turkish War

12-17.title: 1st Airplane Flight 1903 At 10:35 am
12-17.description: On December 17, 1903, 1st Airplane Flight 1903 At 10:35 am, Orville Wright pilots the first sustained, powered, and controlled flight of a heavier-than-air aircraft at Kill Devil Hills near Kitty Hawk, North Carolina; the flight lasts 12 seconds and covers 120 feet

12-17.title: Davina Thompson makes medical history by undergoing
12-17.description: On December 17, 1986, Davina Thompson makes medical history by undergoing the first combined heart, lung, and liver transplant at Papworth Hospital in Cambridge, England

12-18.title: BC Battle of the Trebia: Hannibal's Carthaginian army
12-18.description: On December 18, BC Battle of the Trebia: Hannibal's Carthaginian army heavily defeats Roman forces on Italian soil during the Second Punic War

12-18.title: Mongol Emperor Kublai Khan renames his empire "Yuan"
12-18.description: On December 18, 1271, Mongol Emperor Kublai Khan renames his empire "Yuan" (元 yuán), marking the start of the Yuan Dynasty of China

12-18.title: First fleet of the Dutch East India Company under
12-18.description: On December 18, 1603, First fleet of the Dutch East India Company under Admiral Steven van der Haghen departs for the East-Indies

12-18.title: Abel Tasman 's expedition is the first European voyage
12-18.description: On December 18, 1642, Abel Tasman 's expedition is the first European voyage to reach New Zealand sailing into Wharewharangi Bay at the top of the South Island, making the first confirmed contact with Maori

12-18.title: Prohibition is Ratified 1917 The 18th Amendment to the
12-18.description: On December 18, 1917, Prohibition is Ratified 1917 The 18th Amendment to the US Constitution, authorizing prohibition of alcohol, is approved by the US congress and sent to the states for ratification [1]

12-18.title: World's first full scale nuclear power plant
12-18.description: On December 18, 1957, World's first full scale nuclear power plant, for peacetime use only, begins to generate electricity at the Shippingport Atomic Power Station in Pennsylvania

12-18.title: Stuntman Stanley Barrett unofficially breaks the land
12-18.description: On December 18, 1979, Stuntman Stanley Barrett unofficially breaks the land speed record and the sound barrier in his three-wheeled vehicle the Budweiser Rocket (739.666 mph or Mach 1.01). The speed was never officially recorded and the attempt remains controversial.

12-18.title: US House of Representatives votes to impeach President
12-18.description: On December 18, 2019, US House of Representatives votes to impeach President Donald Trump for abuse of power (230-197) and obstruction of Congress (229-198)

12-19.title: Thomas Paine publishes his first "The American Crisis"
12-19.description: On December 19, 1776, Thomas Paine publishes his first "The American Crisis" essay, beginning "These are the times that try men's souls" [date disputed]

12-19.title: William Pitt the Younger becomes the youngest ever
12-19.description: On December 19, 1783, William Pitt the Younger becomes the youngest ever British Prime Minister at age 24

12-19.title: British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) begins overseas
12-19.description: On December 19, 1932, British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) begins overseas transmissions

12-19.title: First radio broadcast from space
12-19.description: On December 19, 1958, First radio broadcast from space, US President Dwight D. Eisenhower sends a Christmas message "to all mankind, America's wish for peace on Earth and goodwill to men everywhere" [1]

12-19.title: Sino-British Joint Declaration 1984 Chinese Premier
12-19.description: On December 19, 1984, Sino-British Joint Declaration 1984 Chinese Premier Zhao Ziyang and British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher sign the Sino-British Joint Declaration, agreeing to transfer sovereignty over Hong Kong to China in 1997 and to establish the "one country, two systems" framework

12-20.title: Suleiman the Magnificent accepts the surrender of the
12-20.description: On December 20, 1522, Suleiman the Magnificent accepts the surrender of the surviving Knights of Rhodes, who are allowed to evacuate. They eventually settle in Malta and become known as the Knights of Malta.

12-20.title: French flag lowered in New Orleans to signify the
12-20.description: On December 20, 1803, French flag lowered in New Orleans to signify the formal transfer of the Louisiana Purchase from France to the United States, purchased for $15 million

12-20.title: Rumpelstiltskin 1812 " Grimm 's Fairy Tales" or
12-20.description: On December 20, 1812, Rumpelstiltskin 1812 " Grimm 's Fairy Tales" or "Children's and Household Tales " by Jacob Grimm and Wilhelm Grimm is first published

12-20.title: South Carolina General Assembly votes 169-0 to secede
12-20.description: On December 20, 1860, South Carolina General Assembly votes 169-0 to secede from the United States, declaring itself an "independent commonwealth" and is quickly followed by other Southern states, triggering the American Civil War

12-20.title: Improved event: Soviet state security force and
12-20.description: On December 20, 1917, Improved event: Soviet state security force and forerunner to the KGB, the Cheka forms under Felix Dzerzhinsky after a decree by Vladimir Lenin

12-20.title: The National Liberation Front
12-20.description: On December 20, 1960, The National Liberation Front, better known as the Viet Cong, is officially formed in South Vietnam

12-21.title: The Mayflower 1620 Mayflower Pilgrims come ashore in
12-21.description: On December 21, 1620, The Mayflower 1620 Mayflower Pilgrims come ashore in Plymouth Bay, traditionally thought to be at Plymouth Rock, Massachusetts [OS: Dec 11] [some sources disagree, and OS/NS adds to confusion, could be +/- several days]

12-21.title: Scientists Pierre and Marie Curie discover radium
12-21.description: On December 21, 1898, Scientists Pierre and Marie Curie discover radium

12-21.title: First manned Moon voyage launched with Frank Borman
12-21.description: On December 21, 1968, First manned Moon voyage launched with Frank Borman, Jim Lovell and William Anders aboard Apollo 8

12-21.title: Lockerbie Bombing of Pan Am Flight 103 1988 A
12-21.description: On December 21, 1988, Lockerbie Bombing of Pan Am Flight 103 1988 A terrorist bomb destroys Pan Am Flight 103 in mid-air over Scotland, killing all 259 passengers and crew on board and 11 people on the ground [1]

12-21.title: Soviet Union formally dissolves as 11 of 12 republics
12-21.description: On December 21, 1991, Soviet Union formally dissolves as 11 of 12 republics sign a treaty forming the Commonwealth of Independent States

12-22.title: Supposedly impenetrable Turkish fortress of Izmail is
12-22.description: On December 22, 1790, Supposedly impenetrable Turkish fortress of Izmail is stormed and captured by Suvorov and his Russian armies during the Russo-Turkish War (1787–92)

12-22.title: Samurai Itō Hirobumi becomes the first Prime Minister
12-22.description: On December 22, 1885, Samurai Itō Hirobumi becomes the first Prime Minister of Japan

12-22.title: Romanian Revolution 1989 After 23 years of dictatorial
12-22.description: On December 22, 1989, Romanian Revolution 1989 After 23 years of dictatorial rule, Romania ousts communist dictator Nicolae Ceaușescu from power

12-22.title: Labor activist Lech Wałęsa is sworn in as Poland's
12-22.description: On December 22, 1990, Labor activist Lech Wałęsa is sworn in as Poland's first popularly elected president

12-22.title: On This Day launches as HistoryOrb.com
12-22.description: On December 22, 2000, On This Day launches as HistoryOrb.com

12-22.title: Repeal of the "Don't Ask
12-22.description: On December 22, 2010, Repeal of the "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" policy, a 17-year policy banning gay, lesbian, and bisexual people from serving openly in the US military, is signed into law by President Barack Obama after receiving bipartisan support in Congress

12-23.title: Sack of Aleppo 962 Under future Emperor Nikephoros II
