12-23.description: On December 23, 962, Sack of Aleppo 962 Under future Emperor Nikephoros II Phokas, Byzantine troops storm the city of Aleppo and recover the tattered tunic of John the Baptist during the Arab–Byzantine wars

12-23.title: King James II, the last Roman Catholic British
12-23.description: On December 23, 1688, King James II, the last Roman Catholic British monarch, flees to France from William of Orange

12-23.title: US General George Washington resigns his military
12-23.description: On December 23, 1783, US General George Washington resigns his military commission as Commander-in-Chief of the Army to Congress

12-23.title: Vincent van Gogh cuts off part of his left ear with a
12-23.description: On December 23, 1888, Vincent van Gogh cuts off part of his left ear with a razor after an argument with fellow painter Paul Gauguin and sends it to a female courtesan for safekeeping

12-23.title: President Woodrow Wilson signs the Federal Reserve Act
12-23.description: On December 23, 1913, President Woodrow Wilson signs the Federal Reserve Act, establishing the modern central banking system of the United States to manage the money supply and promote financial stability

12-23.title: Government of Ireland Act / Home Rule Act passes
12-23.description: On December 23, 1920, Government of Ireland Act / Home Rule Act passes, partitioning Ireland

12-23.title: First successful human kidney transplant is performed
12-23.description: On December 23, 1954, First successful human kidney transplant is performed by Dr. Joseph E. Murray at Peter Bent Brigham Hospital in Boston, Massachusetts

12-23.title: Frank Borman, Jim Lovell, and William Anders become
12-23.description: On December 23, 1968, Frank Borman, Jim Lovell, and William Anders become the first people to orbit the Moon aboard Apollo 8

12-24.title: Compromise of the Nobles in Habsburg Netherlands
12-24.description: On December 24, 1565, Compromise of the Nobles in Habsburg Netherlands closes against the Inquisition

12-24.title: Treaty of Ghent 1814 Treaty of Ghent signed
12-24.description: On December 24, 1814, Treaty of Ghent 1814 Treaty of Ghent signed, ending the War of 1812 between the United States, the United Kingdom and their allies

12-24.title: Fire devastates US Library of Congress in Washington
12-24.description: On December 24, 1851, Fire devastates US Library of Congress in Washington and destroys 35,000 volumes

12-24.title: First radioactive isotope medicine is administered in
12-24.description: On December 24, 1936, First radioactive isotope medicine is administered in Berkeley, California

12-24.title: US President FDR appoints General Eisenhower as
12-24.description: On December 24, 1943, US President FDR appoints General Eisenhower as Supreme Commander of the Allied Forces

12-25.title: The first Christmas according to calendar-maker and
12-25.description: On December 25, 1, The first Christmas according to calendar-maker and Eastern Roman monk Dionysius Exiguus

12-25.title: Pope Leo III crowns Charles the Great ( Charlemagne )
12-25.description: On December 25, 800, Pope Leo III crowns Charles the Great ( Charlemagne ) Holy Roman Emperor

12-25.title: Norman Invasion of England 1066 William the Conqueror
12-25.description: On December 25, 1066, Norman Invasion of England 1066 William the Conqueror is crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey, completing the Norman Conquest of England

12-25.title: Astronomer Anders Celsius introduces the Celsius
12-25.description: On December 25, 1741, Astronomer Anders Celsius introduces the Celsius temperature scale, which now bears his name

12-25.title: Despite bitter opposition
12-25.description: On December 25, 1868, Despite bitter opposition, US President Andrew Johnson grants an unconditional pardon to all persons involved in the Southern rebellion (Civil War)

12-25.title: Mikhail Gorbachev formally resigns as President of the
12-25.description: On December 25, 1991, Mikhail Gorbachev formally resigns as President of the USSR in a televised speech

12-26.title: First Spanish settlement in the New World
12-26.description: On December 26, 1492, First Spanish settlement in the New World, La Navidad, is founded by stranded crew of Christopher Columbus at the site of modern Môle-Saint-Nicolas in Haiti after the Santa María runs aground and is wrecked

12-26.title: Trial of French King Louis XVI
12-26.description: On December 26, 1792, Trial of French King Louis XVI, court hears the king's defense presented by Raymond Desèze

12-26.title: Decembrist uprising in Russia against Tsar Nicholas I
12-26.description: On December 26, 1825, Decembrist uprising in Russia against Tsar Nicholas I begins [O.S. 14 December]

12-26.title: US General George S. Patton 's Third Army repulses
12-26.description: On December 26, 1944, Battle of Bastogne: US General George S. Patton 's Third Army repulses German forces

12-26.title: Boxing Day Tsunami 2004 A 9.3 magnitude earthquake
12-26.description: On December 26, 2004, Boxing Day Tsunami 2004 A 9.3 magnitude earthquake creates a tsunami that devastates Sri Lanka, India, Indonesia, Thailand, Malaysia, the Maldives, and other coastal regions of the Indian Ocean, killing about 230,000 people

12-27.title: Spanish Crown issues the Laws of Burgos
12-27.description: On December 27, 1512, Spanish Crown issues the Laws of Burgos, governing the conduct of settlers with regard to native Indians in the New World

12-27.title: Flushing Remonstrance 1657 Flushing Remonstrance
12-27.description: On December 27, 1657, Flushing Remonstrance 1657 Flushing Remonstrance petition is signed in the Dutch colony of New Netherland, protesting the ban on Quaker worship and asserting the right to religious freedom

12-27.title: Between 20,000 and 40,000 people die in a magnitude 8
12-27.description: On December 27, 1939, Between 20,000 and 40,000 people die in a magnitude 8 earthquake in Erzincan, Turkey

12-27.title: International Monetary Fund and International Bank for
12-27.description: On December 27, 1945, International Monetary Fund and International Bank for Reconstruction and Development are formally established with the signing of articles of agreement by member countries, ratifying Bretton Woods Conference findings based on ideas of economists Harry Dexter White and John Maynard Keynes [1]

12-27.title: Queen Juliana of the Netherlands formally recognizes
12-27.description: On December 27, 1949, Queen Juliana of the Netherlands formally recognizes the independence of Indonesia after four years of revolution and United Nations mediation

12-27.title: After invading Afghanistan two days earlier
12-27.description: On December 27, 1979, After invading Afghanistan two days earlier, Soviet forces carry out a coup in Kabul and kill President Hafizullah Amin, replacing him with Babrak Karmal

12-28.title: Westminster Abbey Consecrated 1065 A new church
12-28.description: On December 28, 1065, Westminster Abbey Consecrated 1065 A new church devoted to St Peter the Apostle is founded and consecrated by Edward the Confessor in London, later called Westminster Abbey. It is rebuilt in the Gothic style during the mid-13th century. [1]

12-28.title: First observation of Neptune - Galileo observes and
12-28.description: On December 28, 1612, First observation of Neptune - Galileo observes and records a "fixed star" without realizing it is a planet

12-28.title: King Taksin is crowned King of Siam and establishes
12-28.description: On December 28, 1767, King Taksin is crowned King of Siam and establishes Thonburi as his capital

12-28.title: Spain recognizes the independence of Mexico
12-28.description: On December 28, 1836, Spain recognizes the independence of Mexico

12-28.title: Harriet Tubman arrives in Auburn
12-28.description: On December 28, 1860, Harriet Tubman arrives in Auburn, New York, on her last mission to free slaves, having evaded capture for eight years on the Underground Railroad

12-28.title: Earthquake strikes Messina in Italy
12-28.description: On December 28, 1908, Earthquake strikes Messina in Italy, killing nearly 80,000 people and causing widespread destruction and a devastating tsunami in the Strait of Messina

12-28.title: Kalmyk inhabitants of the Republic of Kalmykia are
12-28.description: On December 28, 1943, Kalmyk inhabitants of the Republic of Kalmykia are deported by the Soviet Union to Central Asia and Siberia, with many dying en route

12-29.title: Trail of Tears 1835 Treaty of New Echota is signed
12-29.description: On December 29, 1835, Trail of Tears 1835 Treaty of New Echota is signed between the US government and representatives of a minority Cherokee political faction, ceding all Cherokee lands east of the Mississippi River to the United States

12-29.title: Texas is admitted as the 28th state of the United
12-29.description: On December 29, 1845, Texas is admitted as the 28th state of the United States

12-29.title: French Equatorial Africa separates into Gabon
12-29.description: On December 29, 1903, French Equatorial Africa separates into Gabon, Chad and Ubangi-Shari (Central African Republic)

12-29.title: Chinese revolutionary Sun Yat-sen is elected the first
12-29.description: On December 29, 1911, Chinese revolutionary Sun Yat-sen is elected the first President of the Republic of China

12-29.title: Hong Kong begins slaughtering all chickens to prevent
12-29.description: On December 29, 1997, Hong Kong begins slaughtering all chickens to prevent avian influenza (bird flu)

12-30.title: Battle of Wakefield: Duke of York is killed and his
12-30.description: On December 30, 1460, Battle of Wakefield: Duke of York is killed and his forces are soundly defeated by those of King Henry VI in northern England during the Wars of the Roses

12-30.title: All-India Muslim League is founded in Dacca in East
12-30.description: On December 30, 1906, All-India Muslim League is founded in Dacca in East Bengal, British India, later lays the foundations for Pakistan

12-30.title: Soviet Union Founded 1922 Creation of the USSR is
12-30.description: On December 30, 1922, Soviet Union Founded 1922 Creation of the USSR is formally proclaimed in Moscow at the Bolshoi Theatre, organized as a union (U) of the Russian, Ukrainian, Byelorussian and Transcaucasian Soviet Socialist Republics (SSR)

12-30.title: Astronomer Edwin Hubble formally announces the
12-30.description: On December 30, 1924, Astronomer Edwin Hubble formally announces the existence of other galaxies at a meeting of the American Astronomical Society

12-30.title: Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia become independent states
12-30.description: On December 30, 1950, Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia become independent states within the French Union

12-31.title: "The Great Invasion" sees a vast horde of Vandals
12-31.description: On December 31, 406, "The Great Invasion" sees a vast horde of Vandals, Alans, and Suebi cross the Rhine at Mainz, beginning the invasion of Gaul

12-31.title: Genroku earthquake off the coast of Japan near Edo
12-31.description: On December 31, 1703, Genroku earthquake off the coast of Japan near Edo (modern-day Tokyo) kills thousands and triggers a large tsunami that kills thousands more

12-31.title: English astronomer James Bradley announces the
12-31.description: On December 31, 1744, English astronomer James Bradley announces the discovery of Earth's nutation, or wobble

12-31.title: Battle of Quebec 1775 Battle of Quebec : American
12-31.description: On December 31, 1775, Battle of Quebec 1775 Battle of Quebec : American Continental Army led by Richard Montgomery is defeated trying to take the British stronghold of Quebec City in the American Revolutionary War, General Montgomery is killed and Benedict Arnold is wounded

12-31.title: A world record 22,990 mm of rain falls in a single
12-31.description: On December 31, 1861, A world record 22,990 mm of rain falls in a single year in Cherrapunji, Assam, India

12-31.title: Cuban dictator Fulgencio Batista informs his cabinet
12-31.description: On December 31, 1958, Cuban dictator Fulgencio Batista informs his cabinet that he is fleeing the country
